Title: Congress slams Centre for 'tour politics'
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

NEW DELHI: Congress on Thursday slammed the Modi government for leading a delegation of foreign envoys to Kashmir even as it was continuing to disallow opposition leaders permission to visit the region.

It accused the government of adopting double standards and leading "guided tours" to claim normalcy when three former chief ministers are under house arrest and one - Congress MP Ghulam Nabi Azad - was compelled to approach Supreme Court for permission to visit. "We demand that the government allow unfettered access to J&K to all politicians and not resort to guided tours for envoys," senior Congress MP Jairam Ramesh said.

He also demanded "positive political activity" in J&K, lacking in the past five months. "The PM and the home minister are only indulging in statements and counter-statements, claims and counter-claims. Congress wants that meaningful political activities should be initiated in J&K at the earliest. This political tourism of taking the ambassadors on guided tour of J&K should be stopped. This is our demand in the context of J&K," he said.

Title: India a top geopolitical risk for 2020: US consultancy
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

NEW DELHI: India is one of the world's top geopolitical risks for 2020, according to the Eurasia Group , one of US' most influential risk assessment companies.

In their most recent report, the Eurasia Group said PM Narendra Modi has spent "much of his second term promoting controversial social policies at the expense of an economic agenda .

The impacts will be felt in 2020, with intensified communal and sectarian instability, as well as foreign policy and economic setbacks."

For the first time, the group had the US and its broken domestic politics as the "top" global geopolitical risk of this year. "We face risks of a US election that many will view as illegitimate, uncertainty in its aftermath, and a foreign policy environment made less stable by the resulting vacuum. ... a broken impeachment mechanism, questions of electoral illegitimacy, and a series of court challenges will make this the most volatile year of politics the US has experienced in generations."

On India, the Group observes, the perception could grow that the Modi government's focus on its social agenda would have an economic spillover. "Modi has less room to manoeuvre on structural reforms, just as the economy is starting to sputter, with quarterly growth falling to a six-year low of 4.5% and forward-looking indicators looking softer still. ... A weakened economy will in turn feed further economic nationalism and protectionism, weighing on India's troubled course in 2020."

The top risks include the technological "decoupling" between the US and China and the challenges that it poses to the world besides the enduring US-China tensions, which, the Group says will lead to "more explicit clash over security, influence and values."

Countries and governments, the Group observed, will push back more and more against multinational corporations, with tougher nationalism-based regulatory frameworks. The EU, the group predicts, may increasingly push back against the unilateralism displayed by the US and China. Climate change will challenge companies and countries equally, creating conflicts between controlling emissions and bottomlines.

The Shia world, Eurasia Group predicts, may rise creating greater regional instability. Related, Turkey, it says, may be unravelling, which could be dangerous to others in the region. Latin American volatility and instability would be another source of risk.

Title: SC verdict today on Kashmir communication clampdown
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

A temporary landline phone booth in Srinagar. (TOI file photo)

NEW DELHI: On Friday, the Supreme Court will pronounce its verdict on petitions challenging the Centre's decision to shut communication networks, including internet, mobile and landline phone services, in Jammu & Kashmir after the state's special status under Article 370 was ended on August 5.

A bench of Justices NV Ramana, R Subhash Reddy and BR Gavai will give its decision on two petitions, one by Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad and the other by executive editor of Kashmir Times Anuradha Bhasin. The unanimous judgment has been authored by Justice Ramana.

Title: Kolkata: Cops seek legal opinion on bandh bus attack payout
Content:
Protesters attack a bus in Howrah on Wednesday.

Every such case should be pursued similarly. Political protests lose their meaning when they degenerate into vandalism. TiomesView

KOLKATA: The Hastings police have arrested a bandh supporter who allegedly threw stones at a government bus near Hastings crossing on Wednesday morning. The cops said they have slapped a stringent section of the Prevention of Damage to Property Act. However, what has made this case unique in Kolkata is that cops have sought legal opinion on whether the amended sections of the West Bengal Maintenance of Public Order (Amendment) Bill, 2017, can be used against the accused, which will compel him to pay for the damage.Police said the accused has been identified as Rajan Das, a 50-year-old resident of Hospital Lane in the Hastings area. “He claimed he was a CPM supporter and was only extending his support to the bandh. But we caught him red-handed and he was trying to flee. He managed to get bail on Thursday. However, our legal proceedings will continue against him,” said an officer.The FIR said the case was registered on the basis of a letter of complaint by Asish Dutta, 52, the driver of a government bus from Thakurpukur depot that plies on route S3A — between Thakurpukur and Sealdah. He alleged that around 10.30am on January 8, the accused threw a brick at the windshield when it reached Hastings crossing. A case under Section 3 of the PDPP Act and IPC Section 427 has been lodged against Das.In a bid to curb the tendency to destroy public and private properties during riots, unrest or violent political movements, the government had passed the West Bengal Maintenance of Public Order (Amendment) Bill, 2017, which stipulates that those who commit incidents of burning, looting and damage of properties will be liable for punishment and payment of compensation.The Jadavpur police have also lodged two FIRs against unknown persons for creating “mischief” on Wednesday. “We have certain footage from which we are trying to ascertain the identities of these people. These two cases, too, are fit for asking for damages,” said an officer. The Bhowanipore police, too, lodged an FIR against SUCI activists and 36 people were arrested.

Title: 16-year-old girl gang-raped in Buxar, one held
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

Title: Bihar govt targets Rs 1,000-crore of procurement through government e-marketplace
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Delhi deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi

PATNA: Deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi , who also holds the finance portfolio, on Thursday said government departments at district level would procure goods through government e-marketplace (GeM) portal from next financial year.

Modi, who was addressing a conference on GeM portal at Adhiveshan Bhavan here, said the target of procuring goods worth Rs 1,000 crore through the portal would be achieved in this financial year.

The deputy CM asked the finance department to ensure that at least Rs 300 crore purchase is made in the next three months. The state has so far purchased goods and availed services worth Rs 704.31 crore from GeM portal, thus standing fourth in the country in terms of using the portal. The finance minister also hailed formation of state gem portal account (SGPA). Any department can put money in this account before making purchases and if they fail to pay to the dealer within 15 days, the latter will automatically get the money from SGPA.

Modi suggested that a filtering process should be introduced in the GeM software for the vendors from Bihar . “Of the Rs 704 crore business done in this financial year through the portal, Rs 124 crore transactions were made by the dealers,” he said.

Praising this e-Marketplace, Modi said it’s more transparent and less tedious with no scope of commission. He said the departments which are not using GeM portal would be identified soon. So far, state urban development and housing department (UDHD) has done maximum purchase from GeM amounting to Rs 305 crore, followed by social welfare department Rs 137 crore, home department Rs 118 crore, health department Rs 26 crore, science and technology department Rs 24 crore and education department Rs 21 crore.

He said the Centre was also devising ways to make the portal available to private entities for bulk purchases.

On booming online business which is hampering retailers, Modi said the Centre is in the process of introducing measures to help retail as well as online businesses.

Title: 3 Muzaffarpur jail wardens axed for ‘dereliction of duty’
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

MUZAFFARPUR: Superintendent of Shahid Khudi Ram Bose Central Jail, Muzaffarpur, Rajiv Kumar Singh on Thursday suspended three jail employees, including the chief warden for dereliction of duty .

Two of the three suspended employees have been directed to join the Darbhanga divisional jail, while one has been asked to go to Samastipur divisional jail during their suspension period.

Singh said that all the three jail employees were earlier issued show-cause notices after recovery of some objectionable items during a raid carried out by Muzaffarpur district magistrate Alok Ranjan Ghosh and senior superintendent of police Jayant Kant on Sunday.

“The three jail employees were asked to submit their reply in 48 hours but they failed to comply with the order. Their responses, submitted even after stipulated time, were not found satisfactory. Hence they have been put under suspension with immediate effect from Thursday. I have also recommended senior officials at the prison headquarters in Patna for initiating departmental proceedings against them,” the superintendent said.

He added that the chief head warden of the prison, Ramesh Kumar Singh, was asked to report to the Samastipur division jail till his suspension period. “The head warden, Vidyapati Singh, and warden Droni Prakash have been sent to the Darbhanga jail till further decision on their suspension,” the superintendent said.

Notably, a joint raid was carried out in the central jail on Sunday after the killing of an undertrial prisoner Mukesh Kumar aka Mukesh Telia in Hajipur district jail on January 5. The raiding team recovered knives, cash, mobile phones, chargers, and narcotics from the wards.

Title: Gaya tilkut may get GI tag soon: Minister
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

GAYA: State agriculture minister Prem Kumar said on Thursday that a proposal to award the prestigious Geographical Indication (GI) tag to Gaya tilkut is under consideration of the Central government and a final decision in the regard will be taken soon. “Gaya tilkut fulfills all the criteria for awarding GI tag. A proposal in this regard is awaiting a nod from the Centre and we are expecting to get it soon,” the minister said.

Tilkut is manufactured by mixing sesame seeds, sugar or jaggery in the right proportion heated at an optimum temperature in cold, dry weather, skilfully hammered and then moulded into biscuit like shape. ‘Magahi paan’, another Gaya speciality has already got the GI tag, so has the ‘khaja’ of Silao and Shahi litchi. “Besides Gaya tilkut, the GI tag for makhana is also under consideration,” said the agriculture minister said.

GI tag certifies the quality of the product that possesses certain qualities, is made according to traditional methods and enjoys reputation due to its geographical origin. “The proposal for the GI tag to tilkut is pending at government level for more than two years now,” said Lalji Prasad, president of ‘Gaya Misthan (confectionery) Nirmata Sangh’.

Trade bodies said that the GI tag will provide the much-needed impetus to Gaya tilkut. “Tilkut business, on account of the prevailing market conditions including high input cost, pollution control, skill deficiency and a host of other reasons, has been facing problems for the last several years and as such tilkut makers pinned hope on the award of GI tag to get some impetus,” said Anup Kedia, former president of the Central Bihar Chamber of Commerce.

Meanwhile, Gaya Municipal Corporation has already imposed a ban on use of coal stoves, which have been traditionally been used for making tilkut. Bihar State Pollution Control Board has also cracked the whip to ensure total discard of coal stove. Tilkut makers of Gaya, according to market watchers have by and large switched to LPG and obtained commercial connections of eco-friendly fuel.

Nevertheless, market experts say that there is a big market available for tilkut in the Middle East and even Europe and America as the NRIs relate to tilkut as something native. According to Dr Rita Ambastha, an ayurveda practitioner, tilkut has medicinal value too and taken into a moderate quantity it ends problems like chronic constipation.

Title: Gold, cash worth Rs6.59 cr looted from gold loan company’s office in Vapi
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Caption

Surat: At least six armed robbers with their faces covered targeted the office of a gold finance company and escaped with Rs3 lakh cash and gold jewellery worth Rs6.56 crore at Chanod of Vapi in Valsad district on Thursday morning. Police have registered an offence of dacoity at Dungra police station and started investigation in the loot that created shock waves in south Gujarat. Police sources claim they have got specific leads about the suspects.

Police and officials of India Infoline Finance Limited (IIFL) were examining records to find out the exact value of the gold jewellery looted from the company’s office of gold loan at Chandralok Apartment on Vapi-Silvassa Road along with Rs3 lakh cash. The robbers had their faces covered with monkey caps and handkerchieves while targeting the office at around 10am. The robbers were carrying a gun and sharp-edged weapons. They pointed the weapons at the employees and tied seven of them and pasted adhesive tape on their mouths.

The robbers later forced the manager to enter password for opening the strongroom’s door and later the lock of the safe deposit vault inside it.

“Despite having high value gold jewellery and cash, the office did not have a security guard. The robbers threatened the manager to enter password to open the safe deposit vault. It is not easy to break the vault otherwise,” said a police officer.

The complaint was registered by Dipak Harshwal, 31, an employee of IIFL gold loan. Harshwal was hit on back of his ear and Dhiraj Shah, his colleague, on waist with the blunt side of a knife by a robber.

“Six robbers had entered the office. There is possibility of some more persons’ involvement in it. We have got some clues and are hopeful of cracking the case soon,” said a senior police officer.

Police suspect that the robbers had carried out a detailed recce of the spot before committing the crime for which they came in a car. However, police have not yet got any clue about the car which has disappeared.

A similar loot of Rs2 crore worth of gold jewellery was carried out in September 2017 in Chikhli of Navsari district from IIFL gold loan office.

Title: Centre plans to set up chemical park in Gujarat: Mandaviya
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Ankleshwar/Surat: Central government plans to set up a chemical park in Gujarat to give further boost to its industrial growth, Union minister of state (IC) for shipping and chemical & fertilizers Mansukh Mandaviya said on Thursday. Chemical and pharmaceutical companies make up the industrial base of Gujarat and we need to promote them, he said at the 10th Mega Industrial Exhibition organized by Ankleshwar Industries Association on Thursday.

The NDA government at the Centre headed by Prime Minister Narendra Modi is not only pro-farmer but industry friendly too. We can’t neglect businessmen because they are key contributors of wealth, which helps uplift the deprived sections of society, he said, defending demonetization and implementation of Goods and Services Tax. The minister also referred to improvement in ease of doing business, digital initiatives and “Make in India’ campaign of the government. Five years ago, mobiles were not being manufactured in India but now over 100 companies under 'Make in India' initiative are either manufacturing mobiles here or selling them worldwide with base in our country. This has created endless opportunities for local businessmen, Mandaviya added.

Title: About 4,196 hours of internet shutdown costs India $1.3 billion in 2019, finds study
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Chennai: Internet shutdowns in India are not just disruptions in routine and individual freedom, but are also having an economic impact on the country.

Around 4,196 hours of internet black-outs in India cost the economy close to $1.3 billion in 2019, finds a latest study by UK-based tech research firm Top10Vpn.

India was the third worst-hit economy worldwide after crisis-hit Iraq and Sudan thanks to state-imposed shut downs across Jammu and Kashmir, Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Rajasthan, UP and other regions, shows the report. An average of 8.4 million internet users were impacted across the mutliple incidents, it said.

The economic impact is likely to be higher, the study adds, given that the study only assessed large region-wide blackouts and India's smaller and more localised shut-downs weren't included. “There were more internet shutdowns in 2019 than ever before,” Samuel Woodhams and Simon Migliano, authors of the report by Top10Vpn told TOI in an email.

As for India, the frequency of disruptions still far surpasses any other country we analysed and, unless swift action is taken to reduce the number and duration of disruptions, the economic impact is likely to continue to rise, they added.

The vast majority of internet shutdowns in India in 2019 were highly localised and short-lived, but the costliest disruption occurred in Kashmir, where the shutdown remains ongoing. “The shutdown in Kashmir is one of the longest internet shutdowns to have ever occurred and cost the Indian economy nearly $1.1 billion in 2019,” Woodhams and Migliano said. It has hurt the economy, impacted local healthcare services, freedom of the press and education in the region.

The clampdown of internet services in the North East in relation to the Citizenship Amendment Act resulted in around $102 million of economic impact, and the restrictions in Uttar Pradesh led to a $63 million hit.

Besides 122 major shutdowns worldwide, the roughly 90 smaller blackouts in India takes 2019’s tally beyond previous year’s record total of 196 shutdowns, the report said, noting around 10% increase in disruptions globally from previous year. In terms of hours of disruption, Africa’s Chad and Myanmar are the only other countries ranking higher than India with 4,728 and 4,880 hours respectively, but with lesser economic impact. While industry estimates in 2016 put India’s shutdowns at 22 instances at a cost of around $986 million, the cost of 13 incidents in 2019 exceeded $1.3 billion, so we can surmise that the impact is becoming more pronounced over time, the researchers said.

The study arrived at the economic cost based on Netblocks’ and The Internet Society’s cost of shutdown tool, which relies on data from The World Bank, International Telecommunication Union and Eurostat, among others.

Title: Eye bank at NMCH to be functional in Mar
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

PATNA: A new eye bank is likely to become functional at the Nalanda Medical College and Hospital (NMCH) in March. A separate building has been constructed for the purpose and most of the equipment have been purchased.

NMCH superintendent Dr Gopal Krishna told this newspaper on Thursday that the eye bank would prove to be a boon for a large number of patients suffering from vision problems.

“Soon after the eye bank becomes operational, we will start a counselling session to make people aware of eye donation and transplant. We will then prepare lists of eye donors as well as people seeking transplant and act accordingly,” he added.

Approximately 150 patients reportedly visit the outpatient clinic of the eye department at the NMCH every day and many of them enquire about transplants.

Eye department head, Dr Rajesh Tiwari, claimed that the eye bank would make cornea transplant possible now.

“Teams with well-equipped ambulances will work round the clock to collect the eyes of dead people after seeking their families’ permission. They will also visit primary health centres and other nursing homes for the purpose,” Tiwari said.

He added, “There is a misconception that taking out the cornea surgically can lead to disfigurement of the body.”

Title: PMCH bid to boost Ayushman Bharat Yojna scheme
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Repesentative image

(By: V K Tripathi)

PATNA: Patna Medical College and Hospital ( PMCH ) has initiated measures to make free health cover available to more poor patients under the Ayushman Bharat Yojna (ABY), an ambitious scheme of the central government.

Though launched on September 25, 2018, only a sizeable number of patients could benefit under the scheme at PMCH. After a series of meetings with doctors, nurses and health department officials in the last three days, the hospital administration on Thursday asked all the departments to register poor patients in their outpatient departments (OPDs) and initiate treatment.

PMCH superintendent Dr Bimal Karak said though only about 900 patients were registered under ABY in the last 15 months, the new arrangements would now increase the number of beneficiaries.

“There were only two Ayushman Mitras (AMs) in PMCH. However, all the 14 health managers getting additional responsibility, the number of AMs has now gone up to 16,” Dr Karak added.

PMCH principal Dr V P Choudhary said every patient registered under ABY is entitled to get treatment, including clinical investigation, surgery and medicine.

“Four separate counters have been set up near the central emergency, general OPD covering several departments for registration under ABY,” said the principal, adding treatment facilities under the ABY are available in all the departments, such as medicine, surgery, eye, ENT, neurology, gynaecology, paediatrics, cancer and plastic surgery.

“After the verification of entitlement of the beneficiaries at the entry point, that is OPD, the AMs will take up the job and line up further treatment,” Dr Choudhary said, adding that the nursing staff have also been briefed about the scheme.

Title: Ejaz Yusuf Lakdawala arrest puts ‘terror transit’ spotlight on Bihar
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Ejaz Yusuf Lakdawala

PATNA: The arrest of fugitive gangster Ejaz Yusuf Lakdawala, a Dawood Ibrahim aide, from Patna on Wednesday has once again put the spotlight on the state, which has seen the arrest of several terror operatives in the past.

ADG (law and order) Amit Kumar admitted that some operatives of terror outfits such as Indian Mujahideen (IM) and Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen (J-u-M) have been arrested from Bihar in the past, but denied that the state has become a safe transit hub for terrorists.

“It’s a wrong notion that Bihar is a transit route for terrorists or ganglords from Nepal. We are alert and have taken all precautionary measures on this front,” Kumar said, adding, the state has never been used as shelter by them.

Kumar, who is also officiating as ADG (headquarters), however, admitted that some

The last such case in the state was that of the arrest of Ejaz Ahmad alias Amir, said to be associated with Jamaat-ul-Mujahiden of Bangladesh, who was arrested from Gaya’s Patwa Toli by the Kolkata police STF on August 26, 2019. Ahmad, a resident of West Bengal’s Birbhum district, was living in Gaya with his wife and three children in a rented accommodation under a fake name.

According to the documents available with the Buniyadganj police station in Gaya district, Ejaz was one of the key accused in the October 2014 blast in Khagragarh in West Bengal’s Burdwan district. Police sources said Ahmad was in touch with JMB leaders—Kausar and Salauddin Salahein. “His name had also figured in the low intensity bomb blast at Bodh Gaya in January 2018,” a senior intelligence officer said.

On March 25, 2019, two members of JMB—Khairul Mandal and Abu Sultan, stated to be from Bangladesh, were nabbed near Patna junction. Some incriminating documents, posters and banners of Islamic State (IS) were seized from the accused. Their accomplice Sharaiat Mandal was earlier arrested from Pune.

Police had seized three mobile phones, a memory card, two fake voter IDs, a fake PAN card, railway tickets from Gaya to Patna and New Delhi to Howrah and also a bus ticket from Kolkata to Gaya. The two later revealed that they had entered the country illegally and were tasked by the JMB to lure Muslim youths into the terror outfit.

In August 2013, co-founder of terror outfit Indian Mujahideen (IM) Yasin Bhatkal was arrested by the NIA from Raxaul near India-Nepal border, in East Champaran district. The NIA, which had unearthed the ‘ Darbhanga and Ranchi modules’ of IM, found the involvement of some of its members in both Bodh Gaya and Patna serial bomb explosions in July and October in 2013.

The IM’s Ranchi module was blamed for the October 27, 2013 Patna serial blasts at BJP’s Hunkar Rally, addressed by then PM candidate Narendra Modi, which had left six persons dead and over 90 injured at Gandhi Maidan. Two Buddhist monks were injured in the Bodh Gaya blasts on July 7, 2013. At least nine live bombs were also seized from various locations in Bodh Gaya.

At least half-a-dozen other IM operatives, including Md Asadullah Akhtar alias Haddi, were also nabbed from the border districts of Bihar. “Be it LeT, IM, SIMI or JMB, the state has turned out a safe haven for their operatives in Indian territory,” said a DIG rank officer, who had earlier been associated with a central intelligence agency.

Title: Khuda Bakhsh library to conduct language courses
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

PATNA: Khuda Bakhsh Oriental Public Library (KBOPL) has introduced various language courses for a week’s duration. It has already started with Bangla language course from January 4. Other languages in the list include Marathi, Arabic, Sanskrit, Persian, Urdu, Sindhi, Punjabi and Odia.

These courses will be taught by the experts for a week. Those who pass the examination after completing the course will be given certificates.

Library director Shayesta Bedar said the motive behind introducing such language courses was to promote the culture and also help people in understanding and reading the books available in the library. “One can understand any culture by reading books on the subject. We also realized that the number of people having command over many languages was falling. Hence, this course will be of great help,” she said.

Each language will be taught for a week, after which candidates have to take the examination in order to get the certificate. The library is not charging any fee for that. Library officials further said the languages will be taught in the evening after 5pm for an hour so that even students could attend the classes. There is no test for getting enrolled in the language courses.

“As of now, we have started with Bangla language course. Once it gets over, we will start any other language. We are also exploring the possibility of other languages to be taught here,” said Shayesta.

The library, which is over 128 years’ old, is famous for its rare and precious collections. It has about 21,000 oriental manuscripts and over 2.5 lakh printed books, which include works of Rumi and Firdausi. This library also has four such manuscripts which have been selected by the National Mission of Manuscripts among the Manuscripts Treasure of India. Those manuscripts include Kitab al-Hashaish, Kitab al-Tasrif, Divan-e-Hafiz and Tehreek-e-Khandan-e-Timuriyah.

Title: Nine flights delayed due to poor visibility
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

PATNA: Flight operations at Jayaprakash Narayan International (JPNI) Airport here were partially affected due to poor visibility on Thursday. Altogether nine flights were delayed due to the inclement weather.

Three flights of IndiGo (two Kolkata-bound and one Delhi-bound), four of SpiceJet (one each to Mumbai, Delhi, Chennai and Ahmedabad) and one each of Air India (Delhi) and GoAir (Bengaluru) were delayed.

Santosh Kumar, assistant general manager (air traffic management) at Patna airport, however, said the flights suffered minor delays.

He added, “The minimum visibility of 1,000m for landing of flights was reached before 9am. The first flight of SpiceJet arrived at Patna airport on its scheduled time at 9am and departed without any delay.”

According to weather scientist at Patna Meteorological Office, the device that measures the runway visual range (RVR) broke down in the morning. “The visibility was measured in the morning through conventional method. The weathermen used eye estimates for assessment of visibility condition at the airport, which does not give accurate information,” he added.

Of 40 flights operating from Patna airport, nine were delayed by 45 minutes to two-and-a-half hours, airline sources said.

Meanwhile, two-Delhi bound flights of GoAir were cancelled on Thursday due to operational reasons. A GoAir executive at Patna airport said flight numbers G8-231/ 132 and G8 2512 will remain cancelled till January 10.

Title: Muzaffarpur SSP sets up three teams to probe double murder case
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

MUZAFFARPUR: Muzaffarpur senior superintendent of police Jayant Kant has set up three investigating teams to probe the murder of a 65-year-old retired senior excise official Ajay Kumar Sharma and his wife Renu.

The duo were found bludgeoned to death in their house at Gyan Lok Colony in Muzaffarpur town on Wednesday afternoon. Sharma had retired as assistant inspector general from the state prohibition and excise department five years ago.

“The teams will be headed by SP (city) PK Mandal, DSP (city) R N Paswan and DSP (west) Krishna Murari Prasad. They will probe the matter from different angles. Even the forensic science laboratory and electronic surveillance cell have been asked to cooperate in getting every detail needed by the investigating teams,” the SSP said.

He added: “We are still waiting for the family members of Sharma to lodge a formal police complaint. This will help us to focus on our line of action. Though some valuables have been stolen from the house, the way the crime was committed tells a different story other than loot or dacoity,” he said.

Meanwhile, a senior police officer and a member of the investigating team told this newspaper on condition of anonymity that some burnt papers have been found from the main entrance of the house. “It shows that they were killed for those papers, considered to be important for the miscreants. Even some circumstantial evidences also hint at some insider,” he said.

Brahmapura police station SHO Bishwanath Ram said, “The postmortem report of Sharma couple suggests that they were killed nearly 14 to 24 hours before from the time of autopsy.”

It may be mentioned here that the SP (city) along with DSP R N Paswan and SHO of Brahmapura police station had reached the spot around 1.30 pm after being informed by the Ajay’s elder brother Saroj Kumar Sharma, who is a lawyer at the local civil court.

Title: DRM inspects rly hosp at Khagaul
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

PATNA: Danapur divisional railway manager (DRM) Sunil Kumar made a surprise inspection of the railway hospital at Khagaul on Wednesday and interacted with the patients. He directed chief medical superintendent (CMS) Dr R K Verma to provide better medical facilities to the railway employees and their dependants.

Talking to this newspaper on Thursday, Kumar said he had asked the CMS to take patients’ feedback so that there is transparency in the functioning of the hospital. “I also told him to ensure that all wards of the hospital are kept clean and there is a separate reception counter to help visitors, who want to consult doctors for treatment,” he added.

The DRM claimed that the railways would provide better health care facilities to all patients in the hospital. He said, “I held a prolonged discussion with the CMS and other doctors to get first-hand information about the problems facing the hospital.”

At present, the railway hospital at Khagaul, which is one of the oldest ones, caters to the needs of approximately 14,000 employees and 6,000 pensioners of the Danapur division. It is also fulfilling the medical needs of around 50,000 other patients, including the dependants of railway staff.

Sources pointed out that the capacity of the hospital was reduced to 152 beds from 202, after 50 beds were shifted to the superspecialty hospital at Karbigahiya in Patna. “The hospital has only one ambulance and the pathology department, where about 6,000 routine tests are conducted every month, needs advanced equipment,” a doctor told this reporter and added the hospital had an annual budget of Rs 95 lakh.

Retired railway employees claimed that most of them were unable to visit the railway superspecialty hospital in Patna for treatment or regular check-ups because of old age. Hence, they urged the DRM to provide all facilities at the Danapur railway hospital.

Despite repeated attempts, the CMS could not be contacted for his comments.

Title: Colleague plotted loot of cash mgmt firm staffer
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Rajkot: Had Ala Rathod , the staffer of cash management company , known about the hooter installed in his bag , he could have saved himself from the robbers.

Rathod was robbed of Rs 11.19 lakh cash near Satya Colony in Jamangar on Thusday, but the police nabbed five accused, including the victim's colleague Bhavin Hedav. Investigation revealed that Hedav had plotted the loot as he was under heavy debt.

The looted bag was traced in the bushes near Kansumara village near Jamangar from the GPS system attached to it.

“There was also a hooter in the bag, but Rathod was unaware. Had he pressed the hooter, a siren would have blared, attracting the attention of the people and cops,” said Sharad Singhal, Jamnagar superintendent of police.

Hedav, who worked in the same company, was fully aware of Rathod's schedule and the amount of cash he could be carrying. Along with Hedav, police arrested his brother-in-law Chirag Pandya (27), Irfan Sandhi (29), Shabbir Sandhi (30) and Faruq Shedha (28). Another accused Anees Khalifa is still on the run.

K K Gohil, inspector with Jamnagar local crime branch, added, “Shabbir, Faruq and Khalifa overtook Rathod on their bike and waylaid him. They flashed a knife and snatched his bag."

Hedav hatched the loot conspiracy along with Pandya who roped in others.

CAUGHT CONDUCTING RECCEE

Rajkot: The accused were traced on the basis of CCTV footage of the day before the crime when they visited the spot. The CCTV footage on the day of the crime showed that the accused had covered their faces. However, a day before the crime, the accused were caught on the CCTV footage while carrying out a recce. After the crime, the accused gathered at Shabbir’s house in Theba village of Jamnagar taluka and celebrated his birthday.

“We have asked all the financial firms to train their staff to use bags fitted with GPS system and hooters,” added Singhal.

.

Title: Sarthana extortion case accused cops shunted out of city
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Surat: Four accused cops facing investigation in the Sarthana police extortion case have been shunted out of the city. The DGP issued the transfer order on January 2, 2020 following their alleged attempts to hamper the ongoing investigation.

Of the four cops who are currently under suspension, three have been transferred to Dahod district while one has been transferred to Ahmedabad.

N D Chaudhary, police inspector, has been transferred to Ahmedabad city while H M Gohil, police sub inspector, G D Mudhva, and B R Bhadiyadra, both police constables, were transferred to Dahod district.

The accused cops were booked in Sarthana police station on April 5, 2019. They were booked for extortion and other charges under sections of Indian Penal Code. They are under suspension since then however, their posting was in the city.

After the offence was registered against the four cops the case was transferred to the anti-corruption bureau (ACB). Chaudhary had also approached the Supreme Court seeking anticipatory bail but it was rejected and the court asked him to surrender after which all four accused were arrested in July 2019.

“It has come to notice of the investigation officer that the accused have tried to indirectly interfere in investigation. Hence ACB wrote a letter to the DGP office about the attempt and requested transfer of these cops out of Surat,” ACB stated in a press release.

Earlier in March, Suresh and Jayesh Jivani, residents of Varachha, approached the Sarthana police station informing about a racket of changing chassis number of buses that is being run by Irshad Pathan, who owns a garage at Valak village.

Pathan had purchased a bus from a finance company which was earlier owned by the Jivani duo. The bus had been seized following non-payment of loan.

Following information by the Jivanis, Sarthana police detained Pathan and also seized the bus of which the chassis number was changed. Pathan was later freed without registering any offence after which Jivani approached senior police officials.

An inquiry was instituted against the four cops who were posted in Sarthana police station which revealed that they allegedly took Rs 30.5 lakh from Pathan for not registering an offence against him.

Later city police registered two FIRs related to the case in Sarthana police station. In the first offence Pathan, 39, was booked on March 31 for alleged forgery, cheating and tempering with evidences. In the second FIR the four cops were booked. Both the cases were later transferred to the ACB for further investigation following state government’s order since it involved corruption charges.

Title: Four tents catch fire at Rann Utsav, NRI families’ luggage gutted
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Fire may have been caused by short-circuit, no casualties

Rajkot: A major fire broke out in the tent city at Rann Utsav, the state government’s annual desert festival , in Dhordo village near Bhuj on Thursday morning. Two fire tenders deployed at the tent city, doused the fire. No casualty was reported in the incident. However, probe has been ordered.

The fire was suspected to have been caused by a short-circuit. There were three NRI families from the US who had come to participate in the festival from Ahmedabad.

“When the NRI families went to the dining hall to have their breakfast, the fire broke out in one of their tents. The fire spread to the other tents quickly, and soon four tents were reduced to ashes, gutting the belongings of NRI families,” said Anil Gupta, manager of the tent city.

“There are 400 tents in the tent city. Luckily, when the fire broke out, the NRI families were out of their tents and they had their passports with them. There are two firefighters deployed at the tent city, who doused the fire and prevented it from spreading to other tents. Inquiry has also been ordered on to ascertain the exact cause of the fire,” said an official from Khavda police station.

Tourists from across the world come to stay at the Tent City, having around 400 tents, during the 'Rann Utsav.

“The fire completely destroyed four tents. No one from the management made any efforts to douse the fire. We lost all our clothes, valuables, credit cards, driving licenses and two passports,” a member from the NRI family said

Title: RCCI urges for transparency in plot allocation at Khirasara GIDC
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Rajkot: Rajkot Chamber of Commerce and Industry (RCCI) had demanded transparency in plot allocation process for the newly announced Khirasara industrial estates near Rajkot. The state government had announced allocation of plots at Khirasara GIDC on January 18 through draw system in the presence of chief minister Vijay Rupani.

According to sources, there are 471 plots spread across 92 hectare land in the GIDC estate for which the government has received 9,000 applications. The office bearers of RCCI met with Rupani in Gandhinagar and urged him maintain transparency in the allotment process.

RCCI vice president Parth Ganatra said, “The draw should be down in presence of trade and industry bodies to avoid any disputes in the future.”

The RCCI also demanded extension of Ahmedabad-Chennai Humsafar Express to Rajkot and speeding up of the railway track doubling work between Rajkot and Surendrangar. They urged CM to get the work completed by March 2021.

Title: Duo came on foot, fired at cop, ran inside mosque, walked out
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Kaliyakkavilai: The two young men were not masked and wore skull caps used by Muslims while offering prayers. They had a close look at the place before firing at special sub inspector (SSI) Y Wilson, 57, who was on duty at the small check post on Market Road at Kaliyakkavilai on the inter-state border. The duo escaped through the gates of the Muslim Jama-ath and made their way to Kerala after committing the crime late on Wednesday.

These details as well as the identity of the accused became known from the CCTV footage recorded in the mosque that connects the check post to the main check post on the highway through the mosque premises. “We know Wilson very well. He used to be a silent man and frequented the mosque often when he is on duty. We are shocked,” Mohammed Siyad, 47, the general secretary of the mosque, told TOI. The incident took place around 9.35 pm when the two accused, now identified as Thoufique and Abdul Shamim, came on foot from the Kaliyakkavilai market, crossed the check post where Wilson was alone and went to the back gate of the mosque less than 20 metres away. After waiting there for a minute, they walked to the check post and fired three to four rounds at Wilson. As he fell down unconscious, the duo ran back to the gate and walked out of the mosque through its front gate onto the Nagercoil - Thiruvananthapuram national highway. This was recorded on three CCTV cameras in the mosque and four more in a hospital, weigh bridge and two shops where the duo is seen walking past the inter-state border into Thiruvananthapuram. IG south zone K P Shanmuga Rajeswaran said there were also stab injuries on the body the nature of which can be confirmed only after obtaining the post mortem report.

“They casually walked for about 400 metres and left in an unsuspected manner before people on the other side of the mosque recovered from the unexpected turn of events. One of the CCTV cameras also shows one of the accused asking for a lift from a vehicle,” Mohammed Siyad said. Meanwhile, Wilson lay in a pool of blood with three bullet injuries near the back gate of the mosque. Locals said that it was two children aged about 10 to 12 years playing on the road who first witnessed the events. Two college-goers rushed in on hearing the gun shots and took Wilson to the hospital in an autorickshaw, where he was declared dead.

Both gates of the mosque are about 20 to 50 metres from the Kerala border. It existed as a shed many decades ago and as a tiled-roof structure before it got its current form in 1965. A total of 16 CCTV cameras were installed in the mosque three years ago but this is the first time they have been of some use. The mosque committee said the gates are open till midnight for traders and highway users to offer prayers. Police said that they initially suspected that the accused could have escaped in an SUV as one such vehicle was speeding past the place close to the time the incident took place.

Title: Sensex shoots up 635 points on easing US-Iran tensions
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

TNN

Mumbai: Markets across the world rallied on Thursday as there were signs of some easing of tension between the US and Iran , which also led to softening of crude oil and gold prices . As a result, the sensex rallied 635 points, or 1.6% to close at 41,452, while the Nifty gained 191 points, also 1.6%, to close at 12,216. The rupee strengthened by 49 paise to close at 71.22 per dollar, from 71.71 on Wednesday. The rising rupee, however, led to some selling in the stocks of software exporters.

Motilal Oswal Financial Services head (retail research) Siddhartha Khemka said market sentiments have revived as oil prices cooled down due to no further escalations in the Middle East. “The US has offered to impose sanctions on Iran instead of military action, which eased off the tensions. On the domestic front, the government has eased laws to fast-track mining at sites and also imposed import duty on copper wire rods,” he wrote in a note.

Going forward, however, corporate earnings will be in focus, which could be another quarter of muted growth. On Friday, Infosys is set to kick off the results season. The upcoming Budget on February 1 will also decide the market’s course. “We expect the Q3 to be another quarter of muted earnings, largely led by BFSI, auto and consumer companies,” Khemka said. “Investors would also be watching out for pre-Budget developments, which would influence the market.”

But from a technical perspective, the rally looks to be on a weak foundation. According to Kotak Securities senior VP (equity technical research) Shrikant Chouhan, the markets are into overbought zones, hence fresh long positions should be avoided at current levels.

The day’s rally was led by banking & financial services and select heavyweights. BSE data showed that ICICI Bank, Reliance Industries, HDFC and HDFC Bank were the top contributors to the index’s rise, while lower closing in TCS and HCL Tech limited the rise.

Interestingly, end of the session data showed that foreign funds were net sellers on Thursday with a net outflow figure of Rs 431 crore, while domestic funds were net buyers at Rs 419 crore.

Title: KMDA floats traffic tender for Bypass Metro crossing
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Kolkata: The Kolkata Metropolitan Development Authority (KMDA) has finally floated tenders to engage an agency to come up with a complete traffic dispersal plan at Avishikta crossing on EM Bypass for facilitating the completion of the Metro station there. The chief objective of the exercise is to ascertain possible dispersal of vehicles from Bypass and Prince Anwar Shah Road Connector while the station gets connected with the Metro viaduct.

KMDA has not ruled out the possibility of opening up lanes for office-time traffic and removing shops and an auto stand stand for this purpose. The plan will also create space for passengers to smoothly board and alight from public transport.

The authorities have fixed an estimate of Rs 34 lakh to execute the project and the agency that will take up the job will need to come up with the plan within 30 days from the date of starting work. Discussions were earlier held with the Kolkata traffic police, which came up with a rough proposal.

“The agency will help us ensure there is minimum jam at the busy crossing. Since traffic snarls have been a regular feature here ever since the construction began, we need to plan ahead before allowing RVNL to get their desired blocks.

A committee has been formed comprising representatives from KMDA, KMC, traffic police and other stakeholders to figure out how traffic can be managed in a systematic manner around the new Metro stations that are coming up. “The idea is to follow the Delhi model. Pedestrians will have to use the special channels so that traffic is not disrupted,” said an officer.

Sreeparna Roy, an IT executive from Survey Park, said that while the signal at the Bypass-Avishikta crossing might turn red, there was always the risk of vehicles coming from Garia and taking the open left turn. Similarly, when vehicles take the right turn from the Ruby side towards Ajoynagar, the left turn from Avishikta towards Ruby is kept open, making crossing the stretch a difficult exercise.

Title: In a first, RBI allows KYC process on mobile video
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

MUMBAI: In a move that will enable banks and fintechs onboard customers remotely, the Reserve Bank of India ( RBI ) has amended its norms to allow the ‘ know your customer ’ (KYC) process to be completed through a mobile video conversation. The central bank has also facilitated eKYC and digital KYC by allowing use of Aadhaar or other e-documents in the customer due diligence process.

This makes India one of the rare markets to allow video KYC through an amendment to the RBI rules after the government amended the Prevention of Money Laundering (Maintenance of Records) Rules, 2005. “I think this is a world first where the regulator has allowed video KYC. Banks can onboard customers by doing a video KYC through the app and acquiring Aadhaar and PAN. Non-banks, although they don’t have access to eKYC, can complete the process by using the physical Aadhaar or the QR code,” said Naveen Surya, chairman of Fintech Convergence Council, which has been pushing for this.

After eKYC using Aadhaar was discontinued following a Supreme Court decision, mobile wallets found it difficult to onboard new customers. In a circular issued on Thursday, the RBI said, “Digital KYC has been defined as capturing live photo of the customer and officially valid document or the proof of possession of Aadhaar, where offline verification cannot be carried out, along with the latitude and longitude of the location where such live photo is being taken by an authorised officer of the reporting entity (RE).”

Reacting to the circular, NITI Aayog chief Amitabh Kant said in a tweet, “Great initiative by RBI! Circular on video based customer identification process will make presence-less and paperless banking a reality. The circular is a huge positive step towards Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s goal of Digital Financial Inclusion.”

Once the Aadhaar has been used, the regulated entity must either edit out or blackout the Aadhaar number. The e-document has been defined as an electronic equivalent of an officially valid document with its valid digital signature, including documents issued to the digital locker account of the customer.

The central bank has said that the KYC process cannot be outsourced to any third-party service provider and the audio-visual interaction must be triggered from the domain of the regulated entity itself. Also, the video customer identification has to be done by officials trained for this purpose and the video recordings preserved.

“Regulated entities are encouraged to take assistance of the latest available technology, including artificial intelligence (AI) and face-matching technologies to ensure the integrity of the process as well as the information furnished by the customer. However, the responsibility of customer identification shall rest with the RE,” the RBI said.

Title: Nitish Kumar launches projects worth Rs 584 crore in Bhagalpur
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Nitish Kumar

BHAGALPUR: Chief minister Nitish Kumar inaugurated 50 schemes worth Rs 430.33 crore and also laid foundation stones for 136 schemes worth Rs 153.62 crore at Chada-Badgaon under Bhulni panchayat in Bhagalpur district under the seventh phase of his Jal Jivan Hariyali (JJH) Yatra on Thursday.

Earlier in the day, Nitish unveiled Chandan irrigation project worth around Rs 57 crore in Chandan block of Banka district. He asked water resources department and district administration officials to remove silt from Chandan dam to ensure proper storage of water for irrigation purposes.

From Banka, the CM left for Bhagalpur where he inaugurated the renovated Durga Pokhar (pond), intensive sapling plantation and beautification work at Bhulni panchayat.

He also chaired a divisional level meeting for Bhagalpur and Banka districts to review ongoing projects related to JJH and other local issues. Sources said issues related to Bhagalpur, including Bholanath flyover, a bridge proposed to be constructed parallel to Vikramshila Setu , frequent traffic snarls, Aguani ghat bridge and others were discussed by the elected representatives and representatives of other local bodies during the meeting.

Addressing a public meeting later, Nitish deliberated on the importance of safe drinking water, clean air and green vegetation (sapling plantation) for healthy life. “All kinds of pollution are hazardous for humanity. We have endeavoured to restore the groundwater levels by renovating the ponds and rivers in the state. Besides, intensive sapling plantation work is being done for increasing the state’s forest cover in order to check the greenhouse effect due to the pollutants,” he said.

Referring to the seven resolves of the state government, Nitish said his government was committed to making positive changes in the lives of people.

“Liquor prohibition in the state has reduced cases of domestic violence and crime as well,” the CM said. He also spoke on Jeevika initiative as well as steps taken by the government to make villages open defecation free and check stubble burning .

The CM urged the people to join human chain being organized by the state government on January 19 to spread awareness on JJH, liquor prohibition and eradication of social evils like child marriage and dowry.

Nitish was accompanied by JD(U) Rajya Sabha MP Kahkashan Parveen, Lok Sabha MP Ajay Mandal, state building construction minister Ashok Choudhary, several other elected representatives and senior officials.

Title: Telangana saw 153% increase in corruption cases in 2018
Content:
Representative image

HYDERABAD: As per the National Crime Records Bureau ’s ( NCRB ) latest data, corruption cases in Telangana increased by 153% between 2017 and 2018.As per the NCRCB data, the number of cases booked under the Prevention of Corruption (PC) Act and related sections of the IPC in Telangana in 2017 were 55. However, in 2018, there was a 153% increase with the ACB registering 139 cases.“The increase in number of cases was due to the effective use of technology by our team. Due to good use of audio and video evidence gathering technology, the success rate in laying traps has increased,” ACB Director General, Telangana, J Purnachandra Rao said.A big catch for the bureau in 2018 was HMDA director K Purushotham Reddy. ACB sleuths booked a disproportionate assets case against Reddy on January 20, 2018 and unearthed over Rs 25 crore worth disproportionate assets. While the bureau launched a manhunt to arrest Reddy, he surrendered before the ACB court over a month later on February 16.In relation to Reddy’s case, a DSP, an inspector and a constable of ACB were suspended and another inspector was repatriated to his parent department for misconduct.Another significant achievement of ACB in 2018 was the arrest of judges in corruption cases. In 2018, ACB has arrested four judges in corruption cases.As per the data provided by the ACB, the performance of the agency improved in 2019 with a total of 173 cases.

Title: How 24 schoolkids were saved from LPG cylinder blasts in Surat
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Children – all aged between 10-12 years – were safely taken out of the bus in the nick of time as LPG cylinder... Read More

SURAT: Twenty four schoolchildren had a miraculous escape after their bus collided with truck at a stone’s throw away from a tanker carrying LPG bottles that had gone up in flames on Surat-Olpad road on Thursday.

The bus of Radiant International School located on Ugat-Jahangirpura Canal Road was on way to Surat from Olpad taking the children to school. In the meantime, a tanker of Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) loaded with nearly 300 LPG bottles caught fire at around 7:15am. As a result of the fire and thick plumes of smoke, one side of the state highway was closed for vehicles. A truck driver, who had to take a wrong side because of the blockage, failed to see the school bus approaching and both vehicles collided head on close to the tanker.

The children - all aged between 10-12 years- were safely taken out of the bus just in the nick of time as LPG cylinders from the near-by tanker started exploding one after another.

While the truck driver fled from the spot, the bus driver suffered minor injuries. However, all three vehicles were charred as the flames from the tanker spread rapidly. The accident happened near Masma village, some 20 km from Surat city.

The fire in tanker is suspected to have been triggered due to sparks in the battery devise of the vehicle. It spread rapidly and engulfed the whole tanker. Panic gripped the area as the cylinders started exploding one after another.

An eyewitness said that thick plumes of black smoke were visible from long distance and constant explosions of LPG cylinders created a major scare on the highway and near-by areas.

“The explosions were so loud that it looked as if someone had hurled grenades,” said a fire brigade officer who had rused with the team from Mora Bhagal station.

Four fire fighting vehicles from Mora Bhagal, Palanpur and Adajan fire stations of Surat were rushed to the spot. Nearly 30,000 litres of water was used to cool the vehicles and the cylinders.

Basant Pareek, chief fire officer, Surat Municipal Corporation, said, “It was nothing short of a miracle that major tragedy was averted. All the schoolchildren were moved to safety in the nick of time and there were no injuries to anyone. The initial fire started due to sparks in tanker’s battery and spread very quickly. The tanker driver had also fled.”

It took nearly two hours to clear the spot and ensure normal traffic flow.

Title: Teaching innovations at click of an app now
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

RAJKOT: If hanging library in Nigala village worked wonders for 190-odd students there, such innovations stayed confined to the realms of the hamlet only. At best, such measures by enterprising teachers may get documented in District Education Training Centre’s (DIET) annual publication, but these too remain within the district only.

But thanks to the efforts of teachers like Jafrabad-based Sanjay Parghi, this ignorance about rural innovators could be erased to a great extent. This English teacher in Rohisa school of Jafrabad taluka provided these innovative teachers at the village levels a much wider platform — through his android-based mobile application. Parghi has documented nearly 300 such innovations done in the last five years in Amreli district alone.

The app was launched on January 2 and has already had 500 downloads in the past one week. This digital platform showcases experiments on tough subjects like mathematics and science were not only made easy for the rural students but also enthused them to go to schools regularly.

“I want to make these innovations available to all the rural primary teachers of the state who are facing similar problems. I have given innovative teachers the username and passwords who themselves now add to their work and also reply queries posed by other interested teachers,” said Parghi

District innovation co-ordinator of Amreli, Bharat Der said, “We now plan to include videos and pictures of the teachers with their innovation in the text description.”

Another innovative teacher in Liliya taluka’s Saldi village, Chandrika Kanani, uses the sports page of an English daily to teach English to her students after noticing their interest in sporting activities. Yet another teacher in Chittal school created mathematics puzzles to make the subject easy, while another used the chessboard to teach mathematics.

Tejas Parmar, district development officer, Amreli, said, “The app will help innovations reach other teachers.”

Title: Jamia girl who fought Delhi cops in Kolkata today
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Braving rain, protesters at Park Circus continue their demonstration.

KOLKATA: The image of a hijab-wrapped girl fiercely shielding a male friend from the batons of Delhi Police was the tipping point of the collective consciousness of India, which erupted in protests against CAA and NRC. Ayesha Renna N , the post-graduate history student at Jamia Milia University, will be in Kolkata on Friday to participate in a protest march from Esplanade to Gandhi statue.

Activists Harsh Mandar and other members of civil society and students will also participate in the rally, where Ayesha is expected to raise her voice against the attack on JNU students.

Ayesha, who along with a fellow student, Ladeeda Sakhaloon, has become the symbol of defiance during the ongoing movement, told TOI she was excited to be in Kolkata, which had always fought fascism and turned down communalism and bigotry. “It is a privilege to be invited to a march in Kolkata, which has a long history of defying anti-people regimes and shows little tolerance towards communalism and bigotry. I have never been to Kolkata but have heard stories about how the city raised its voice against injustice to the weak,” she said. “The people here can teach me a thing or two about fighting for one’s rights, but my small message will be to stay united against fake propaganda and to fight CAA and NRC.”

Ayesha was born and brought up in Kondotty, a small town in Kerala’s Mallapuram. The attack on her friends on the university campus on December 15 changed her perspective towards life overnight. Her impassioned way of protecting her friends from the cop batons won her love from people of all communities. She had been flooded with invitations to protests against CAA and NRC from Hyderabad to Kerala. “I am showered with love everywhere I go. Despite all efforts to divide people through fake propaganda I find them united. Protests of such a huge scale would not have been possible had people from only one community participated,” said Ayesha, whose photo was made the display picture of many social media users, who pledged their support for the movement through the image.

“I urge more and more women to come forward to fight for their rights before it is too late,” said Ayesha, pointing out many of the rallies and demonstrations were already being led by women, including the one at Shaheen Bagh in Delhi.

Title: Bihar governor asks VCs to accelerate process of academic reforms
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Bihar governor Fagu Chauhan at a meeting with the vice-chancellors of all the universities at Raj Bhavan in Pa... Read More

PATNA: Governor-cum-chancellor Fagu Chauhan on Thursday directed the universities to evolve a mechanism for regular monitoring of the working of all constituent and affiliated colleges besides BEd colleges and help improve the state’s higher education system.

Addressing a high-level review meeting at Raj Bhavan here, the governor said that senior officers of the universities should regularly visit the colleges under their jurisdiction and inspect the various activities. He asked the principal secretary to initiate necessary action in this regard and create a fool-proof system for ensuring regular monitoring of colleges. The meeting was attended by the vice-chancellors of all the universities besides the officials of Raj Bhavan.

Chauhan asked the VCs to take necessary steps for accelerating the process of academic reforms by making an assessment of vacant posts of teachers and also the strength of students in different colleges and university departments. Institution-wise and subject-wise vacancies must be worked out. He directed the VCs to ensure proper rationalization of posts of teachers in the light of students’ demand for the subject.

It is seen that in some subjects which have virtually no takers, there are plenty of teachers and, similarly, in some subjects which are much in demand there are only a few teachers. Such imbalance must be removed by ensuring proper rationalization of posts before expediting the recruitment of fresh teachers.

Referring to the admission of students in BEd course in teachers’ training colleges, the governor pointed out that this year the state-level combined entrance test for BEd course would be conducted by the LN Mithil University.

Candidates’ counselling and their choice of institutions must be coordinated in such a way that genuine students do not face any hardship in securing their admission. No candidate who fails to qualify the entrance test, should be admitted in any institution. Stern action would be taken against the institution which admits such students, warned the chancellor.

Title: Tiger invests $200 million in Byju’s, valuation at $8 billion
Content:
(File photo)

BENGALURU: Tiger Global Management , one of the most influential investors in India’s digital economy, has invested $200 million in education technology company Byju’s at a valuation of close to $8 billion. The new deal will make it the third-most valued startup in the country, after mobile payments major Paytm and hospitality company Oyo , while putting it ahead of ride-hailing major Ola .The new capital raised by Byju’s continues the rapid increase in its valuation over the last 24 months — from about $1 billion in early 2018 — cementing its position as the world’s most valuable education technology companies as it undertakes global expansion. The company, which said it has 42 million registered users and 3 million paid subscribers, plans to launch programmes in vernacular languages besides rolling out online tutoring in the coming months.“They (Tiger Global) share our sense of purpose and this partnership will advance our long-term vision of creating an impact by changing the way students learn. This partnership is both a validation of the impact created by us so far and a vote of confidence for our long-term vision,” said founder Byju Raveendran in a statement.Byju’s already counts as investors Facebook co-founder’s foundation Chan Zuckerberg Initiative, Chinese conglomerate Tencent, Canadian pension firm CPPIB, Amsterdam-listed Prosus Ventures, sovereign wealth fund Qatar Investment Authority and PE major General Atlantic.The fresh investment represents the growing maturity of the ed-tech segment, according to investors tracking the space. “The demand for quality education has always existed. With erstwhile roadblocks of access, data cost and digital payments going away, these companies are poised for strong growth over the next few years. Having said that, they will need to clearly demonstrate tangible improvement in learning outcomes to create a major dent in the offline coaching market,” said Rajat Agarwal, director at venture firm Matrix Partners India.Byju’s had reported a 174% increase in revenues on a standalone basis to Rs 1,341 crore, while the company also turned a profit of little over Rs 20 crore in the financial year ending March 31, 2019. Though on a consolidated basis, it reported a loss of Rs 8.8 crore. It has said it is targeting revenues of Rs 3,000 crore in FY20.Byju’s expanded to focus on early learners from kindergarten to grade 3 this year by tying up with US-based media and entertainment conglomerate Walt Disney. The tie-up is aimed at expansion into new English-speaking markets like the US, England and Australia. Besides, Byju’s also came into the limelight earlier this year by replacing Chinese smartphone brand Oppo for jersey rights for the Indian cricket team.

Title: Amreli cops summon diamond baron in fake complaint case
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Savji Dholakia

RAJKOT: Amreli police have issued summons to Surat diamond baron Savji Dholakia asking him to remain present on January 13 for questioning in the case of fake complaint of Mahatma Gandhi ’s statue desecration in Lathi town of Amreli district on January 4.

Talking to TOI, Amreli superintendent of police (SP) Nirlipt Rai said, “The evidence available with us shows that a fake crime scene was created. We will question Dholakia whether he was aware about this and what was the motive behind misleading the police.”

During preliminary questioning, Kanak Patel, caretaker of the lake and surrounding area developed by Dholakia Foundation, admitted to have fabricated the incident of desecration. However, police are awaiting more evidence, forensic reports and questioning of concerned persons before registered an offence.

“There is motive behind every crime and this needs to be established,” said Rai.

An application was submitted by Dholakia Foundation on January 4 at Lathi police station alleging that some miscreants has vandalized Bapu’s statue. Spot investigation and recovery of audio clips from some labourers revealed that the statue was accidently damaged by a tractor engaged by the Dholakia foundation in it’s premise several days before January 4.

It is suspected that the fake complaint was submitted to ‘fix’ some villagers who have been at loggerheads with the foundation over use of the approach road where the statue has been installed.

Title: Greaves Cotton puts Rs 180 crore into Ampere
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

File photo

CHENNAI: After investing Rs 180 crore into electric vehicle business Ampere , Greaves Cotton is now working with multiple partners for charging and engine platforms.

“As of December 2019, we became 100% owners of Ampere and the complete investment was in line with our strategic commitment,” said Nagesh Basavanhalli , MD & CEO, Greaves Cotton. “The total investment into Ampere is Rs 180.48 crore including new product launches, manpower etc. We continue to invest in the company in expanding capacity to up to 5,000 units a month from less than 1,000 units earlier. We are also expanding the tech team to 40 in Coimbatore and Bengaluru,” he said.

In terms of network expansion, in the “last 6-8 weeks we have 23 more distribution outlets and the total Ampere and Greaves Retail network is around 180-200 strong covering 180 cities,” said Basavanhalli.

Ampere has clocked net revenue of Rs 53.6 crore in FY19. Its net revenue is just under Rs 38 crore in H1FY20. Net loss was Rs 8 crore in H1 this year compared to Rs 9 crore for FY19 though adjusted for deferred tax on consolidation it is down to Rs 5.4 crore loss.

While Ampere will be an electric mobility division for Greaves Cotton, the company is also selling e-rickshaws through Greaves Retail outlets in north and east India.

“Over the last couple of years, we’ve had partners across the value chain—including SUN and Altigreen,” said Basavanhalli. “Greaves is looking at setting up entire eco-system – two wheelers, service, spares. We are looking at this over the long run and are open for partnerships or any other opportunities,” he added. Ampere too has just tied up with Bigbasket for e-scooters as part of its drive to have application B2B presence as well.
