Title: Nagpur: 38.09% polling in NMC’s bypoll, counting today
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Citizens come out after voting in the by-election that was necessitated following the death of four-time corpo... Read More

NAGPUR: An abysmal 38.09% polling was recorded during the by-election for prabhag number 12(D) on Thursday. Of the total 58,162 voters, just 21,151 exercised their franchise.

The counting will be held from 10am at in NMC’s Dharampeth zone office , Gokulpeth on Friday.

Five contestants were in the fray — independent Ashok Dorlikar, Bharip Bahujan Mahasangh’s Praful Ganvir, BJP’s Vikram Gwalbanshi, AAP’s Akash Kawle and Congress’s Pankaj Shukla.

The by-election were necessitated following the death of four-time corporator Jagdish Gwalbanshi, a resident of Sai Nagar. The election passed off peacefully and there were no untoward incident.

During the first two hours, a mere 6% polling was recorded. The later part of the day too saw a similar trend with the percentage not climbing to more than 5% every two hours.

The ward has total 30,235 male and 27,927 female voters. But, only 11,948 male and 10,203 female voters turned up. Officials blamed the poor show on official working day beside low enthusiasm among mass about bypolls. The civic body had set up 50 polling booths in the prabhag.

BJP had fielded Vikram Gwalbanshi, son of the deceased corporator, while Congress picked Pankaj Shukla, whose parents Surendra and Nilima had also represented the ward earlier. NCP and Shiv Sena are not contesting the bypoll.

The dismal turnout of voters was because bypoll as such is not taken seriously by several voters in the city. “From our side too there should have been much better mobilizing of workers and voters,” said BJP office-bearer.

Congress workers, however, pointed out that the turnout could have been better if, like other polls, there would have been a holiday.

Title: Anganwadi workers to get Rs 2,000 raise
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

UDUPI/MANGALURU: Anganwadi workers will get an increment of Rs 2,000, women and child development minister Shashikala Jolle said on Thursday, adding that the order has been issued and will be implemented in 15 days.

In further relief, she said the workload on anganwadi workers would be eased so that they can focus on their primary responsibilities.

“Within 15 days, anganwadi workers’ monthly aid (salary) will be increased by Rs 2,000. The order has been already issued. In October 2018, the central government said it would pay Rs 1,500 to anganwadi workers. Though the grant was released in the 60:40 ratio, it was not given to them. Now, the state will put in the remaining 40% and provide Rs 2,000 to the workers. Steps will be taken to ensure anganwadi staff receive the honorary aid by the 10th of every month,” she said.

Jolle said her department was among the neglected ones in the state but in the past four months, 60% of the vacancies have been filled and steps taken to expedite promotions.

“Anganwadi workers are being burdened with departmental work and they are unable to pay full attention to the children in their care. We will work towards reducing the work pressure,” she said.

In another move, anganwadi workers may soon get a new name. “A proposal is being sent to address anganwadi workers by a better name which will reflect society’s recognition of their services,” the minister said.

Face-reading equipment, digital books

A biometric attendance system for workers and face-reading equipment for children will be launched soon to check irregularities in anganwadis.

“Currently, though the attendance book shows 50 children, the centre is found to have only 20. So where does the food of 30 children go?” Jolle said.

Anganwadis in Karnataka with own buildings will have uniform interior design. The ceilings of these anganwadis will be painted with images of solar system or any such image that will give children information about their surroundings or that will help improve their knowledge, said Jolle. This will be followed for all new anganawadi buildings that will be constructed, she said.

Reviewing the department’s progress in Dakshina Kannada district, the minister said given the demand for anganwadis in Karnataka Public School in the state, a decision on including the same with these schools will be decided at the level of ministers.

“Principal secretaries of the two departments will first sort out the issue and give their recommendation to the ministers, who in turn will address fears that anganwadi teachers have on the issue,” she said. R Selvamani, CEO, Dakshina Kannada Zilla Panchayat said there is demand from beneficiaries of the scheme that they be provided chikki, egg and milk at their doorsteps rather than make them come to the anganwadis for the same.

The government will take a call on it given there are similar demands from across the state, the minister, however, ruled out transferring the food packet amount to beneficiaries account, fearing its misuse.

Title: JNU: Students’ march stopped near Shastri Bhawan, some injured
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

JNUSU chief Aishe Ghosh (left) emerged from a meeting with MHRD and exhorted the students to march towards Ras... Read More

NEW DELHI: Hundreds of JNU students , accompanied by their counterparts from Delhi University and Jamia Millia Islamia, marched alongside citizen supporters on Thursday from Mandi House towards Shastri Bhawan to apprise the Union HRD ministry about their 73-day agitation against the hostel fee hike.

The protesters made a strong pitch for sacking JNU vice-chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar for “allowing violence on campus”. The marchers also demonstrated against CAA and NRC. Though the protesters were halted at Shastri Bhawan, some members of JNU Teachers’ Association and JNUSU, including its president Aishe Ghosh, insisted on meeting the HRD ministry officials.

Saket Moon, JNUSU vice-president, declared, “We are not going to move back an inch.” The meeting with ministry officials lasted over two hours.

As the meeting was going on, a number of political leaders addressed the crowd outside. Saying that he “proudly owns the tukde-tukde title” given to him and fellow demonstrators, former JNUSU president Kanhaiya Kumar said, “We will render tukde-tukde the movement to spread hate and vitriol in the country.”

Kumar commended actor Deepika Padukone for standing in support of JNU students and added, “If repression becomes law, then it’s a crime not to speak. So, start speaking... Don’t be silent, don’t be violent.”

The former JNUSU president also said that they were not demanding the VC’s resignation because “he will never resign since his agenda is to destroy the university. So, it is important to remove him.”

CPM’s Sitaram Yechury echoed these sentiments: “The government has to fire this VC and not allow him to tender his resignation. He allowed masked men to attack students on campus.”

Later, as the delegation emerged from the meeting with ministry officials, Ghosh said the negotiations were unsatisfactory and that the students would now march to Rashtrapati Bhavan. But as they proceeded towards the National Archives, they were detained on Rajendra Prasad Road. A few students were injured in the melee with the cops. As the crowd started to disperse, some proceeded to the Mandir Marg police station, where two women students were detained, but were later let off.

The protest was eventually called off a little after 8pm. Delhi Police additional PRO Anil Mittal said the march remained peaceful till the time the JNU delegation was in the HRD ministry office. “However, when the delegation emerged, a student leader provoked the gathering into marching towards Rashtrapati Bhavan. They were prevented from disrupting traffic on Rajendra Prasad Road. In the process, 11 people were detained but subsequently released,” Mittal said.

Title: Five police teams formed to apprehend the accused
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Kaliyakkavilai (Kanyakumari): The body of slain SSI Y Wilson was laid to rest with full state honours at the burial ground of the CSI church at Marthandam. Director General of Police J K Tripathy and senior police officers paid tributes to the cop by placing a wreath. Police fired 21 rounds in the air before the body was laid to rest around 4 pm on Thursday.

Earlier, the DGP, IG south zone K P Shanmuga Rajeswaran and DIG Tirunelveli range Praveen Kumar Abhinapu along with senior officers from Kerala visited the scene of the crime for investigation. They also visited the SSI’s family residing at Marthandam and consoled them. “It is a sorrowful incident. Investigations are under way,” Tripathy told reporters. Five special teams under the superintendent of police of Kanyakumari district N Shreenath are on the job to nab the accused, Thoufique and Abdul Shamim. Police sources said that the two have suspected terror links and have murder and attempt to murder cases separately pending against them.

Kaliyakkavilai police registered a case under sections 302 (punishment for murder) and 506(ii) (punishment for criminal intimidation) of the Indian Penal Code and sections 7 read with 25(1A) and 25(1B) of the Arms Act for illegal possession of the weapon used for the murder. Postmortem was performed on Wilson’s body at the government medical college and hospital in Asaripallam before it was laid to rest. An SSI attached to the Kaliyakkavilai police station, Wilson had joined the police force in April 1986 and was due for retirement in five months. He has been serving at Kaliyakkavilai from July 2018. The resident of Paruthivilai near Marthandam is survived by his wife Angel Mary and two daughters, Antris Rimija, 27, and Vinitha, 26. MDMK general secretary Vaiko condemned the murder and urged the police to nab the accused and get them convicted at the earliest. In a tweet, PMK leader Ramadoss has expressed shock over the murder..

Title: High court notice to Gujarat government over election code violation
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Pradipsinh Jadeja

AHMEDABAD: The Gujarat high court on Thursday issued notice to the state government in response to a petition filed by the minister of state (home) Pradipsinh Jadeja seeking quashing of a metropolitan court’s decision to conduct a trial against him over allegations of him violating the election model code of conduct in 2007.

The trouble began for Jadeja more than 13 years after the incident. In October 2007, the then city Congress president Pankaj Shah filed a complaint with the election officer, on the basis of a pamphlet distributed in the Asarwa constituency. It displayed a photograph of Jadeja, then the MLA from Asarva, with the slogan ‘Aapnu Asarwa, Aagvu Asarwa’. It also bore a photograph of then chief minister with the slogan ‘Aapnu Gujarat, Aagvu Gujarat’. The pamphlet also contained a prayer – Vishwambhari Stuti — with a picture of the goddess Amba.

The Congress leader complained that the pamphlet was distributed by Jadeja but did not contain the name of the printer, which is a must under Section 127A of the Representation of the People Act. On basis of this complaint, the district election officer filed a complaint with the metropolitan court, seeking action against Jadeja.

The metropolitan court conducted verification in the matter and ordered a police inquiry asking Meghaninagar police to inquire and report on the circulation of the pamphlet. The police filed its report in December 2007 after recording the statements of Shah and a National Student Union of India (NSUI), Vinaysinh Tomar.

Thirteen years after police submitted its inquiry report, the metropolitan court on December 21, 2019 ordered to begin the process against Jadeja and conduct a trial in the case. The law under which Jadeja faces charges is punishable with imprisonment for up to six months.

Title: Over 2 lakh cardholders get Pongal gift hampers on day 1
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Madurai: Long queues were witnessed outside all 1,354 ration shops in the district from early in the morning on Thursday to receive the Pongal gift hampers, with more than two lakh beneficiaries receiving their gifts on the first day.

The Tamil Nadu government is distributing gift hampers of one kg of raw rice, cashewnuts, raisins, sugar, and Rs 1,000 cash to all beneficiaries of the rice card in the state for Pongal festival. While the programme was formally launched last Sunday by the ministers in each district, the distribution for public started on Thursday.

Many shops in the city witnessed squabbles between the people in the queues. While the beneficiaries were told that the names of the people would be displayed on the board outside the shops to prevent overcrowding, however confusion prevailed at many places.

In Villapuram, women and elderly people stood in long queues and were given tokens from as early as 6am. “I stood in the queue from 6am but got my gift only at 11am, so I could not go to work,” said Shanthi, a resident.

It was announced that beneficiaries whose names appear on the ration card can come to the shop and receive the cash and gift hamper by producing the card or their Aadhaar as proof, many of them complained that it got delayed due to the serpentine queues.

“Last year, I went on a Sunday before the Pongal festival and was given only Rs 500, as they said cash, rice and other condiments were not available. So, I came on the first day this year, but have lost half my day’s pay waiting for this,” said Rajeswari of Karupayoorani.

Meanwhile, sources from the district administration said that Pongal gift hampers were issued to 2,23,437 rice cards in Madurai district out of the total 85,00,15, which is about 26%.

Title: Delhi assembly elections: BJP bike rally over ‘misuse’ of youth
Content:
Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari and MP Vijay Goel take part in the rally that saw participation of several youth ... Read More

NEW DELHI: Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari and others flagged off mega motorcycle rally from the party office on Thursday to protest against the violence in JNU and the alleged “misuse” of youth by the opposition parties to push their agenda.The rally, which was kick-started by Tiwari riding a bike with MP Vijay Goel standing behind, was scheduled to cover Mandi House, Kashmere Gate and Britannia Chowk, but police diverted it to bypass Mandi House due to a march by students and teachers. The rally covered Vikas Marg, ISBT, Delhi University, Azadpur and reached Britannia Chowk, where it was joined by MP Pravesh Verma, and finally reached Delhi BJP office via Punjabi Bagh and Dhaula Kuan.“The youth have contributed the most to the development of the country. Congress and AAP are creating an atmosphere of confusion and falsehood on CAA, which can lead to disturbance in the country. In frustration, the opposition parties are trying to push the youth into anarchy for electoral gain,” Tiwari said.Goel said the rally titled ‘Vijay Abhiyan Sankalp Rally’ signalled the political farewell of the Kejriwal government. “I am confident that BJP will form the government in Delhi. Under the leadership of PM Modi, Delhi will progress at double speed,” he said.Meanwhile, on uncertainty over who will be BJP’s CM face for the assembly election, party MP Meenakshi Lekhi has picked an unusual contender — the lotus. “Whether you are the Prime Minister or party president or hold any position, it’s the lotus which is our face and we all work for the same cause. It is the lotus which will contest on every seat and lotus will become the chief minister of Delhi,” she claimed.

Title: Crane tagged in Mongolia covers 2,766 kilometers, dies of pesticide in Rajasthan
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Crane T-51 that was tagged.

JAIPUR: T-51 died on January 9. It was not supposed to. But it was practically poisoned to death by pesticides easily available and used in India but banned in the US and across Europe.

When on July 27, 2019, it soared into the sky with its flock of about 400 demoiselle cranes -- a small, graceful species with a black head and white ear tufts that breeds in south-eastern Europe and central Asia -- on a three-month journey from Mongolia’s Khurgan Lake to their winter home in state’s Khichan village, scientists who had tagged it "back home" were expecting it back. No one thought it would die months after it reached its destination, having survived the July to November 2,766-km flight.

T-51 died along with 15 other sick birds on Thursday. Three had perished earlier. They were among 40 that fell critically ill on December 31. Autopsy of some of the cranes have revealed death came from consuming grains laced with pesticide.

Viscera samples of the birds sent to National Centre for Avian Ecotoxicology at Coimbatore confirmed poisoning and specifically mentioned the pesticide monocrotophos in their report, forest officials said. Farmers in large parts of the world have been asked to stay away from monocrotophos.

T-51 was special as it had been tagged, allowing scientists to know the exact distance the bird had travelled, every halt it had made, its every move. T-51 landed in Jodhpur’s Khichan last November. T-51 was one of two chicks of a family banded at Khurk Valley.

“Rajasthan hosts thousands of migratory birds every year. The state must issue advisories about using harmful pesticides,” said Dau Lal Bohra, senior wildlife researcher in Jaipur. “Researcher Nimbiar Batbayar has confirmed T-51 is one among the 1,000-crane project,” he added. The 1,000-crane project is a multi-country initiative that stretches over years, tracking multiple migrations and crane species and populations, following routes, rest-sites, impact of changing climate and even social structures among the birds.

The small band or tag tied to a bird’s leg yields rich information used in migration studies and conservation efforts. Soaring to altitudes of up to 26,000 feet, the migration route of demoiselle cranes, the smallest of 15 crane species, is considered among the toughest pathways as they fly over the Himalayas, head and neck straight forward and legs straight behind, a formation legend says was used by ancient armies. Ornithologists suggest there’s an easier route over the Khyber Pass but the cranes are hard-wired to follow their known route over hundreds of migrations.

Many die on the journeys to and fro battling extreme weather, hunger, predatory birds and even power lines. To tide over inhospitable habitats on their migration pathway, cranes store fat they use as fuel to sustain themselves and make the longest flights between rest stops.

As disturbing the news was of thousands of migratory birds dying in Sambhar last year — village Khichan alone houses up to 40,000 cranes at a time in various batches and groups — there is little recognition of the disruption avoidable deaths of just one bird can cost scientific studies. The return journey of the demoiselle cranes to summer home in Mongolia will start sometime in March.

“Banding allows easy identification and helps establish connections between two distant sites the tagged bird visited. It helps provide information on lifespan and the bird’s ‘flight tendency’,” said Bohra.

Extremely upset at T-51’s death, Bohra said, “When a tagged bird meets such fate, the entire research is hampered. These deaths are completely avoidable.”

Title: ‘Hyderabad declaration’ for curbs on money power in politics
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

After the two-day deliberations on ‘Money power in politics— Indian democracy at work’ at ISB, a ‘Hyderabad declaration ’ was released enlisting steps to curb money power in politics. The conference organised by Foundation for Democratic Reforms (FDR) along with ISB and University of Hydrabad stressed on the need to disincentivise and deglamourise electoral office.

FDR president Jayaprakash Narayan said: “In recent decades, there has been an enormous increase of funds in political activity amounting to hundreds of crores of rupees. Realtors, land mafia, owners of educational institutions and big contractors make direct entry to gain access to the government. After the two-day deliberations, we came up with the Hyderabad declaration.”

According to the declaration, a concerted campaign should be taken up by civil society groups, Election Commission and citizens concerned on the consequences of money flooding into politics. The declaration also says that there is a need to strengthen and enforce legislations on political party funding and expenditure.

“There is no perfect electoral system. All electoral models have strengths and weaknesses. In the Indian context, elected legislators taking control of the fate of the government and becoming defector executives has led to competitive bidding for votes. Increasingly, a system of gift-giving to voters has developed. This has led to a vicious cycle of corruption, abuse of power and plutocracy,” said the declaration

The conference said a national-level conversation on alternative electoral models is the need of the hour. Election commissioner Ashok Lavasa said that some pending suggestions made to strengthen the Election Commission would help address loopholes. He said at many meetings held by MHA, they did not discuss about electoral offences. He said state governments should investigate and prosecute the cases.

Title: All churches to pray for peace, love in holy week
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Kolkata: The weeklong annual congregation of Christians of all denominations used to be a routine affair of praying and forgiving. But this year, Unity Octave , slated for January 18 to 25, will see Christians from over 100 churches in the city, praying for “conversion” of dissenting voices and coercive forces into one that speaks of kindness, love and inclusiveness. Community leaders feel that forgetting the divide of church denominations, people should unite in these difficult times and pray for a miracle so that peace returns.

The Roman Catholic , Anglican, Methodist, Baptist, Assembly of God and other protestant churches will take part in Unity Octave. Traditionally here, this programme, popularly called, The Week of Prayer, is celebrated between the feasts of St Peter and St Paul. Though the Vicar General of the Archdiocese of Kolkata (Roman Catholic church), Father Dominic Gomes , is the chief organiser, CNI is also partnering in the activities. “We try to forget all our differences and unite as a community of Christians for peace. This year, we will pray as a community for the country as a whole. Peace is the need of the hour and we need a miracle to happen,” the vicar said.

He insisted that while the Unity prayers will keep in mind the current atmosphere of fear and uncertainty, there is nothing political about the initiative. “We hope all quarrels will end and equality will be upheld…May all those who have hurt others through their words and actions be forgiven, too…” the vicar said.

The holy week will start with a service at Salvation Army on Lenin Sarani on January 18, followed by Ecumenical Sunday at churches across the city. Key services have been kept the whole week at Sacred Heart Church, Dharamtala, AG Church, Park Street, St Thomas Church, Free School Street, Fatima Church, CIT Road, Baptist Missionary Society and will end with a grand service at St Paul’s Cathedral on January 25.

Title: Ahmedabad: Khokhra man poses as NIA officer in court, arrested
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Amit Arya

AHMEDABAD: A 38-year-old man from Khokhra was arrested for posing as an officer of the NIA ( National Investigation Agency ) before a local court, when he went there in connection with a case of assault filed by him. He presented himself as an assistant commissioner of police (ACP) in the NIA and pressed his demand that the accused not be released on bail, but landed in legal trouble himself.

Inspector B Z Jhala of Khokhra police said the man, identified as Amit Arya alias Nasirkhan Pathan, was attacked by his neighbour on January 6, over a parking dispute. In connection with that case, the accused was produced before an additional chief metropolitan magistrate.

Arya had then submitted an application pleading that the accused should not be given bail and said that he was an ACP in the NIA. Arya’s friend, Saiyed Gulrez Alam, also submitted an affidavit substantiating Arya’s claim, said Jhala.

When the cops asked for proof of his identity, he could not produce any.

Title: SI murder: Police on the trail of terror suspects from Tamil Nadu
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

The check post on Market Road at Kaliyakkavila where SSI Y Wilson was attacked. (Inset) Suspects Thoufique (L)... Read More

KANYAKUMARI/THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: The two young men were not masked and wore skull caps. They had a close look at the place before firing at special sub-inspector (SSI) Y Wilson, 57, who was on duty at the small check post on Market Road at Kaliyakkavila on the inter-state border.

The duo escaped through the gates of the Muslim Jama-ath and made their way to Kerala after committing the crime late on Wednesday. These details and their identities became known from the CCTV footage recorded in the mosque that connects the check post to the main check post on the highway through the mosque premises.

The incident took place around 9.35pm when the two accused, now identified as Thoufique and Abdul Shamim, came on foot from the Kaliyakkavila market, crossed the check post where Wilson was alone and went to the back gate of the mosque less than 20m away. After waiting there for a minute, they walked to the check post and fired three to four rounds at Wilson. As he fell down unconscious, the duo ran back to the gate and walked out of the mosque through its front gate onto the Nagercoil - Thiruvananthapuram national highway. This was recorded on three CCTV cameras at the mosque and four more in a hospital, weigh bridge and two shops where the duo is seen walking past the inter-state border into Thiruvananthapuram.

IG south zone K P Shanmuga Rajeswaran said that there were also stab injuries on the body the nature of which can be confirmed only after obtaining the post mortem report.

Earlier, Tamil Nadu DGP J K Tripathy, IG south zone K P Shanmuga Rajeswaran and DIG Tirunelveli range Praveen Kumar Abhinapu along with senior officers from Kerala visited the scene of the crime for investigation. Five special teams under the superintendent of police of Kanyakumari district N Shreenath are out to nab the accused.

Police sources said the two have suspected terror links and have murder and attempted murder cases separately pending against them. While one of the suspects Shamim was involved in the murder of Hindu Munnani leader K P S Suresh Kumar in Chennai in 2014, the other suspect was involved in a few assault cases including the attempted murder of a BJP functionary, M R Gandhi, in Kanyakumari.

Meanwhile, in a statement issued in Thiruvananthapuram on Thursday, state police chief Loknath Behera said that anybody with valid information about the suspects could share it by contacting the police at state police control room numbers, 0471-2722500 or 9497900999. He also assured that the identity of the informants would be kept confidential to protect them from any harm.

The body of Wilson was laid to rest with full state honours at the burial ground of the CSI church at Marthandam.

Title: Increase people's participation through civil society: J&K DGP
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

JAMMU: Jammu & Kashmir Police chief Dilbag Singh reviewed the law and order situation in south Kashmir on Thursday and directed officers to augment the security grids in the Valley. Singh also called for increasing people's participation through interaction with the civil society at different levels.

The Director General of Police (DGP) made the remarks at security review meetings during his visit to the twin police districts of Kulgam and Awantipora in south Kashmir.

Appreciating JK Police personnel and other security forces for neutralising terrorists, the DGP directed the officers to strengthen the checkpoints and augment the security grids to enhance security for the citizens of the Valley.

He stressed on redressing the genuine grievances of the people and increasing public outreach by organising more community-based initiatives and programmes.

Title: Shooter Shafat Ali Khan a judge for Telangana’s shooting event
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Nawab Shafat Ali Khan

HYDERABAD: Man-eating tiger hunter Nawab Shafat Ali Khan is back in action. He will serve as a jury member at a shooting competition where a moving target has to be shot dead by the competing shooters. Telangana Rifle Association (TRA) is conducting the 1st Telangana Super Big Bore Shooting Competition from February.

The shooting event will have running targets similar to wild boars, and word has been sent out to National Rifle Association of India, TRA and affiliated district rifle associations of TRA.

The ex-Inspector General of Police at the CRPF Academy in Gurugram, Tejinder Singh Dhillon who mentored several Olympians is also a jury member. The Nawab has culled hundreds of wild boars in various states with his rifles.

Nawab Shafat Ali Khan said, “The event will be held at the Aman Sanghi shooting range in Sanghinagar. The game is planned as an audience-oriented program where the spectators will have a bird’s-eye view of the event. The event provides an opportunity to the rifle enthusiasts across the country to display their heavy rifles, especially the double barrel rifle and also offers shooters a chance to use them on specially designated targets.”

There are two categories of events. The first event involves .375 magnum calibre and above up to .600 nitro, and another category will involve .375 straight calibre and below. All members of NRAI, TRA and affiliated district associates with a valid arms license to possess NP bore rifle will be permitted.

In the first event, the shooter loads two cartridges in the magazine on the command and a running target will appear at a distance of 45 metres. As soon as the shooter shoots his first shot, the target starts to jump up and down while moving ahead. The shooter then takes the second shot. On the second command for second series, the shooter loads two cartridges and shoots again.

In the second event, completion will comprise of 10 shots at a distance of 50 metres on duelling targets for which sight on card will be provided and the total time will be four minutes.

- In an additional event, participants will have to display their rifles and a panel of judges will select the best maintained rifle of the country. All parameters of the weapon like the stock, bluing, internal barrel condition, engraving and working condition of the gun will be taken into consideration.

As per the rules, any person points a weapon at another person intentionally or unintentionally will be debarred immediately.

Title: 2 held in Uppinangady in honeytrap case
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Mangaluru: The Dakshina Kannada district police on Wednesday arrested two people in connection with a honeytrap case in Uppinangady .

The arrested are Lohith , a resident of Kushalnagara , and Sharif from Vittal . Jamal, Jeevan and Naushad, who were also involved in the case, are absconding.

Police said they received information that a few people under the guise of being Kerala police , were planning to raid a resort near Uppinangady where two couples were staying. They were informed that they would threaten and try to extort money from them. The police were tipped off about the same by their counterparts in Kerala.

Police said the accused are experts in setting honeytraps, and were involved in similar crimes since a long time. Their modus operandi was to use two women from Mangaluru to lure their intended targets.

Once they trap their target, the woman and victim are sent to resorts.

They then raid the resort posing as police officials, and click pictures in compromising positions of the victim with the woman.

They threaten to release the pictures on social media or TV channels, if they fail to pay up.

Police said the accused demanded Rs 10 lakh from each victim, but they denied to pay up. Irked by this, the accused took away the victims’ belongings such as phone, money and car.

The victims who believed that the accused were police personnel, asked them to take them to the police station. Instead of taking them to the police, the accused took them to a secluded place, where they claimed that they were putting the victims under house arrest. Police have seized an SUV from the accused.

Title: Mukhtar in trouble again? Now, on radar of Mau cops, admin in land grabbing case
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Varanasi: Days after being named in an FIR and cash reward being announced on two shooters of his gang, jailed don and BSP MLA Mukhtar Ansari is again on the radar of Mau district administration and police in a fresh case of land grabbing.

After registering cases against 60 persons for their involvement in grabbing around 5 acre pond land in Jahagirabad locality under Dakshintola police station on Tuesday, district magistrate Mau Gyan Prakash Tripathi said that reports hint at Mukhtar’s involvement in the case.

“An investigation is still in progress in the case and if his role is confirmed, he would also be booked,” added the DM. A voluntary organisation Ganga Tamsa Seva Samiti had lodged a complaint of land grabbing with the district administration and Mau police. The land, which is a pond, is registered in the name of Hindu deity ‘Thakurji’, in revenue records.

The DM had ordered a probe in the case that revealed that about five acre land of such pond had been transferred in the name of several persons. He said that name of 60 persons became clear in the on-going probe after which an FIR was lodged with the police in this connection while more names are expected to come to light. Mukhtar’s name is also expected in the list.

When contacted Arya on Wednesday to know the reason for increased action against Mukhtar and his gang members in past few days, he said, the action against mafia elements and activities of their gang members is continuing for past several months to put a check on organised crime. Two months ago one more member Saud Abbasi of Mukhtar gang along with nine other persons had also been sent to jail in the cases of extortion.

Before Tripathi disclosed it, SP Mau Anurag Arya on Tuesday afternoon had announced cash rewards of Rs 25,000 on Mukhtar gang shooters — Anuj Kanojia and Ramu Mallah of Ghazipur each. The two were booked under Gangster Act 2010. Hearing in the case is still pending as the duo did not appear in court so far. After initiating the process of confiscating their properties, the process of announcement of reward was followed, he said adding efforts for their arrest has been intensified.

Earlier, on January 5, Mau police had lodged an FIR against six persons including Mukhtar, former station officer Dakshintola police station JK Singh, then lekhpal of area concerned, Israel Ansari, Anwar Shahzad and Salim under various IPC sections and 30 arms act.

Mukhtars recommendation had enable four persons to get arms licenses on fake addresses in 2001 while one of such license holders was eliminated in an encounter with police in Ghazipur in August 2008.

Title: Collector files plaint with cyber cell
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Kozhikode: Wayanad district collector Adeela Abdulla has filed a complaint with the cyber cell of the police against the alleged insulting and misleading social media posts against her after she accepted pro-Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) pamphlet from BJP workers.

Adeela told media persons at the collectorate on Thursday that she was facing attacks on social media and she had asked the police to investigate the matter. She said that while there have been attempts to misuse the photograph of her accepting the pro-CAA pamphlet from BJP workers for political purposes, some people, who are opposed to CAA, too were making defamatory comments against her on social media. “I have filed a complaint with the cyber cell asking them to look into the insulting posts on social media as some comments were highly defamatory in nature, even amounting to insulting womanhood,” she said.

Responding to a question she said that she would not like to make personal comments on CAA as she was holding an official position as a bureaucrat. She, however, added that it was a fact that there were concerns among people about National Population Registry (NPR) and that her mother too has been worried about it. tnn

Title: M Jagadesh Kumar: HRD rules out ouster of JNU vice-chancellor, calls for meet
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

JNU vice-chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar

NEW DELHI: Ruling out the removal of JNU vice-chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar , the human resource development ministry on Thursday said that its priority was addressing academic issues.

Amit Khare, MHRD secretary, met JNU teachers and students even as a huge protest was held demanding removal of the VC. The ministry has asked the VC and other JNU officials to come for a meeting on Friday morning, which will be followed by an interaction with students and teachers in the afternoon.

After the meeting, Khare said, “JNU Teachers’ Association president professor (DK) Lobiyal, JNUSU president elect Aishe Ghosh and her entire team had a lot of grievances about the university administration not following the understanding that had been reached earlier.”

“We will ask the administration to implement the understanding developed earlier in the meeting tomorrow. We told students they can meet us at 3pm to address concerns regarding various fees. They’ve given us in writing that they are open to discussions. We are trying to bring JNU back to normalcy,” Khare added.

Amid growing demands for removal of Kumar, Khare said addressing academic issues was a priority rather than removing anyone. “Students shouldn’t be under pressure of deadline for registration and the ministry has asked the university to extend it,” he added.

The meeting with the MHRD secretary lasted over two hours after which the teachers and students said that issues remained inconclusive and the struggle would continue for now. The protesters then decided to march to Rashtrapati Bhavan. “We appealed with MHRD to remove the VC. However, we were told that we will have a dialogue tomorrow,” Ghosh said. The students said they will appeal with the President to remove Kumar.

“The future course of action will be decided after tomorrow’s meeting. The students placed their points of view and grievances. We were told that the ministry will have a meeting with the JNU administration to discuss the grievances of the students. After that, a meeting has been called with the students. We will wait for the outcome,” said Lobiyal.

After being pulled up by the ministry, the JNU administration at 10.50pm issued a circular stating that service and utility charges won’t be levied in the current registration for the winter semester. “UGC will bear the cost of service and utility charges proposed till further orders,” it added.

Title: Four held for blocking Levitt’s boat cruise
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

ALAPPUZHA: Four CPM men were arrested by Pulinkunnu police on Thursday for blocking a houseboat carrying Nobel laureate Michael Levitt in Kuttanad during the trade union strike on Wednesday.

The arrested have been identified as Sabu, 46, of Raj Bhavan, Kainakary, Sudheer, 45, of Puthanchira, Pulinkunnu, Aji Kumar, 43, of Aji Bhavan, Kainakary and Jolly, 52, of Kandakudichirayil, Kainakary. The arrested belong to CITU and Kerala State Karshaka Thozhilali Union of CPM. Jolly is the CPM R Block branch secretary.

Pulinkunnu police said they were arrested based on information from residents in the R Block, said the police.

“Levitt declined to file a complaint. So, we registered a case based on the complaint and statements of the boat crew,” a police official said.

The collectors of Alappuzha and Kottayam too met Levitt on Thursday.

CPM district secretary R Nazar said the arrested men were CPM supporters and they violated the party’s directive. So action will be taken against them soon, he said.

Title: 3 of 14 Pak, B’deshi nationals apply for citizenship
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Gorakhpur: Following the Citizenship Amendment Act, three persons of 14 people of Pakistan and Bangladesh living in the city on long term Visa (LTV) have applied for citizenship and their application is in process.

“There are six Pakistani and eight Bangladeshi citizens living in Gorakhpur on long term visa which is given to those who get married to an Indian citizen. Anyone who is on record of LTV will be given citizenship. Also Indian national who went to other countries like Pakistan and Bangladesh after marrying a citizen of these countries and want to return will be given citizenship,” said inspector Chandan Singh.

Those who have applied for citizenship are Nighat Anees (45) of Pakistan who came in 1983 after marrying Shameem Mohammad of Jafra Bazar area, two sisters who came from Bangladesh in 2009 after marrying two brothers of India and Asma (35) wife of city-based physician Dr Iqbal, and Shamim (36), wife of Mohammad Ayyub. Among others who have been asked to apply for citizenship are Pakistan’s Rama Devi (50) and her brother Basant Kumar (52) who fled from Pakistan to reach their ancestral place Pipiganj in Gorakhpur in 1981 and 1983, respectively through Atari Border. They were born in Pakistan’s Sindh province after their father Ram Naresh Chaubey migrated to neighbouring country in search of job after partition. Rama Devi, later married to Gorakhpur’s Yogndra Pathak . She is now mother of five children and her brother Basant, also lives Sikriganj block of the district.

“We are very happy that the government of India took initiative to provide citizenship to minorities prosecuted in Pakistan,” Basant said. Other two Hindus whose name have been sent to grant citizenship are Bangladesh’s Bhagirati Devi (60) and Ganesh Prasad (70). Bhagirathi migrated to India through Haridaspur checkpost in 1971 with her husband Rajman. Rajman died four years ago.

Title: Maximum temperature drops by 5.1 degrees in Ahmedabad
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

IMD officials said that the cold will persist on Friday as well, after which the minimum temperature will rise... Read More

AHMEDABAD: After a few warm days the chill returned to the city with a bang on Thursday. Ahmedabad recorded dip of 5.1°C and 3.4°C in maximum and minimum temperatures. India Meteorological Department (IMD) officials said that the cold will persist on Friday as well, after which the minimum temperature will rise.

According to IMD website, on Thursday the city recorded maximum and minimum temperatures of 22.9°C and 9.6°C, which were lower than normal by 4.8°C and 3.2°C, respectively. “Minimum temperature will be around 9°C,” mentioned the website in its forecast for Friday.

“There will me no major fluctuation in minimum temperature in the region for next 24 hours. Thereafter, minimum temperatures will rise by 3-4°C,” the forecast for the state says. The department issued cold wave warnings for isolated pockets in Rajkot, Porbandar and Kutch with the return of northeasterly winds over the region.

Naliya recorded a minimum of 3.3°C — the lowest this winter — whereas eight other weather stations recorded 10°C or lower. These included Gandhinagar (7.5 °C), Bhuj (8.3°C) Kandla and Deesa (8.4°C), Keshod (8.8°C), Rajkot (9°C), Ahmedabad (9.4°C) and Vadodara (10°C).

Title: Four more arrested for ATM cash van heist bid
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Allahabad: The men behind the unsuccessful Kaushambi ATM cash van heist were absconding criminals with a Rs 50,000 reward on each of their heads, police said on Friday after arresting four persons over 10 days after the robbery attempt.

Police said the accused included the former employee of the security agency which owned the ATM cash van.

On December 30, a group of seven men in a car tried to rob an ATM cash van near Narwa turn, under Saini police station, on Allahabad-Kaushambi border. The cash-loaded van was on its way to fill up ATMs. The accused hurled crude bombs and fired at the van, but had to abort the plan after the vehicle’s driver stopped the van at Kada Dham police station and alerted the police.

Police had arrested one of the accused Balwant Kushwaha, near Gulamipur Road shortly after the incident. Two days back, police also arrested another accused Sabi Mohammad, a resident of Kaushambi, near Civil Lines. He was aslo carrying a reward of Rs 50,000 on his head.

The men arrested on Friday were identified as Kaushal Kumar Srivastava (34) alias Gagan of Abubakarpur (Dhoomanganj), Dheeraj Yadav of Dhoomanganj, Golu Soni alias Bachcha of Mirzapur and Devanand Srivastava alias Balloo of Fatehpur.

Police also seized a 7.65mm pistol along with three live cartridges, two countrymade pistols of 0.315 bore along with two live cartridges, two crude bombs, Rs 8,500, two motorcycles, two mobile phones and a car from their possession.

SP (Kaushambi) Abhinandan said, “We received a tip-off that he accused were planning to execute another crime near Nathaipurwa village on Kaushambi- Allahabad- Varanasi route. We cordoned off the area and nabbed the four.”

Police said that the kingpin of the gang Kaushal Srivastava was a former custodian of a private security agency, which supplied ATM vans.

Police claimed Kaushal along with Devanand , Micheal Soni and Balwant Maurya had robbed a Fatehpur-based cattle trader of Rs 3.30 lakh near Dhata canal road, under Mahevaghat police station, on Kaushambi- Fatehpur border .

Kaushal had also been accused of killing a man near Kasari Masari area of Allahabad on December 24 and later dumping his body near Malwa area in Fatehpur district.

Title: More suicides in Kerala than road accident deaths in 2018
Content:
Representative image

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: The suicide data of the state released by the National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) along with the crime and accident data of 2018 presents a grim picture. In 2018, as many as 8,237 persons committed suicide in the state. This is nearly double the number of persons who died in road accidents in the same year, which is 4,303. In 2017, the number of suicide deaths in the state were 7,870 and the year before, 7,705. While there was only an increase of 165 suicides going from 2016 and 2017, in 2018, there were 367 more suicides than the previous year.The data also reveals that the number of men, who committed suicide in the state were manifold higher than the number of women. The data has as many as 25 categories for various causes identified for the suicides and women outnumber men in only five categories. They are failure in exams, impotency/infertility, ideological causes/worship, poverty and physical abuse. The major categories of causes in which men lead are family problems, bankruptcy, marriage related issues, extra marital affairs, divorce, illness, mental issues, death of dear ones and fall in social reputation. In the category of suicides owing to drug abuse, there are 656 men while there are no women.According to Dr G Mohan Roy, psychiatrist and regional medical officer of Thiruvananthapuram, men leading the list of suicides was a common phenomenon all over the world.“We have a popular saying regarding suicides that women attempt more whereas men commit more,” he said, adding that it might be because a man’s ego never allowed him to take help.Dr Roy said that it was high time the authorities here addressed suicides as a grave issue that needed to be addressed. There ought to be an emergency helpline number, which people having suicidal thoughts could dial and seek help.“It is a proven fact that a person, who is about to commit suicide, would want to speak to someone as a last resort. Having an emergency hotline number would help at times like these,” he said, adding that often, women would make a last-minute attempt to reach out to someone, which in turn saved them from possible death.

Title: UP: 3 policemen suspended in Deoria for beating youth
Content:
Representative image

GORAKHPUR: Three policemen of Madanpur police station in Deoria were suspended on late Wednesday night after a video in which cops were seen brutally beating a youth went viral.As per reports, the youth identified as Sumit Goswami, was accused of theft.Deoria SP Shri Pati Mishra suspended two constables Mauleshwar Singh, Jitendra Yadav and a Diwan (police clerk) Lal Bihari.Mishra told TOI, “On Wednesday, someone informed at dial 112 that a phone had been stolen. The dial 112 constables brought the accused Goswami to the police station in the afternoon and brutally beat him up. The video was sent to the DM and after Goswami filed a complaint, an FIR was lodged against the two constables and the clerk of the police station.”“The have been suspended and a probe has been initiated against them,” he added.In Video: UP cops brutally thrash youth suspected of theft, 3 suspended

Title: Retired cop found dead at construction site in Naini
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Allahabad: A retired head constable (promoted) was found dead under mysterious circumstances at his under-construction house within the limits of Naini police station in trans Yamuna area on Friday morning.

The deceased identified as Ramashankar Ram (61) was a resident of Naini and had retired from Kaushambi district jail last year.

He was constructing his house on FCI Godown road in Naini area for the past two months.

SSP, Allahabad, Satyarth Anirudh Pankaj told TOI that the case came to the fore when son of retired policeman, Raghvendra reached the site on Friday morning and found his father dead.

On being alerted, a police team from Naini, along with forensic experts, rushed to the spot and carried out investigations. The body was sent for post mortem.

SSP said that Ramashankar had reached the site on Thursday evening as the construction of the roof was to be started from Friday morning.

“Although the cause of death can only be revealed once we get the post mortem report, we have come to know that there was a dispute between Ramashankar and his neighbour over the laying of raw materials for the construction of roof,” said Pankaj.

“There was an injury mark on back of the body,” he added.

Title: ‘Expedite bullet train, metro works’
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Anil Mukim

GANDHINAGAR: Expressing displeasure over the slow progress of the bullet train project and three city metro rail projects, chief secretary Anil Mukim asked various departments concerned to expedite implementation of these projects. On Thursday, Mukim chaired a high-level meeting of officials to review the progress of the Ahmedabad-Mumbai bullet train project and the city metro rail projects of Ahmedabad, Gandhinagar and Surat.

The meeting was attended by the top officials of state’s revenue, urban development and industry & mines departments, apart from officials of the metro rail corporation, railways and other agencies concerned.

The CS reviewed land acquisition status for the bullet train project and expressed dissatisfaction over the slow pace of acquiring land for the project. “Development of Sabarmati railway station and Surat railway station as the two main junctions for the bullet train was also discussed. The CS asked officials to finalize the design aspects of these two stations at the earliest,” said an official privy to the development.

Title: CAA violence: Police use cellphone tower data to trace miscreants
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Burning: A file picture of violence in Mangaluru on December 19

Mangaluru: The Mangaluru city police , who are probing violence during anti CAA and NRC protests in the city, that resulted in the death of two people, have started collecting data of people who were present during the protest, by using data from mobile towers.

According to sources, the collection of data through mobile towers will help police identify miscreants who were present during the violence.

Meanwhile, this will also help police to file a watertight case as it has accurate details about a person’s presence in a particular locality during the incident. The probing officers are also checking the presence of people from Kerala on December 19 in and around the Bunder area, where violence happened.

“We have collected data from all the phones that were operating when violence took place in a particular area. The data is huge and it’s a cumbersome task to isolate those who were involved in the violence. The process in going on in full swing, and it is giving us accurate details. We have collected a substantial amount of data. This will help to nail the miscreants easily, since it proves their physical presence when the violence was taking place,” said a source from the police department on condition of anonymity, adding that the police are extra careful to ensure that no innocent people are harassed.

“Usually in a mobile tower network, thousands of phones operate in a day. The place where the incident took place is in a central business district, that has a heavy movement of people throughout the day. We are carefully analysing all mobile phones and calls made in the area on December 19,” the source added.

A team comprising senior police officers from Bengaluru with local police personnel in Mangaluru, are involved in this particular probe area.

“We have now collected data and the process of isolating suspects is under way. It will take a few days to get a clear picture. Apart from cellphone details, police also have CCTV footage and videos obtained from various agencies,” sources said.

Police are also probing if there is any involvement of people from Kerala in the violence.

“There are some phone numbers from Kerala that were in the area on the day of the violence, but we cannot say that they were involved. It may be that they came here on business or for other reasons. We will serve them a notice and seek an explanation from them, based on which action will be taken,” added a source.

Title: Kolkata to turn into fortress during PM visit; routes yet to be decided
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Prime Minister Narendra Modi

KOLKATA: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s two-day visit to the city is turning out to be a major security challenge after the Special Protection Group (SPG)’s advance liaison team suggested that he should take the road from the Kolkata airport to the city centre on Saturday and a riverine route to Belur .

While the details are yet to be firmed up, sources said Kolkata Police, on the other hand, had suggested the PM should use an IAF helicopter from the airport to the racecourse helipad, which would cut down on his travel time by an hour. Defence personnel are assisting state and central agencies to plan the security road map for the PM’s itinerary.

According to a source, Modi has three engagements in the city on Saturday. First, he is supposed to visit Currency Building at 5:30pm, then Millennium Park at 7pm and finally, Belur Math at 7.50pm before he returns to Raj Bhawan for the night. He is scheduled to attend a dinner, hosted by governor Jagdeep Dhankhar. The next morning, he will attend a programme at Netaji Indoor Stadium around 11am, where chief minister Mamata Banerjee is an invitee. Modi will leave Kolkata after the function.

Central Kolkata was likely to turn into a fortress , a source said. Police and SPG will take over all places, where the PM is supposed to visit, from Friday night. “While the essential drill, including multiple layers of security and deployment of commandos and combat forces in high-rises and towers, will be carried out, special effort is being made to set up multiple-layer barricades on the entire route. Traffic will be halted before the PM convoy moves. Security agencies are coordinating with Navy on whether Modi would travel to Belur in a special vessel or not,” the source said.

The security will be several notches tighter given the ongoing protests. While the agitation at the airport has been withdrawn, a protest at Kaikhali on VIP Road is still on. Another demonstration has been lined up outside Raj Bhawan, and both Left and Congress have planned to wave black flag. Left legislative leader Sujan Chakraborty has urged citizens to hit the streets. “People of Bengal will show the PM the mood of the state against CAA-NPR-NRC even if Trinamool doesn’t protest that day... He won’t have a smooth entry here,” he said.

Title: Delhi: Who’s accountable, asks hit-&-run victim’s sister
Content:
Siddharth Sharma

NEW DELHI: Shilpa Mittal , the sister of Siddharth Sharma , a business consultant who was mowed down by a speeding Mercedes being driven by a teenager near Civil Lines in April 2016 , is disappointed by the Supreme Court verdict that ordered the accused to be treated as a juvenile in conflict with law.Speaking to TOI, Mittal rued that she now has to go back to Juvenile Justice Board (JJB) for trial. “It is a failure of our justice system when the apex court agrees that there is a loophole in the law, but cannot do anything about it. Because your system is flawed and incapable, you are accepting this. All you can say is sorry, but sorry doesn’t bring a dead man alive,” she said.Mittal said that such a decision coming from Supreme Court was totally unacceptable. “If a person commits a crime, the system grants justice to the victim. When you know the law is faulty and let the culprit go away, who should be held accountable then?” she questioned.“If the court’s decision was the other way round, it would have set an example for others. In this case, no one was being sent to prison for 100 years. It was just to set an example. You should come up and say there is a loophole. I don’t know whom to turn to now,” Mittal said.Talking about how the law had changed post the Nirbhaya case, Mittal said, “You are saying heinous crime, but the word minimum is mentioned too. This is childish and a complete joke. I don’t know whether to laugh or howl or cry. Clearly, the system is promoting the culprit. Who knows if he will again go and kill someone else because before my brother, he had another accident. Four years have gone down the drain.”In Video: Delhi: Who is accountable, asks hit-and-run case victim's sister

Title: Kerala all set for digital trials
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan

KOCHI: A statewide project connecting 53 jails with 372 courts using video conferencing would be inaugurated by chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan at the high court on Friday.

In the first stage, facilities have been arranged in five districts — Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Alappuzha, Pathanamthitta and Kottayam — for connecting 38 studios located at 14 jails with 136 courts. This would be followed by, Ernakulam, Thrissur, Idukki, Kannur and Kozhikode in the second phase and Palakkad, Wayanad, Kasaragod and Malappuram in the third phase. The second and third phase would be implemented by February 28 and March 31, respectively.

Addressing the media in Kochi on Thursday, senior prisons department officials said once the system is implemented, police department would get back service of as many 800 police personnel who gets deputed for escorting the accused.

This would also prevent prisoners from smuggling in contraband which they collect during the trip to court and back. The risk of dangerous criminals escaping or attacking the officials accompanying them during their transportation can also be avoided, said officials.

Title: 682 attacks by 'anti-national elements' in 2018; Reds most violent
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

File image used for representation.

NEW DELHI: 'Anti-national elements' - a category that includes jihadi terrorists, leftwing extremists, north-east insurgents and other terrorists - accounted for a total 682 attacks across the country in 2018, up from 575 in 2017. These attacks were targeted at police stations, security camps, railway infrastructure, telephone exchanges and towers, schools and economic establishments.

As per the NCRB report on 'Crime in India 2018', 163 civilians, including four informers, were killed by the 'anti-national elements' - a nomenclature first introduced in the 2017 report - in the said year. They also killed 117 security personnel, including from the police, central paramilitary forces , Army , Home Guards and special police officers. In 2017, they had killed 137 civilians and 132 security personnel.

The data shows that leftwing extremists were most violent, having carried out 355 attacks on police stations and government/private property, for which a total 621 cases were registered. Jihadi terrorists were next with 163 such attacks, followed by "other terrorists" behind 96 attacks and north-east insurgents responsible for 68 attacks.

NCRB put the total number of terrorists killed during 2018 at 247, including 142 Naxalites , 52 jihadi terrorists and 51 'other terrorists'. In 2017, a total 271 'anti-national elements' were killed.

While Naxalites were responsible for 94 civilian deaths and 51 fatal casualties among security forces , jihadi terrorists killed 49 civilians and 44 security personnel, 'other terrorists' 16 civilians and 19 security personnel and north-east insurgents, four civilians and three security personnel.

The "anti-national elements" looted 1,051 arms - including 54 rifles, 15 AK-series guns, 14 SLRs and 16 INSAS rifles - from police and central forces in 2018. Other items snatched away by anti-national elements included 17 night vision cameras, 18 GPS sets and 17 binoculars. Recoveries from 'anti-national elements' in 2018 included over Rs 49 lakh in cash, 302 mobiles, 18 wireless sets, eight binoculars, and two night vision cameras, apart from 70 kg of drugs.

According to NCRB, data for some states is provisional as clarifications are still pending from West Bengal, Assam, Arunachal Pradesh, Meghalaya and Sikkim.

Read this story in Bengali.

Title: Draw for devotion: Magh Mela starts today
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Allahabad: Over 3,500 security personnel spread across a 20-bigha area and a huge army of administrative officials would be ready to greet devotees when the Magh Mela kicks off in Allahabad on Friday.

The 43-day Magh Mela will start on Friday with the Paush Purnima snan and would end with the snan on Magha Purnima. The administration expects over 40 lakh pilgrims to visit the event. The estimate includes lakhs of kalpwasis, who would start camping along the banks of Ganga for a month while braving the cold.

During the entire month, kalpwasis camp along the banks and and lead an austere lifestyle to earn ‘punya’ (blessings). “It is believed that a holy dip on Paush Purnima liberates the soul from the cycle of birth and death,” said a local seer.

At the same time, thundershowers since the past two days have created new problems for the Mela administration, which had already been struggling to stem the damage unleashed by September’s floods. The rain has left a large part of the Magh Mela venue marshy and slippery. The authorities are trying to contain some of the damage by laying sand on the slippery ground. On the other hand, many organisations camping on the venue have been protesting at the Mela Adhikari’s office demanding more facilities.

“We are trying our best to provide all the facilities to the devotees and Kalpwasi’s coming to the mela despite adverse weather conditions”, said Mela Adhikari, Rajnish Mishra.

Magh Mela would be another test for both the police and administrative brass in Allahabad, given the praise it earned from various corners for organising the grand Kumbh Mela last year.

During the snan, devotees are expected to take a holy dip in the rivers, perform various rituals and donate to the needy. The Mela attracts devotees not only from UP, but from other states like Madhya Pradesh, Bihar and Jharkhand too.

A local priest camping on the Magh Mela venue said, “Paush Purnima marks the beginning of a month-long period of austerity which is observed during the Hindu month of ‘Magh’.” Local priests said that the ‘muhurat’ (auspicious timing) for a holy dip on Paush Purnima would start from 2.34am on Friday and end at 12.50pm on Saturday.

According to police, traffic restrictions will be introduced to streamline vehicular movement on routes leading up to the Mela venue on Friday. Besides, the entry of vehicles into the Mela ground too has been banned.

The authorities have made separate arrangements for vehicles and pedestrians to avoid chaos and jams on pontoon bridges. Pedestrians would be given the priority and be allowed to pass on pontoon bridges and Sangam area on snan days.

The Mela venue is replete with facilities like hospitals, primary health centres, transportation, sanitation, ghats, security, firefighting services, ration distribution, lost & found camp, potable water, pollution control and other civic amenities .

Teams of STF, ATS, bomb diffusal squads and anti-sabotage squad would be patrolling on ghats to ensure safety of the visitors. Meanwhile, companies of CRPF and PAC personnel along with hundreds of policemen have been deployed on the venue as part of security arrangements.

The administration has constructed temporary ghats stretching along five kilometres for the convenience of devotees wanting to bathe in the rivers. Jal Police personnel will also be deployed to check cases of drowning.

Title: Murli Manohar Joshi too joins call for removal of JNU VC
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Former HRD minster and senior BJP functionary Murli Manohar Joshi

NEW DELHI: Former HRD minster and senior BJP functionary Murli Manohar Joshi on Thursday called for the removal of JNU vice-chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar, saying it is “shocking” that the VC is adamant on not implementing a government proposal to resolve fee-hike crisis in the varsity.

In the tweet, Joshi said: “Reports are, that the HRD ministry had twice advised the JNU VC to implement certain reasonable and working formula for resolving the issue of enhanced fees in JNU. He was also advised to reach out to the teachers and students. It is shocking that the VC is adamant for not implementing the government proposal. This attitude is deplorable and in my opinion such a VC should not be allowed to continue on this post.”

Joshi’s comments add to the clamour for Kumar’s removal. The human resource development ministry has, however, ruled out his removal saying sacking him was not the solution.

Title: Gujarat high court notice over continued imposition of Section 144
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: The Gujarat high court on Thursday sought an explanation from the state government over a petition challenging the continued imposition of Section 144 of the Criminal Procedure Code (CrPC) and Section 37 of the Bombay Police Act in the city. The petition has been filed by a faculty member at the Indian Institute of Management, Ahmedabad, (IIM-A) and four others, terming it suppressive.

The petitioners claimed that the persistent imposition of these sections has made Ahmedabad a war zone indefinitely, as if it is in permanent danger. It takes away the people’s right to get together to express themselves. They approached the HC after police detained students from outside the IIM-A campus on December 16, when they were protesting the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA).

During the hearing, Justice S H Vora suggested that the authorities publish in newspapers the reasons along with the notification imposing Section 144 of the CrPC and Section 37 of the Bombay Police Act, prohibiting gatherings of more than four persons in public.

The petitioners complained that the restrictions have been in place in the city for the last three years. The people protesting did not know about this restriction were hence detained. The repetitive invocation of these provisions is against Article 19(1) of the Constitution.

The court said that the authorities should state why they are apprehensive of a nuisance and it should justify what nuisance is in its their notification. There must be specific purpose and reason for invoking these provisions or the people standing at pan parlours could also be detained.

The state government submitted that the existing notification under Section 144 of CrPC would lapse after two days. The court was also told that the government granted 107 permissions to people who wanted to protest CAA-NRC. Some of the gatherings turned violent as well.

The HC is to hear this matter further on January 22.

Title: Kerala: Muslim organizations divided over Quassim Suleimani’s killing
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Quassim Suleimani

KOZHIKODE: Muslim community in Kerala is divided over the killing of Quassim Suleimani, the commander of Iran’s Quds Force who was murdered by the US forces in Iraq last Friday.

While majority of the Salafis hailed killing of Suleimani, others believes that the murder is an attempt by the US to foment trouble in the Middle East.

In an article published in ‘Vichinthanam’, Kerala Nadvathul Mujahideen (KNM) state secretary A I Abdul Majeed Swalahi said the murder is a huge blow to Iran’s attempt to export Shia agenda in other countries.

“Suleimani is Iran’s general but his activities are mainly in other countries,” Swalahi told TOI.

The article says Suleimani is the one who exported Iran-sponsored terrorism to Syria, Lebanon, Iraq and Yemen. He was killed while trying to implement the dream project of Iran in Iraq, said Swalahi in the article.

Suleimani was heading the Shia project in the Arab-Islamic world by interfering into internal conflicts of the Arab world. Swalahi accused Suleimani of helping Shia militant groups and exploiting every opportunity for ‘Shiaization.’

“Suleimani’s death will be a blow to the Hezbollah in Lebanon, Houthis in Yemen and al-Ikhwan al-Muslimin (Muslim Brotherhood) in Egypt. Iran has been pumping millions of dollars to pursue the Shia interests in Iraq, Lebanon and Yemen and there was dissent in the country against these attempts,” he said.

“Suleimani’s hands are stained with the blood of infants in Yemen and Syria; he is not to be hailed as a hero,” Swalahi said, adding that with his death Iran’s attempts to interfere in the political affairs of other countries to implement the Shia agenda will be temporarily halted.

P Koya, national executive member of Popular Front of India (PFI), said that the Salafis have taken a stand against Suleimani because of their influence of Saudi Arabia. “Suleimani was a brave fighter. Saudi Arabia and Iran may have their own national interests, but that cannot be a reason for demonizing the general,” he said.

Jama’at-e-Islami thinks that it would be improper to brand Suleimani a terrorist. “He is the general of the army of a country. If he is a terrorist, then the generals of the armies of every country that wages war should be treated so,” said Sheikh Muhammad Karakkunnu, secretary of Jama’at-e-Islami.

“It is baseless to say that Suleimani had some truck with Muslim Brotherhood, which is basically a Sunni organization,” he said.

“The allies of the US, including Israel, have distanced themselves from the attack on Suleimani. They are persuading America to withdraw from a showdown in view of the deteriorating economic situation in the world,” he added.

Title: KMC to increase income from different sources
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Kanpur: The house of Kanpur Municipal corporation ( KMC ) decided to increase its income from different sources. The decisions taken by the house include making the city hoarding free like Indore and bring the houses in tax net which are out of the tax ambit. Besides this, morning walkers and cattle owners would have to pay more.

Municipal commissioner Akshay Tripathi said that around 1.5 lakh houses which are out of tax ambit would be brought under the tax net in order to increase KMC's income.

The corporators gave their nod to increase the rent of the mobile toilet and entry fee in Kargil Park up to Rs 10.

The fine for stray cattle has been also enhanced, and now cattle owners would be required to pay Rs 5000 and an additional sum of Rs 150 per day for feeding stray animals. Similarly, charges for door-to-door garbage collection has also been increased between Rs 25 to Rs 6,000 in different categories.

The municipal commissioner informed the corporators that at present the door-to-door garbage collection was being done in 30 wards and soon it would be extended to other wards.

Title: 5-year subsidy for new investors, says Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Pinarayi Vijayan

KOCHI: In an attempt to woo investors and increase job creation in the state, the state government will subsidize new industrial projects, based on the number of employees. While inaugurating ASCEND Kerala 2020, a global investors’ meet, in Kochi on Thursday, chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan declared that the government will be offering a five-year subsidy for investors who are going to invest in Kerala from April 2020 onwards.

“This will be applicable to all new projects that are going to be registered from April 1, 2020 to March 31, 2025. The registered project will not take off the very next day and hence we are factoring in that and are giving a five-year period for completion of the project,” Vijayan said.

“We might give a substantial amount as a subsidy, but subject to the approval after further discussions. One thing is sure, the subsidy amount for a woman worker will be Rs 2,000 higher than that of a man – we are also aiming women empowerment through this project. Our ultimate aim is to eradicate unemployment in Kerala within the next 20 years,” he said.

However, the subsidy scheme will be offered only to those investors who enrol their employees with ESI and PF schemes. “With this project, we are expecting 37 lakh families to be brought under the social security net,” he said.

The CM also announced a number of other measures to increase ease of doing business. The local self-governments will be asked to create a conducive environment for employment generation, Vijayan said. “We will ask them to help create five new jobs every year for every 1,000 people in their area,” he said.

Another major announcement was the relaxation on the limit of land holdings of companies. “Currently there is a land ceiling of 15 acres a company could hold and this is restricting the operations of industries here. Hence, a company which has Rs 250 crore investments or employee strength of 1,000 will be exempted from this,” Vijayan said.

The ceiling for financial aid from Kerala industrial development corporation (KSIDC), fixed years ago, will be raised from the current Rs 35 crore to Rs 100 crore, chief minister said, adding that in deserving cases, this could even go beyond the limit.

RP Group chairman Ravi Pillai said that the Kerala MSME Facilitation Act 2019 had been hugely beneficial to the majority of industrial units in the state, as they belong to the MSME segment.

M A Yusuffali, chairman, LuLu Group, said that those who complain about the traffic congestion in Kerala should visit other states to understand the comparatively worse situations in those places.

Title: Mangaluru: Gold worth Rs 63.7 lakh seized
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

MANGALURU: Customs officers at Mangaluru International Airport (MIA) thwarted attempts by passengers to smuggle gold and seized 1.6kg of gold valued at Rs 63.7 lakh in three separate cases on Monday and Tuesday. Officers arrested passengers in two of these cases since the value of gold seized was in excess of Rs 20 lakh, the department stated in separate tweets on Thursday. The modus operandi of smuggling was the same in two of the three cases.

In the first instance, officers on Monday seized 336.7g (net) gold of 24-karat purity in paste form valued at Rs 13.4 lakh from a passenger who arrived from Dubai. The gold was concealed in socks that the passenger had worn. On Tuesday, gold of 24-karat purity weighing 716g (net) valued at Rs 29.1 lakh was seized from a passenger who arrived from Dubai. The gold was seized in paste form concealed in the body. The passenger was arrested.

Again, on Tuesday, custom officers were back in action, seizing 24K purity gold weighing 523g (net) valued at Rs 21.2 lakh from a passenger who arrived from Dubai. Gold in paste form concealed in the body was seized. The customs officials did not reveal the identity of the accused in the above three cases as it would hamper their investigation, and divulged information through tweets from their handle @Cusmglr.

Title: Police’s fear of trade unions shameful: HC
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Kochi: A police force that is unable to provide protection to unload materials from a lorry citing opposition from trade union workers is a shame to the state, the high court said on Thursday. Considering a contempt of court petition against Idukki SP T Narayanan and Kumily CI V K Jayaprakash, justice PB Suresh Kumar asked whether this is the business-friendly atmosphere being projected by Kerala.

The contempt of court case was filed by Cochin Granites after being obstructed by Kumily unit of Head Load and General Workers Union while unloading Kota stones brought to Government Higher Secondary School, Kumily. The stones were brought to the site on a lorry on December 7, 2019 and the petitioner firm had unloaded 75% stones using its registered workers. When four workers of the union obstructed, help was sought from Kumily CI. When police failed to provide protection, the firm approached the HC which ordered for providing protection to unload stones on December 12. Alleging contempt of court against police officers, the petitioner has alleged that no protection was granted despite producing the court’s orders. Asking the inspector to inform the steps taken to implement the orders in person, the court has scheduled further hearing on Monday.

Title: Dehradun: Anglo Indian MLA can approach government to review demand, says BJP chief
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Ajay Bhatt

DEHRADUN: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) state president Ajay Bhatt on Thursday said Anglo-Indian legislator George Ivan Gregory Mann has the option to approach the government with his demand for a review of the 126th Constitutional Amendment Bill, which seeks to exclude the Anglo-Indian quota in state assemblies and Lok Sabha.

The Union BJP government on January 7 had ratified the 126th constitutional amendment, which extended the SC/ST quota for another 10 years but ignored a similar quota for legislative representation of Anglo-Indians. Upset by the development, Mann had claimed the data used to discontinue the quota was faulty and wanted BJP to review the decision of excluding the community.

Speaking on the issue, BJP state president Ajay Bhatt said, “The (SC/ST) amendment was passed by Parliament. If the MLA thinks it should be reviewed, then he should write to the government.
