Our party position is very clear that SC/ST reservation must stay, and since the population of Anglo-Indians is in the country is now very low, so the matter of their quota will be decided later." Bhatt added that according to census data, the total population of Anglo-Indians in India is not more than 500.

“If he [Mann] has any issue with the census data, he can write to the government and seek a review. The decision to not extend the quota was taken on the basis of the low number,” said Bhatt. Regarding the ratification of the 126th amendment, BJP legislator Mahendra Bhatt had recently said that well-off SC/ST community members must not get benefits of reservation. In response, BJP state president Bhatt said, “It was his personal view, and not the party’s position. ”

Title: Provide treatment to Bhim Army chief Chandra Shekhar Azad: Delhi court
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

File photo of Bhim Army chief Chandra Shekhar Azad

NEW DELHI: A Delhi court on Thursday directed Tihar Jail authorities to facilitate medical treatment to jailed Bhim Army chief Chandra Shekhar Azad , who is suffering from a blood-thickening disorder , at AIIMS , where he is already undergoing treatment.

“Since the doctors from AIIMS have reported that the accused is suffering from polycythemia and the fact that the accused has been getting treatment from AIIMS for the last one year, this court hereby directs the jail superintendent concerned at Tihar Jail to ensure that the accused is treated... be given therapeutic phlebotomy and be taken for treatment at AIIMS, where his treatment is already going on.

According to the plea filed by Azad’s lawyers, his condition “requires continuous check-up from the doctors concerned”. The plea further said, “The treatment of the accused is going for a long time under the supervision of the doctor concerned and requires day-to-day check. Medical attention needs to be given for as and when, within a week or maximum 10 days, when the blood turns thick, it can be let out by the procedure of “phlebotomy”, the plea said. “If it is not done, it may become a cause of cardiac attack,” it added.

Azad was arrested after he surrendered before Delhi Police in the early hours on December 21 and was refused bail and sent to Tihar Jail for 14 days in judicial custody by a court. Delhi Police has alleged that the accused persons, including Azad, indulged in violence in the garb of CAA and NRC protests.

Title: Nirankari Sant Samagam from Jan 24
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Nashik: The three-day 53rd annual state Nirankari Sant Samagam of Sant Nirankari Mandal will begin from January 24 in the city.

The preparations are in full swing with enthusiasm as the devotees have started putting up the stalls and the pandal. The community is preparing to welcome lakhs of devotees from various parts of the world.

“The event will be conducted in the presence of Satguru Mata Sudiksha Ji Maharaj, the head of Sant Nirankari Mission,” said the authorities.

It will be held at Thakkar Ground, Makhmalabad, Peth which is on Gujarat Highway.

“The programme will begin at 2pm when the devotees will share their experiences through speeches, hymns and prayers, followed by a discourse by the head of Sant Nirankari Mission at 9 pm. ,” the officials added.

The event will also include an exhibition for children and a mass marriage programme.

Title: Maestro offers spell of art and introspection
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Pandit Ajoy Chakrabarty

Pandit Ajoy Chakrabarty’s concert ended at 3am on Thursday, yet at about 11.15am he sang a few notes into the phone to elucidate the concept of vaad-samvaad to TOI. "Vaad-samvaad is the fifth-note relationship: sa-pa, re-dha...this relationship is harmony," Pandit Chakrabarty, the titan of the Patiala-Kasur Gharana, told TOI. Panditji’s sunny explication showed that he is both a maestro and a master at every moment. In fact, Pandit Ravi Shankar had applauded Pandit Chakrabarty’s efforts to teach Indian classical music.

Saptak is commemorating Pandit Ravi Shankar’s 100th birth centenary year. So at the start of his concert on Day 8, on Wednesday, Pandit Chakrabarty played a reminder of the sitar legend’s extraordinary range. "I chose Kalavati because Pandit Ravi Shankarji played a lot of Carnatic ragas," Pandit Chakrabarty said. "I sang in the North Indian style. Kalavati, Hamsadhvani, Charukeshi, and Saraswati...these are all basically Carnatic ragas, but are appreciated in both styles."

Pandit Chakrabarty had prefaced his Kalavati essay by questioning those who are dismissive of ragas such as Hamsadhvani. "Why is Hamsadhvani considered a small raga ? Is it because it has only five notes? Bhoopali also has only five notes," Pandit Chakrabarty told TOI. "But in Bhoopali, there are many instances of samvaad. Ragas are fully elaborated when vaad-samvaad relationships are maximum in number."

Saptak rasikas were lucky to be part of this spell of art and introspection.

Title: Controversies & irregularities mired AU VC’s four-year stint
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Allahabad: The four-year stint of Prof RL Hangloo as the vice-chancellor of Allahabad University ( AU ) was mired with a series of controversies and allegations.

Besides financial and administrative irregularities, he was also accused of favouritism, sexual misconduct and improper handling of complaints of sexual harassment and lack of grievance cell for redressal of complaints.

A three-member team is likely to visit AU campus to probe allegations against Prof Hangloo, who resigned on January 1. Former president of Allahahad University Students’ Union (AUSU) Rohit Mishra said, “We will meet the three-member probe team and hand over to it all the relevant papers, corroborating the allegations levelled by us.” Fingers were raised on teachers’ selection process at AU and its constituent colleges in 2018-19.

Allegations were made that interviews of candidates at constituent colleges lasted 3-4 minutes only.

At CMP Degree College, more than 210 candidates were called for interviews for 14 posts of assistant professors and, on an average, 65-70 candidates were interviewed on first two days between 10am and 5pm. On the third day, however, nearly 60 candidates where interviewed in just three hours.

Candidates claimed that many aspirants who were selected were either related to top-ranking university officials or teachers. Eyebrows were also raised on the selection of two administrative functionaries on “illegally instituted posts” at AU (OSDs to VC and Registrar). The OSD to VC was appointed against the post of semi-professional assistant, a post which is exclusively meant for library for which the essential qualification is BLib (bachelor of library sciences), which he did not possess. Same was the case with a number of other appointments where meritorious candidates, who were pursuing courses at eminent universities of US and UK and had research papers published in reputed journals were not selected.

Names of selection committee members were also out before the commencement of interviews and the worst part was that the selection committee was same for CMP and Shyama Prasad degree college in gross violation of UGC guidelines. In 2018, the campus was rocked by two audio tapes of purported talks between the VC and his Delhi-based female friend.

On September 5, 2018, a student leader leaked an alleged WhatsApp conversation between Prof Hangloo and the said lady which allegedly had some explicit content too. Prof Hangloo was also in news for facilitating plum postings for his close aides. The person appointed as estate officer as well as in charge of legal cell by Prof Hangloo, was the one against whom the UP Government had written several letters to AU (when it was a state university) and four committees appointed by the respective VCs also gave adverse reports against him.

Likewise, the terms of appointment of registrar and finance officer were changed after interview and selection by EC in April 2017, which constrained selected persons to refuse appointment.

Prof Hangloo was also accused of financial irregularities as it was his decision not to pay former teachers of AU as guest faculty. Later in 2018, the teachers got relief from Allahabad high court and were paid Rs 1.5 crore for a period of around two months without taking even a single class. During his tenure, decision to shut down the Institute of Correspondence Course was taken which left more than 100 employees jobless. The decision was challenged in the high court which, in a recent judgment, quashed the decision and directed that the employees be paid their salary of nearly three years. The implementation of the judgment is likely to cost over Rs 40 crore to the university.

AU panel for security: Slammed with allegations of lax security at Women’s Hostel campus, Allahabad University (AU) will now set up a committee to look into hostel inmates’ safety. During a meeting on Thursday, AU officiating vice-chancellor KS Mishra said a legal awareness programme would also be organised in hostels and CCTV cameras would be set up only at WH’s main gate and kitchen area.

Title: Locate more zones to accommodate vendors: Punjab and Haryana high court
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Vendors argue that they are finding it difficult to make a living as they were shifted to Sector 15 ‘without a... Read More

CHANDIGARH: Giving no interim relief to street vendors, the Punjab and Haryana high court on Wednesday directed the municipal corporation (MC) to file a progress report in the case and locate more zones to accommodate them while segregating the cases pertaining to Punjab, Chandigarh and Haryana.

The court also directed the civic body to provide basic amenities to vendors, warning officials not to abuse statutory provisions of the Street Vendors (Protection of Livelihood and Regulation of Street Vending) Act, 2014, or they would have to pay penalty from their pockets. The court also directed the MC to apprise it about ‘natural markets’ mentioned in the Act.

The matter would come up for hearing on March 26.

The counsel for the vendors argued that they had been shifted to Sector 15 without application of mind and were struggling to make a living. The vendors claimed the authorities had flouted rules by removing them from ‘natural market’. Under the Act, ‘natural markets’ are those established more than 50 years ago, they said. “Sector 22 was established in 1956 and is a natural market. Still, the authorities removed vendors from there against the rules,” the counsel said.

It was argued vendors were facing the wrath of nature, to which the court directed the MC to provide them with basic amenities. Vendors objected to pucca sites, demanding they be shifted to places having more footfalls. The court observed that resource feasibility had to be taken into account and the administration too was grappling with the issue.

Earlier, MC commissioner Kamal Kishore Yadav filed a status report in the court, mentioning that the MC started the process of relocation of registered vendors as per law from December 6, 2019. The MC claimed it scrutinised and forwarded grievances submitted by market association/resident welfare association and others to the sub-committee which held a meeting on December 2, 2019. The report said the MC allotted 1,038 sites on December 4. The total sites allotted in phases 1, 2, 3 and 4 draw of lots were 4,284 under E-ESP category. Till December 12, 2,845 out of the 4,284 registered street vendors had been shifted.

Title: Deepika-starrer ‘Chhapaak’ declared tax-free by Nath govt
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Bhopal: Two days after actor Deepika Padukone stood in solidarity with protesters at JNU, Madhya Pradesh chief minister Kamal Nath on Thursday declared her upcoming movie, ‘Chhapaak’, tax-free. On the same day, BJP leader Gopal Bhargava attacked Deepika and suggested she stick to “dancing in Mumbai”.

Chhapaak, the reel biography of an acid attack victim, is due for release on January 10. Nath took to Twitter to announce his decision and said the film gives a positive message to society.

“I declare the Deepika Padukone-starrer ‘Chhapaak’, based on acid attack survivors, and set for release on January 10 in cinema halls all over the country, tax free in Madhya Pradesh,” tweeted the CM on Thursday.

Padukone had visited the JNU campus in Delhi on Tuesday night to express solidarity with students who were protesting against the January 5 mob attack. She did not address the gathering, but her presence was enough to spark a nationwide debate.

Praising the concept of the movie, Nath said, “The film gives a positive message to society about women who are acid attack survivors, by portraying their story of pain, confidence, struggle, hope and their determination to live and gives a message to bring about a change in society’s thinking in such cases.”

Leader of Opposition (LoP) in MP assembly, Gopal Bhargava used rather coarse words to criticise her. “What are actors and actresses supposed to do among students, whose only work is reading and writing? They should let students do their work and the actress should sit in Mumbai, performing her dance,” Bhargava told reporters at a press conference on CAA in MP’s Harda on Thursday. “Heroines’ work is to dance in Bombay. Why should they go to JNU? Those who are interested in politics, should contest elections to test the waters,” he added.

The state BJP questioned the Congress government’s decision to declare ‘Chhapaak’ tax-free. “Instead of making the film tax-free, the government could have supported and treated acid-attack survivors, given them legal aid and arrested those involved in such crimes. Chief minister Kamal Nath's decision is politically motivated, meant to take mileage of the situation that has arisen after Deepika's JNU visit,” said BJP state spokesperson Rajneesh Agrawal.

The state Congress strongly objected to Bhargava’s remark. Congress media coordinator Narendra Saluja said, “Bhargava’s statement is shameful. He should then come clear on what he thinks about actresses related to BJP, like Hema Malini, Kiron Kher and Smriti Irani. In fact, the previous BJP government paid lakhs of rupees to Hema Malini and her daughter for their dance performances at state-run events. Where was Bhargava then? His statement is an insult to women.”

Title: Car plunges into Ram Ganga canal, driver safe
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Car in Ram Ganga Canal after the accident in Saandh area

Kanpur: A car plunged into the Ram Ganga canal in Saandh area of the district on late Wednesday night, but the driver managed to come out safely.

Vijay Kumar of Kidwaiagar, driving the vehicle, was on his way to Ghazipur village in the Saandh police area when the mishap occurred. Vijay lost control of the vehicle and it slipped and fell into the Ram Ganga canal. Vijay, somehow, came out of the car and escaped unhurt. Later, he abandoned the vehicle and returned home without informing anyone.

The abandoned car floating in the canal caused a flutter in the early hours of Thursday.

The locals passing through the site alerted local police control room about a white colour car floating in the canal following which a police team from Saandh police station rushed to the spot and initiated swift action. The police with the help of a Pokeland machine pulled the car out from the canal. They later tracked down it's owner Vijay Kumar of Kidwaiagar with the help of it’s registration number plate.

Vijay told police that in order to avoid collision from a vehicle coming from opposite direction, he tried to take a turn but in the process lost control over vehicle and it plunged into the roadside canal.

Title: Students of DU stage art attack against violence
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Hundreds of students gathered at the Arts Faculty on Thursday afternoon to participate in an event organised b... Read More

NEW DELHI: Hundreds of students gathered at the Arts Faculty on Thursday afternoon to participate in an event organised by the Miranda House Queer Collective. The event was held for students to show solidarity with their counterparts from other colleges in their protest against the recent violent attacks.

Unlike other protests in the city, this was one where students were seen carrying musical instruments, candles, ribbons and posters to showcase their dissent through the medium of art . Students also used sloganeering as well as street plays in a bid to ensure that their voices are heard.

“I have been a part of many protests that have taken place in the city of late. This one stands out because here we are not concentrating on mere sloganeering but on creating art that touches the chord and attracts the attention of people. We want more and more of them to join us in our cause and stand in solidarity with the students who have been attacked,” said Chhavi, a student of KMC.

Her friend Tanvi Sharma said that they cannot let the protests die down. “If we sit silent today, tomorrow we will be the ones who will be attacked. We, till sometime back, used to think that universities were among the safest places for students. But our belief has been shattered now,” she added.

The Miranda House Queer Collective had called upon the student community across the city to join the event in solidarity with the students who became the victims of the recent violent attacks on them.

“We are made to feel safe at least by our teachers who are standing with us through this tough time. This is the age in which we should be gathering the maximum education at the universities. But here we are out on the streets to get justice for the students who have been attacked. What is wrong is wrong and attack on students shall never be accepted in a civilised society like ours,” said Karishma Singh, a student from IP university.

Title: Nirbhaya case: Tihar requests for 2 hangmen from UP jails
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

File photo of Nirbhaya case convicts. (Photo: PTI)

Title: Road deaths: Every 2.5km of NHs claimed a life in 2018
Content:
Representative image

NEW DELHI: On an average, every 2.5 km of national highways claimed one life due to road accidents in 2018, according to the latest report of the National Crime Records Bureau ( NCRB ).The report, based on information shared by states, has said 50,771 people died in accidents on the country's NH network and this worked out to 44 deaths per 100 km.According to NCRB, of the total 4.12 lakh accident deaths reported in 2018, only 6,891 were due to natural forces such as lightning, sun stroke and severe cold. Traffic accidents , including railroad crashes , had over 44% share of non-natural fatalities and the death figure was over 1.78 lakh. Road accidents had the lion's share of these fatalities, registering nearly 1.53 lakh deaths. This is nearly 1,000 more deaths than what the road transport ministry report had mentioned recently.While speeding has been identified as the biggest reason behind the high number of road deaths, in the case of railways, fall from train and collision of trains with people on the tracks were responsible for most fatalities.According to NCRB, 16,702 people died in railway accidents due to these reasons. So far as road deaths are concerned, the NCRB report claimed that incidents of "hit and run" went up in 2018. Police registered 47,028 such cases in 2018 compared to 43,727 in 2017."Reducing road deaths remains a big challenge and this cannot be achieved unless all states and enforcement agencies are on board. We have seen how only a few states have implemented the amended motor vehicle law. The alarming number of fatalities shows how we can't wait any further to enforce stricter norms to save lives," said K K Kapila of International Road Federation.

Title: Nishad Park to get facelift to welcome Ganga Yatra
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

(Top) A ghat along Gang in Bithoor and (above) DM Dr Brahma Deo Ram Tiwari along wit others during inspection ... Read More

Kanpur: The Ganga Yatra that is set to commence from Ballia and Bijnour will conclude in Kanpur on January 31. City’s Nishad Park will be beautified elaborately to welcome the teams of Ganga Yatra.

Beginning from Ballia, the Ganga Yatra will reach at Billhaur Tehsil of Kanpur on January 30 and a human chain will welcome the team.

The Yatra will then proceed to Bithoor via Shivrajpur and Chaubeypur. A cultural programme will be organized at Patthar Ghat and a Ganga Arti will be performed.

After a night halt at the guest houses in Bithoor, the team will move to the Ganga Barrage in the city, from where a second team of the Yatra will reach from Bijnour. A cultural programme at Nishad Park will be organized to commemorate the Ganga Yatra.

Kanpur DM Dr Brahma Deo Ram Tiwari and his team on Thursday inspected the proposed venues and finalised one of them.

The DM directed his subordinates and various departments to decorate Nishad Park and install the statue of the`Kewatraj' (boatman).

The park will be themed on Ganga. The story of Ganga’s origin and its journey over the years will be displayed in pictures.

The DM has also instructed to set up a permanent music system at the park which will play Aarti and Bhajans on Ganga at the Barrage. Ganga-themed lazor light shows will also be held which will then become a permanent attraction of the park. Adequate seating arrangements will be ensured at the park.

The DM also inspected the place where the boat of the second team from Bijnour will drop its anchor.

Addressing other officials, he said, “Chief minister Yogi Adityanath and governor Anandiben Patel were likely to attend the function. Therefore, all arrangements should be completed in due time.”

During the inspection, municipal commissioner Akshay Tripathi, chief development officer Sunil Kumar Singh and officers of the Namami Gange programme, irrigation and other departments were also present.

DM, SDM Billhaur Sri Laxmi, city magistrate Himanshu Gupta and other officials had visited Billhaur tehsil on Wednesday and inspected the route of the Yatra. Tiwari pointed out encroachment and garbage problems in Bithoor and instructed the officials to take action immediately.

Title: Man’s body found hanging in train
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Jhansi: A middle-aged man was found hanging inside an empty compartment of Jhansi-Kanpur Passenger in Jhansi on Thursday. The body was discovered when the train was shunted to the yard. The deceased is yet to be identified.

As per the details, 51803 Jhansi-Kanpur Passenger, which originates from here everyday, was standing at platform number 7 on Thursday morning. One of the passengers noticed a man hanging from the ceiling fan of compartment number 11584 and sounded an alert. GRP personnel arrived and took the body with them.

The man was identified as Jai Singh of Baitul by a ticket recovered from his pocket. A slip with a mobile number was also recovered.

Jhansi Government Railway Police (GRP) said, “We are trying to establish his credentials. The reason behind the act is unknown as of now.”

Title: ASCEND stresses need for innovation
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Kochi: Along with political stability and law and order, Kerala needs stronger, skilled labour, industry-friendliness and innovation boost-up - all of which are on a reform mode, ASCEND 2020 Global Investors Meet noted.

A plenary session on ‘Doing Business in Kerala — Key Enablers for Industrial Reforms’, also highlighted the role of MSMEs (micro, small and medium enterprises), industrial parks and single-window facility in making the state a fast-developing hub for entrepreneurs.

K Ellangovan, principal secretary (industries & Norka), spoke about K-SWIFT (Kerala’s single window interface for fast, transparent clearances), while highlighting its salient points. Launched a year ago to position the state as an investment hotspot, the initiative also aims at boosting the Rebuild Kerala mission.

Sanjay Garg, principal secretary (industries and commerce), said Kerala has of late been a haven for MSMEs, which produce almost a third of the country’s industrial products and nearly half of the exports. He said Kerala had seen the emergence of 55,026 medium and small-scale enterprises since 2016, taking their current total to 1,31,925. Of them, the top units are in agro, textiles and general engineering sectors .

The Kerala state industrial development corporation (KSIDC) MD, M G Rajamanickam, speaking on ‘Single-Window Facility and Support to Investors’, threw light on a couple of recent amendments made to secure licences quicker and smoother.

Kinfra managing director Santhosh Koshy Thomas highlighted the role of the industrial infrastructure development corporation, which had 7,000 acres of land bank along with 700 units and provide direct employment to 20,000 people. Having provided an investment of Rs 1,750 crore, the 1993-founded Kinfra is now readying to realize 24 well-defined industrial parks. “We have identified 20-core competency areas,” he revealed.

Title: 9 hurt in LPG tanker-KSRTC bus collision
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

The gas tanker being towed away after the accident near Karunagappally on Thursday

Kollam: A gas tanker carrying LPG collided with a KSRTC bus that was parked on the roadside at Puthentheruvu, near Karunagappally on the National Highway. Nine people sustained minor injuries.

Timely rescue operation by the fire force and police helped avert a major tragedy. Nine people, including the bus driver and conductor, were injured. They have been admitted to Karungapally taluk hospital. The injured are bus conductor Baby, 44, driver Thulasidharan, passengers Haridevan, 75, Gayathri, 49, Lakshmi, 65, Sukumaran, 70, Suresh, 62, Indira, 68 and Kuttan, 58.

The tanker was carrying LPG from Bengaluru to the LPG bottling plant at Parippally when the driver is believed to have fallen asleep, causing the accident . The incident occurred at 6am when the Kollam-bound KSRTC bus from Vallikkavu was taking a halt.

Soon after the accident, rescue workers reached the spot and switched off the electric lines and blocked traffic through the NH and ensured that no gas leaked from the tanker.

Fire tenders were rushed from Chavara and Karunagapllay to deal with any eventuality. Fire and rescue officers Manoj, Shiji, Abhilash Vipin, Raju and Sudhi led the fire force team. Karunagappally circle inspector Manjulal, Tahsildar Sajitha Beegam and other revenue officials too reached the spot. The driver’s cabin was partially destroyed in the impact. Later, a new cabin was brought from Paripally and the tanker was taken there.

On December 31, 2009, a major accident involving a gas tanker had taken place at Karunagapally .

Continued breach of standard operating procedures have been cited as the cause of recurring accidents.

Title: Mangaluru: Sandalwood worth Rs 2 crore seized; five arrested
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

MANGALURU: Personnel of Panambur police station and the anti-rowdy squad of Mangaluru North sub-division of Mangaluru city police on Wednesday busted a gang that was in the process of illegally exporting red sanders via New Mangalore Port Trust and arrested five people in this connection.

Police also seized red sanders valued at Rs 2 crore and other items, including vehicles used by the accused in this connection, all valued at Rs 2.19 crore.

City police chief P S Harsha in a communique late on Thursday said details of the case were withheld to verify the antecedents of the people accused of attempting to smuggle red sanders.

Based on a tip-off, police raided Venus Enterprises on the road leading to Jokatte from Baikampady Industrial Area and recovered 4,000kg of red sanders valued at Rs 2 crore.

The source of the red sanders is being investigated, Harsha said.

All the accused from Mangaluru taluk

Those arrested are Sheikh Tabrez, 36, and Farooq, 45, and Hussain Kunhi, all from Permannur, Rakesh Shetty, 44, from Kavoor and Lohith, 36, from Thokottu. All the five accused are from Mangaluru taluk, Harsha said.

Police seized a Maruti Brezza, Renault Pulse, Tata Ace, two plywood boxes and seven mobile phones from the accused.

A case has been registered under sections 50, 62, 80, 104 of Karnataka Forest Act and 144, 165 of Karnataka Forest Rules at the Panambur police station in this regard.

Title: Nagpur: MTDC takes over Ambazari garden for tourism development
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

NAGPUR: Two-and-a-half years after obtaining lease from the state government, the Maharashtra Tourism Development Corporation ( MTDC ) took over possession of city’s biggest park — Ambazari garden — from the Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) a couple of days ago.

Through its Mumbai-based PPP operator Garuda Amusements Park (Nagpur) Pvt Ltd, the MTDC has planned to continue the garden and add fitness, recreational, amusement, tourism, club house and commercial activities in the sprawling 44-acre land at a cost of Rs80-100 crore.

Vinay Wavdhane, MTDC’s executive engineer, told TOI that the garden will remain open for morning walkers and visitors on the lines of the NMC. “The operator has been directed to continue pass system for morning walkers. Even the entry fees will remain the same for morning walkers,” he said.

MTDC’s commitment towards morning walkers will prevent criticism from the public. In a letter submitted to the NMC, office-bearers of Jan Samasya Nivaram Manch had feared of setback to morning walkers.

Wavdhane said the operator will have to develop the garden as per the conceptual plan, which will be approved by the MTDC within two years followed by operation and maintenance for 28 more years.

“Earlier, the NMC had developed the garden on only 19 acres and the remaining area was in an abandoned condition. Now, the MTDC will bring the entire land to use. The operator is allowed concrete construction of only 0.15 floor space index (FSI) as the entire area is reserved as green zone. Therefore, there will be no multi-level buildings and all activities will be facilitated in a green and eco-friendly manner,” he said.

It will be MTDC’s first ever PPP project and also the first in an urban city in the state. Without any expenditure, the MTDC is likely to earn Rs1.50 crore per annum from the project.

As per the preliminary conceptual master plan, the MTDC will add a cycling track along the existing walking track, green gym and a recreational hut in the garden. The urban hut of 50 commercial shops will be developed followed by amphitheatre, exhibition & art gallery and herbal/botanic arena.

The children play area will be transformed into a state-of-the-art amusement park which will have water park, fish aquarium, food court and souvenir shops.

Left abandoned by the civic body for decades, the operator will develop the community centre with banquet halls, party lawns, resort of 20 rooms and kitchen. A club house with swimming pool, gymnasium, table tennis court, cards room, badminton court, lawn tennis court, squash room, bar-cum-restaurant, jacuzzi, steam bath etc will be also be developed.

West Nagpur MLA Vikas Thakre said the NMC should take over the garden back as people will lose their property once the private operator starts to develop it. “Any private operator will look for its own benefit. Banquet halls, lawns, club house etc will pollute the green zone and water body. Families visit the garden in large numbers due to low fees. The operator will keep high entry fees for all types of activities,” he said.

“People residing in adjoining areas like Verma layout, Ambazari, Pandhrabodi etc are opposing the move. I will talk to people and raise the issue with the government if all wish the NMC to continue taking care of the garden,” he added.

Title: Haridwar: Forest field officers to get salary hike, a month’s additional pay
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

HARIDWAR: In a major relief to forest field officers , the state government has given an ‘in principle’ approval to provide a salary hike , one month’s additional salary and other perks, apart from acceding to their demands of overhauling the promotion structure. The decision was taken on Wednesday although a final go-ahead from the cabinet is still awaited.

Uttarakhand has approximately 3,640 sanctioned posts of forest guards, of which 1,218 are vacant and out of 1,628 sanctioned posts of foresters, 316 are vacant, whereas out of 408 sanctioned posts of deputy ranger, 197 are vacant. Similarly out of 308 sanctioned posts of forest rangers, 61 lie vacant.

The state is home to some of the most magnificent wildlife sanctuaries and national parks of the country, including two tiger reserves – Corbett Tiger Reserve and Rajaji Tiger Reserve.

Forest minister Harak Singh Rawat said that considering the harsh weather conditions and difficult terrain in which the officials have to protect forest and wildlife, the government decided to increase the pay. “Just like our police force, the forest field force has been actively stopping poaching and safeguarding our natural resources in such extreme weather conditions. They have also been saving precious wildlife like snow leopards and tigers from poachers and protecting medicinal plants like keedajadi from mafias. So, they deserve similar perks and motivation for their hard work.” Rawat said.

Meanwhile, the workers of four unions—State President of Forest Reserve Association, Assistant Forest Staff Union, Deputy Ranger Union and Ranger Union—are demanding the government to give more preference to promotion than direct hiring, especially for the post of forest ranger.

“For the post of forest ranger from deputy ranger, the ratio should be enhanced from existing 50:50 to 66.66:34.34 ratio, out of which 66% posts should be through promotion rather than direct entry. We are demanding this because the experience of having worked for so many years should be given more weightage, as a deputy ranger holds experience of around 20-30 years,” said one of the members of four unions, who participated in the meeting on Wednesday.

Title: Brace for another spell of dry days this weekend
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Water supply will be disrupted in the city on Saturday for the third phase of renovation works at 86mld water-treatment plant at Aruvikkara . The water supply will be shut down for six hours.

The renovation work will be from 2pm to 8pm on Saturday, because of which water supply will be partly or completely disrupted in some areas in the city.

The water pumping from the treatment plant will be restarted at 8pm on Saturday and the supply is expected to be normalized at all areas by 6pm on Sunday.

“The renovation work being taken up in four phases will improve water supply by an additional 10 million litres of water per day (mld). The first and second phases of the renovation were completed on December 13, 2019, and on January 4, respectively,” Kerala water aauthority ( KWA ) said.

The water supply is shut down in four phases for replacing pump sets and other equipment. The old pump sets and pumping lines in two pump houses will be removed and their electrical work will be completed in the third phase. The pump sets and electrical equipment at 86mld water treatment plant date back to two decades; this resulted in reduction of their efficiency and led to water shortage.

The areas were water supply will be disrupted are Kowdiar, Peroorkada, Pipinmoodu, Sathamangalam, Kochar Road, Edapazhanji, Kanakanagar, Vellayambalam, Marappalam, Pattom, Medical College, RCC, Sri Chitra Medical Centre, Kumarapuram, Ulloor, Prasanth Nagar, Akkulam, Cheruvaikal, Pongamoodu, Sreekariyam, Chempazhanthi, Kariyam, Parottukonam, Nalanchira, Mannanthala, Kesavadasapuram, Paruthipara, Chalakuzhy, Muttada, Ambalamukku, Vazhayila, Kudappanakunnu, Jawahar Nagar, Nathancode, Devaswom Board Junction, Poudikonam, Kazhakootam, Kariavattom, Technopark, Manvila, Kulatoor, Pallipuram, Alathara and CRPF Junction.

The fourth phase of the renovation will take place on February 1, and the 86mld and 74mld treatment plants will be shut down for 16 hours.

There are three KWA water-treatment plants at Aruvikkara with capacity of 86mld, 74mld and 72mld. The construction of the new water-treatment plant with a capacity of 75mld is in progress.

During shutdown, KWA will arrange partial supply to Medical College. Tankers will supply water to institutions such as RCC and Sree Chitra Tirunal Institute for Medical Sciences and Technology. KWA will also ensure water supply by tanker to hospitals and police personnel. In addition to KWA tankers, city corporation, police and CRPF will deploy tankers for water supply.

Title: Insurance availed for Rs70 cr, govt tells court
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Kochi: State government has informed the high court that it has availed insurance coverage for up to Rs 70 crores for the damages that may occur during the demolition of illegal apartment complexes at Maradu .

State attorney KV Sohan submitted before the court that insurance for Rs 60 crore has been taken for the area near the apartment named Alfa Serene whereas the area near Golden Kayaloram apartment is covered with an insurance for Rs 10 crore. For the two towers of Alfa Serene, insurance of Rs 25 crore has been availed, the court was told.

The court is considering petitions filed by a builder as well as nearby residents seeking proper insurance coverage and determination of market value of their residential and other buildings. Heera Construction Pvt Ltd, which had built an apartment complex near to Golden Kayaloram, is seeking a court directive to the government to avail insurance for Rs125 crore.

Residents of the areas near the apartment complexes being demolished have also approached the court seeking immediate determination of market value of their buildings so as to ensure proper compensation if damages occur during demolition.

While the first petition was filed by 10 residents, 83 more persons approached the court by Thursday. During the hearing, the court asked why the petitions have been filed only now. The court also asked the government to inform its views on the petitions filed by the residents.

Title: MP Rape Capital Of India 8th Yr In A Row
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Indore: Registering highest number of rape cases in 2018, Madhya Pradesh retained the dubious distinction of remaining the rape capital of the country for eight consecutive years. But police say — all is well, claiming that women are safe here as numbers don’t depict the ground reality.

In National Crime Record Bureau report 2018 released on Wednesday, MP with fifth highest population in the country accounted for 5,433 rape cases out of 33,356 recorded across the country in 2018. MP is followed by Rajasthan and Uttar Pradesh with 4,335 and 3,946 rape cases registered respectively.

DGP VK Singh said that though the state recorded highest number of crimes against women, such incidents have come down to 27,106 from 27,953 in 2017 and 26719 in 2016, according to NCRB data.

“I don’t agree with these figures at all. The ground reality is very different from what the figures show. Women feel much safer in MP as compared to other states. I have seen women walk and drive on streets alone late night which is a testimony in itself of how safe they feel. The figures can always be misleading as there is a difference between number of cases reported and registered. We take crime against women very seriously and so all such cases are given importance. There are more crimes reported in other states but number of cases registered is low,” DGP Singh told TOI.

Of 5,433 girls and women raped in 2018 in state, 2,830 were minors followed by Uttar Pradesh and Chhattisgarh with 1,353 and 1,215 such cases respectively.

While in 2017 there was a 14% increase in rape cases, 2018 saw a decrease of 3% in rape cases from 5562 to 5433.

NCRB figures revealed that MP in 2018 reported maximum cases of rape cases/victims reported in the country. Besides it also had highest number of cases, when it came to rape with girls aged between 6 and 18 years as well as rapes with women aged between 45 and 60 years and those aged 60 or above. Further analysis showed that in cases of rape with minor girls, MP accounted for 30.3% of total such cases nationally in 2018 with 2830 cases.

DGP added that crimes against women are mostly committed by people, who are in their close proximity. “To address this, we have started many awareness campaigns for minor girls, college going girls and women and there has been a positive impact always,” he said.

Title: UT: New authority for land acquisition
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

CHANDIGARH: The UT administration on Wednesday notified the land acquisition, rehabilitation and resettlement authority.

Last week, UT administrator V P Singh Badnore approved the constitution of a one-member authority to be headed by district and sessions judge of Mohali or a representative of his.

A senior UT official said the setting up of the authority would help in timely execution of the government’s projects in the city and ensure compensation, rehabilitation and resettlement of people affected due to land acquisition. The authority will provide speedy disposal of disputes related to land acquisition, compensation, rehabilitation and resettlement. The affected parties will be able to appeal against the order of the land acquisition officer (district collector) with authority, the official said.

After the constitution of the authority, no civil court (other than the high court or the Supreme Court) will have jurisdiction to entertain any dispute related to land acquisition in respect of which the collector or the authority is empowered, and no injunction shall be granted by any court in respect of any such matter.

Cheats using apps to get mobile information

After disconnecting the phone, Deepak realised that while he was busy talking to Rahul, the cheats had diverted Rs 44,980 in four transactions from his bank account linked to Paytm. So, he called his bank and got his account blocked, but the money was already gone.

Both complainants has submitted their complaints to the public window at police headquarters, which forwarded those to the cyber cell for investigation.

Devinder Singh, CCIC incharge of the UT police, said the cell has been flooded with complaints of frauds in the name of Paytm KYC update. They are getting two-three complaints every day, he said.

He said that cheaters generally ask Paytm users to download apps like “Quick Viewer” and “Team Support”. “These apps are actually applications to remotely access your mobile phones. Once users enter their details in the app, fraudsters get full control of their devices. Next they ask customers to make a token payment from their debit or credit card to Paytm (to keep the account alive), which gives them all the required details to do online transactions.”

The cyber cell unit of UT police has also written to Paytm to make their customers aware regarding fraudulent SMSs and calls, so that people do not fall prey to such fraud.

Title: DSP Vishnupriya case: Court accepts CBI’s closure report
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Coimbatore: The chief judicial magistrate court on Thursday dismissed the petition filed by the parents of former Tiruchengode DSP R Vishnupriya, who was found hanging in police quarters on September 18, 2015 , opposing the CBI’s second closure report on the case.

The court accepted the CBI’s report in the death of Vishnupriya that stated it was a suicide case and ruled out any instance of abatement.

The CBI had submitted the first closure report in May 2018, stating there was no foul play behind the death of the DSP and that it was a pure case of suicide. Her parents M Ravi and B Kalaiselvi then filed a petition before the court, saying there were lots of contradictions in the report filed by the CBI, which they said had reproduced the report of the Crime Branch CID.

Following the petition, the CBI’s closure report was dismissed by the chief judicial magistrate and the court ordered the investigation agency to continue further investigation. The agency submitted its second closure report before the court on August 29, 2019, and stuck to its earlier claim that it was a case of suicide. But the late DSP’s parents filed a petition on November 7, 2019 and objected to the report. The proceedings of the case had concluded on January 7 when the court examined five police officers and parents of Vishnupriya. The court on Thursday accepted the second closure report filed by the CBI and dismissed the petition by the late DSP’s parents.

Title: Flat owners to protest against SC-appointed panel
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Kochi: Around 22 flat owners will begin a protest against the Supreme Court-appointed compensation committee alleging that they have not received the immediate compensation of Rs 25 lakh as ordered by the apex court. They said that the amount should be given before the demolition happens. Moreover, they alleged that the committee has not started initiatives to assess how the remaining compensation will be paid to each flat owner and the amount each one will get.

“Around 57 flat owners didn’t get the immediate compensation (Rs 25 lakh) until Thursday noon. Several times, we approached the commission seeking a solution and we did not get a proper response. Finally, when we raised this concern in public in front of the media, a GO was issued stating the funds have been sanctioned for 35 more flat owners. But the money is yet to be credited to our accounts. Even now there are 22 flat owners who have not received a confirmation,” said S Jayakumar, a flat owner of Holy Faith H20.

Meanwhile, sources associated with the committee said that the committee sanctioned Rs.62 crore and released Rs.49.36crore. A sum of Rs 8.75 crore has been sanctioned for 35 flat owners on Thursday. With this, the total released sum stands at Rs 58.11 crore (94%).

“All applicants (except builders/their family members) was allotted Rs 25 lakh each and the government was informed of the same. Owing to paucity of funds, government is delaying payment to some claimants. They can approach the government or the Supreme Court. The committee has nothing to do with the disbursal of the amount,” said a source.

Flat owners plan to stage a protest in front of the commission’s office at PWD Rest House in Ernakulam. “A sum of Rs 25 lakh is not enough for the loss we suffered. The assessment of compensation has not started yet and the flats will be demolished within two days. How will the commission assess the deserving compensation for all of us?” asked Biyoj Chennattu, a flat owner of Holy Faith H20.

Title: Camera traps 95,000 motorists in city last yr
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: City police commissioner Balram Kuma Upadhyay on Thursday released a piece of information that may eliminate any misconception by motorists that they are free to violate any law if they could avoid police personnel on roads.

According to statistics released by the commissioner, over 95,000 motorists were booked and penalised via the cameras of police as well as TC Vigil WhatsApp number, 9497975000. While over 88,000 people were booked through cameras of police, as many as 7,678 motorists were booked with the help of evidence shared by the public through the TC Vigil WhatsApp number which is personally supervised by the commissioner.

The statistics pertain to motorists booked between January 1, 2019, and December 31, 2019. Out of the 88,000-odd cases detected through police cameras, as many as 51,930 were detected using the fixed surveillance cameras installed in the city. Majority of these cases were related to helmetless riding of motorcycles. Another 22,567 two-wheeler riders were booked for helmetless riding using images clicked by police officers using their mobile phone cameras. As many as 1,893 car drivers were also booked this way for not complying the seatbelt rule.

The commissioner has urged the public to make use of the TC Vigil facility more and help the police reduce traffic violations that would in turn make way for accidents on roads.

Title: Mock drill at Maradu to test preparedness
Content:
As demolition day nears, city police commissioner Vijay Sakhare and sub-collector Snehil Kumar Singh will coor... Read More

KOCHI: As demolition day nears, city police commissioner Vijay Sakhare and sub-collector Snehil Kumar Singh will coordinate the mock drill involving various agencies on Friday morning to understand the preparedness of personnel. Chief secretary Tom Jose also visited the site on Thursday to review the situation. He also tried to allay the fears of residents.Policemen, fire force and medical officials will be positioned at predesignated spots at the boundary of exclusion zones. Prior to the drill, they will be briefed on their duties and what safety measures police should take when the siren is sounded. The drill might be held simultaneously in Holy faith H2O, Alfa Serene, Jains Coral Cove and Golden Kayaloram. During the drill, there won’t be any evacuation of residents or traffic curbs.“Since the buildings are charged with explosives, nothing more can be done in the area. The drill is to make sure that personnel understand their duties and positions on demolition day. Fire tenders will be placed at the designated spot in each exclusion zone,” said a source.Meanwhile, in the wake of rising apprehension among residents living near Alfa Serene, Petroleum and Explosives Safety Organization (PESO) officials met them in the morning. Residents asked about the safety of their homes when the second tower of Alfa Serene will be pulled down on Saturday. The explosives experts told them that there was nothing to fear as the process won’t damage nearby houses.Officials from IIT-Madras too visited the spot and installed accelerometer at some spots near Holy Faith H2O and Alfa Serene. To study the impact of vibration during implosion of Holy Faith H2O on the Thevara-Kundannoor bridge, experts installed geophone on the bridge to analyze seismic response. On Friday, they will identify spots around Jains Coral Cove and Golden Kayaloram and install some equipment.Meanwhile, pollution control board (PCB) will set up two water sampling and three air monitoring stations (at an angle of 120 degrees) near Jains Coral Cove and Golden Kayaloram. Three water sampling and three air monitoring stations will be set up near Holy Faith H2O and Alfa Serene too. Water samples were collected to study the presence of heavy metals. Samples will be collected after the demolition of the buildings.The stations near Holy Faith H2O and Alfa Serene will set up on Friday. Stations near Jains Coral Cove and Golden Kayaloram will set up on Saturday.

Title: Alagumalai jallikattu: Bull owners told to register animals
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Tirupur: With the third edition of Alagumalai jallikattu scheduled to be held on February 2, bull owners have been asked to register their bulls to take part in the event.

The district administration directed people to take the bulls to nearby government veterinary clinics, where veterinarians would check the health of the bulls and online registration would be done. Only the bulls that completed registration would be allowed to participate in the event.

“The bulls should be registered separately with our association to take part in the event. The district administration said it was mandatory to register with the veterinary department, but jallikattu bull owners’ associations have opposed it. The bull owners say that there were practical difficulties in registering with the department,” said S Palanisamy, president of the Alagumalai Jallikattu Welfare Association. “For instance, each bull can take part only in four jallikattu events as per the veterinary department. But sometimes, a bull would get registered but would be returning without participating in an event due to time limitation.”

T Rajesh of Jallikattu Paathukaappu Nala Sangam said the forum represented the issue with the sate animal husbandry department. “We were promised that it would not be mandatory this year. In case of fitness tests, it would be done at the venue so that only the fit bulls take part in the event.”

Title: Millions of gig workers set to get health cover, other sops with labour law tweak
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

File photo for representation

NEW DELHI: The inclusion of "gig workers" in new labour laws, offering millions of informal workers like Uber drivers and Swiggy riders benefits like health insurance and other schemes, is set to be okayed by Parliament's standing committee on labour which concluded its discussions on Thursday.

In its brief to the committee, headed by BJD MP Bhartruhari Mahtab, the government said that new definitions have been included to cater to emerging forms of employment like aggregator, gig worker and platform worker.

"For these workers, schemes can be formulated by the central government with regard to disability cover, health and maternity benefits ," it said. The code on social security, one of four codes that are intended to refashion 43 labour laws, seeks to extend coverage of employees state insurance corporation act across India and to all establishments employing 10 or more employees.

Earlier the ESIC Act's applicability was based on the concept of notification for each district or a part of it and the law can be specific to hazardous occupations.

"In such (hazardous) classes of establishment, the threshold can be even one worker," the government has said, adding that an employer of a plantation may opt for the ESIC by willingly joining the corporation.

The committee seems in agreement with the view that these measures will go a long way in extending social security for medical services, sickness and maternity benefits as also dependent pension and employee compensation.

Thresholds for provident fund, ESIC, gratuity, maternity benefits and social security can be set or changed through notifications rather than amendments of specific acts.

At present, under the unorganised workers social security act , 2008, there is no provision of electronic registration of workers. It has been proposed that an unorganised worker will submit a self declaration electronically or otherwise in a form to an authority prescribed by government.

A registered unorganised worker will be assigned a unique number based on Aadhaar .

Stiff fines have been proposed, with increases of as much as 10-fold, as earlier the fines were last revised in 1998.

At the same time there is a provision of prior warning for improvement and for complying with the new code. The news codes are likely to be discussed and voted on in the second half of the budget session.

Title: Second most unsafe state for children
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Indore: Every day, 52 crimes against children were committed in Madhya Pradesh making it the ‘ second most unsafe state for children ’ in 2018. MP recorded 18,992 cases after Uttar Pradesh (19,936), according to NCRB data.

Indore witnessed a 2.3% increase in number of crimes as compared to 2017. Around 18,946 such cases were registered in 2017 across MP.

Uttar Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh emerged the top two states, both having share of around 14 per cent or over 18,000 cases in crime against children.

Meanwhile, kidnapping and abduction of children continues to be the biggest crime, accounting for almost 64% of the total cases of abduction in state (8,933).

The crime reported under Juvenile Justice (Care and Protection of Children) Act, 2015, also shows an increase with reportage of 29 cases in 2018, an increase from five in 2016.

MP recorded third highest number of foeticide cases (17) after Uttar Pradesh and Gujarat with 22 and 21 cases respectively. DGP VK Singh said that they have started special campaigns for children across state but unfortunately in most cases, accused are known to the children. “We make sure that children are aware of wrong things and are taught about good touch and bad touch at school such that they immediately inform their parents if they feel something is not right. We have seen good results in this direction as well,” said DGP Singh adding that safety of women and children is of utmost priority to MP police.

Title: Cop’s murder: Check posts on high alert
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Coimbatore: Following the murder of sub-inspector Wilson of Kaliyakkavilai in Kanyakumari district, the Coimbatore city and rural police have strengthened security at the 26 check posts on Thursday.

Two men had opened fire at the inspector while he was checking vehicles on Wednesday night. The duo escaped in a car to Kerala.

“We have the photographs of the two suspects and our cops are conducting vehicle checks at the check posts,” police superintendent Sujit Kumar said.

While the Coimbatore rural police have tightened security at 14 check posts including Walayar, Velanthavalam and Anaikatti, the city police are keeping watch at 12 check posts. TNN

Title: Red mercury scam: Five arrested
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Coimbatore: The Salem city police arrested five people on Thursday for attempting to cheat a group of people by offering to sell red mercury, a substance they said , is used to make nuclear weapons.

Police identified them as Pandiyarajan, 24, from Dindigul district, Ramesh, 30, from Viluppuram district, Kannadasan, 45, from Kotagiri in the Nilgiris, Thangapandian, 44, from Usilampatti in Madurai district and a 15-year-old boy from Nagapattinam. “They had posted messages about red mercury on social media websites. When a man expressed interest to buy it, the gang told him to meet them at a coffee shop in Salem, where they were meeting other prospective buyers. The man informed police about the gang,” a police officer said.

Police nabbed them from the shop. “The gang met a group of buyers at the shop and showed them a fake video of red mercury in a mobile phone. They told the buyers that the substance is worth Rs 3 crore. The buyers showed them a video showing currency notes,” the officer said. Police have arrested them on cheating charges. tnn

Title: Banks scurry to get Rs 18,000 crore from defaulter firms in Hyderabad
Content:
Representative image

HYDERABAD: In an indication of the tough times ahead for the economy, various banks in Hyderabad have issued e-auction notices to defaulters to recover Rs 18,827 crore in just six months — from July 2019 to January 5, 2020.As many as 226 e-auction notices were issued during the period in a bid to recover loan dues from pledged properties and securities of defaulters. In fact, some auctions have already been conducted while others are in the process.All the defaulting companies are based in Hyderabad.One can gauge the scale of the default from the fact that Rs 18,000 crore is what the entire state of Jammu and Kashmir lost in terms of business since the August 5 clampdown by Centre.TOI analysed bank e-auction notices issued by major banks, including SBI, Andhra Bank , Syndicate Bank , Canara Bank , UCO bank , Bank of Baroda, Indian Bank and Union Bank. Major defaulters were infrastructure projects, along with power projects, cotton and spinning mills, food processing, paper boards and agro-tech firms.Banking experts say businesses failing to repay loans is not new and is a pan-India problem. But the problem seems to be getting alarming in recent days. Bankers are worried as some companies have pledged disputed land and where the government has interests as guarantee for huge sums.In some cases, property prices were inflated. “A major infrastructure company took more than Rs 580 crore and defaulted. Because other properties are in dispute, the banker has put about 475 sq yards in Guttala Beghumpur in Serilingmapally for e-auction. Even if bank auctions the land, it will be able to recover only Rs 5 crore,” a chief general manager of a bank said.Banking expert and former IDBI director K Narsimha Murthy blames both central and state governments for the current situation. Government dues contribute 50% of total non-performing assets (NPAs) of banks.“The governments should stop freebies and clear the dues,” he said. “According to estimations, government owes private firms about Rs 5 lakh crore. This includes power distribution companies and other sectors. When governments don’t pay the dues to contractors and agencies, firms can’t run their offices and pay salaries to their employees. Micro, small and medium scale (MSMEs) sector is badly hit.”Banking officials said with increasing list of defaulters, some banks have stopped honouring guarantees being provided by states government such as Andhra Pradesh where the government’s pending bills have piled up to Rs 30,000 crore. The Telangana government too owes over Rs 10,000 crore to contractors, especially for irrigation project.All India Bank Employees’ Association national secretary B S Rambabu said the main reason for mismatch between loan amount and recovery was because of over-valuation of collateral or pledging disputed properties. “If an individual borrower fails to repay, his properties would be confiscated by banks. Like this if any firm fails, personal properties of directors or persons involved in the management of that firm need to be confiscated. Not only civil proceedings to recover the amount, criminal course should be initiated against them,” Rambabu said.According to the national secretary suggested the government should come up with a law barring major defaulters from being elected to any public representative post. On loans, he said total NPAs in all banks come to about Rs 7.90 lakh crore. SBI alone has written off Rs 76,000 crore. Moreover, banks which have failed to recover the amount from bigwigs and major defaulters have collected about Rs 8,000 crore from common depositors for not maintaining minimum balance.Bank Employees Federation of India vice president P Venkatramaiah said banks have recovered less and written off more in the past five years. “Banking reports clearly say while banks were able to recover Rs 2.32 lakh crore, they wrote off Rs 4.82 lakh crore in the past five years,” he said.In the name of settling cases, a sick textile industry was given to a business group for a song at Rs 5,000 crore while the dues were Rs 23,000 crore. These mistakes are harming the entire banking industry, Vekatramaiah said.

Title: Nine of gang of robbers held after encounter by Agra police
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

AGRA: In one of its biggest crackdowns, Agra police has arrested nine members of a gang that allegedly committed at least 36 robberies, including 16 over the past three months. The nine men were caught after an encounter on the intervening night of Wednesday and Thursday. However, three gang members managed to flee. According to police, among those arrested is the son of a gram pradhan and two are jewellers.

The gang was active in Kiraoli , Sikandra, Achenra, Shamshabad , Pinhat, Malpura and Jagner in Agra district and some areas of Morena district in Madhya Pradesh .

The apprehended men were identified as Kartar Singh (38) and his his three brothers -- Ramhet Singh (22), Sahab Singh (20) and Suresh Singh (42). Another gangster was identified as Hariom Singh (20). All the five men originally hail from Naduapura village of Morena district of Madhya Pradesh.

The other members were Rahul alias Shribhagwan (24) of Nibohra and jewellers Akash Verma and Sabir Khan of Pinhat. Police also arrested Virender, son of Vipravali’s gram pradhan Ragunath.

The absconding men were identified as Nona, Majnu and Uttam, who hail from Madhya Pradesh.

Arvind Kumar Nirval, station house officer of Shamshabad, said, “Kartar along with his three brothers, a nephew and three brothers-in-law – two of whom are in jail (Udaybhan and Veerbhan)-- use to execute the robbery, especially at the homes and shops of jewellers. The gang was helped by Vipravali pradhan’s son Virender, who use to provide shelter to the accused men after they committed a robbery. The men than used to sell the stolen booty to local jewellers.”

During interrogation, the accused men claimed that they have lost count of the number of robberies they had executed over the years. The men bought several plots, built luxurious homes, bought SUVs and motorcycles from their ill-gotten gains.

The modus operandi of the gang was simple. Virender used to choose the target and share the details with the gang, who would conduct a recce before executing a robbery in the night hours. On December 28, the gang decamped with silver and gold jewellery from a bullion trader’s outlet in Shamshabad. In November, the gang helped five men to execute the murder-cum- robbery in a garment store owner’s home in Pinhat,” said the SHO.

Police have recovered 30 kg silver, several kilos of gold, Rs 60,000 worth spices and other valuables from them.

“We are now going to attach the properties of the accused men as they have acquired or built them from stolen goods. All the men will be charged with the Gangster Act, too,” he added.

Title: Madhya Pradesh fourth in number of suicide, accounts for 8 per cent deaths
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

Bhopal: Though National Crime Record Bureau (NCRB) report for 2018 doesn’t specify whether suicides by persons involved in farming sector (farmers and farm labourers) has seen an increase or decline in 2018 compared to previous years, but only says that a total of 10,349 persons involved in farming sector committed suicide during the year, which is 7.7 % of the total suicides during the year. The report also underlines that in some states and UTs, zero farmers’ suicide has been reported.

The report dealing with the chapter “Suicides in India” says “A total of 10,349 persons involved in farming sector (consisting of 5,762 farmers/cultivators and 4,586 agricultural labourers) committed suicide during 2018, accounting for 7.7 % of total suicide victims (1,34,516) in the country. Out of 5,763 farmer/cultivator suicides, a total of 5,457 were male and 306 were female. Out of 4,586 suicides committed by agricultural labourers during 2018, 4,071 were male and 515 female.

Some states/UTs namely, West Bengal, Bihar, Odisha, Uttarakhand, Meghalaya, Goa, Chandigarh, Daman & Diu, Delhi UT, Lakshadweep and Puducherry reported zero suicides of farmers/cultivator as well as agricultural labourers, the report highlights in a bracket.

According to NCRB data on suicides for the year 2018, a total of 1,34, 516 suicides were recorded during 2018, showing an increase of 3.6% in comparison to 2017 and the rate of suicides increased by 0.3% during 2018 over 2017.

Madhya Pradesh stood fourth in the country among states in terms of number of suicides and accounted for 8.8% of total deaths. Maximum number of suicides was reported from Maharashtra followed by Tamil Nadu, West Bengal, Madhya Pradesh and Karnataka. These five states accounted for 50.9 % of total suicides reported in the country while rest of the 24 states and 7 Union territories (UTs). These five states have also accounted for 7 % or more suicidal deaths in the country from 2016 to 2018.

Uttar Pradesh, the most populous state (16.9% of country’s population) reported comparatively lower percentage share of suicidal deaths, accounting for only 3.6 % of total suicides reported.

The overall male: female ratio of suicide victims for the year 2018 was 68.5:31.5, which was exactly the same as the previous year, 2017. The cause of suicides among women was more due to “marriage-related issues” specifically “dowry-related issues” and “impotency/infertility”.

The age group (18-30 years) and (30-45 years) were the most vulnerable groups resorting to suicide. These groups accounted for 34.9% and 31.6% suicides respectively.

“Family problems” (2,236), “failure in examination” (1,529), “love affairs” (1,131), and illness (932) were the main causes of suicides among children (below 18 years of age).

Professional status of suicide victims as per the NCRB report for the year 2018 shows that only 1.3% (1,707 out of 1,34,516) of the total suicide victims were government servants as compared to 6.1% (8,246 out of 13,516) of total suicide victims were from private sector, whereas students and unemployed victims accounted for 7.6% (10,159) and 9.6% (912,936) victims respectively. Self-employed category accounted for 9.8% of total suicide victims (13,149 out of 1,34,516).

Homemakers accounted for 54.1% of the total female victims (22.937 out of 42,391) and constitute nearly 17.1% of total victims who committed suicide (22,937 out of 1,34,516) during 2018.

Out of total 92,114 male suicides, maximum suicides were committed by daily wage earners (26,589). A total of 3,535 daily wage earners were among 42,391 females, who committed suicide.

Title: Mumbai: Two new Metros, three road projects to ease your commute in 2020
Content:
File photo used for representational purpose

Extension of SCLR set to make east-west drive fast

MUMBAI: Traffic woes in the suburbs, mainly in the west, are likely to reduce this year, with MMRDA, the apex planning body, announcing it will throw open two Metro corridors and complete three road projects.Six years after the city’s first Metro line (Versova-Ghatkopar) was commissioned in June 2014, D N Nagar-Dahisar Metro 2A and Andheri-Dahisar Metro 7 will be inaugurated in October. By 2021, Metro 2A and 7 are expected to carry around 4.1 lakh and 5.3 lakh passengers a day respectively, and help reduce congestion on S V Road, Western Express Highway and over crowding in local trains.Metropolitan commissioner R A Rajeev said, “Besides, SCLR extension till Western Express Highway, BKC-Vakola Junction elevated road and Kalanagar junction improvement will also be completed in this year.” These three road projects are aimed at improving connectivity to BKC and reducing traffic congestion in the commercial hub. The Kalanagar junction work will ensure fast travel to BKC, Sion-Dharavi Link road, airport and Bandra station. At present, vehicles take-20-30 minutes to clear the junction during peak hours. They will be able to save at least 10 minutes.The Kalanagar junction in Bandra east will have two flyovers and a free left turn from T-junction to sea link. MMRDA said it would be thrown open in October.SCLR has not realized its full potential because of bottlenecks in Kurla. Hence, the extension was proposed to ensure quick connectivity between WEH and Eastern Express Highway. SCLR extension will originate from Kapadia Nagar on CST Road near Kurla and terminate at the WEH near Vakola.Once Vakola-BKC elevated road is ready, motorists won’t have to go up to Kalanagar to enter BKC and save 20-30 minutes. Vehicles from Andheri can take the elevated road to directly reach Asian Heart Hospital in BKC’s G Block.Additional metropolitan commissioner Sonia Sethi said, “By 2026, MMR will have Metro length of around 337 km.” Delhi metro has a length of 391 km. She said, “In 2019, 41.1 km length of work had begun on 3 corridors whereas in 2020, 87 km route length of Metro work will begin.”Metropolitan commissioner RA Rajeev said recruitment for the two new Metros will be completed by February. Regarding the progress on Mumbai TransHarbour Link Corridor, Rajeev said, "Despite heavy rains, 25% work on the project has been completed.” On Monorail, he said, “The beam was designed in such a way that only rakes that were manufactured by erstwhile operator Scomi could fit in. We have gone for re-tendering for 10 rakes as only one firm had shown response in earlier bids floated. There are only limited firms who are keen to participate in bids as they will have to modify the design of their rake to match the specifications.”

Title: CAA: ‘Don’t believe rumours, we’ll protect you’
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

DMK members led by deputy leader of opposition S Durai Murugan walked out in protest after speaker P Dhanapal ... Read More

CHENNAI: With protests continuing against the Citizenship Amendment Act and National Register of Citizens, chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami and his deputy O Panneerselvam on Thursday asserted that the government would continue to protect the minorities just like late chief ministers M G Ramachandran and J Jayalalithaa did. The CM also listed out the various welfare measures initiated for the minority communities in the state.

Replying to the debate on the motion to thank the governor for his address to the assembly, the chief minister sought to reiterate that minorities in the state would not suffer in any way. The AIADMK regime since MGR and Jayalalithaa had stood by the minorities and it would remain supportive. “Don’t believe in rumours spread with political motive. The minority community doesn’t need to be worried or scared,” Palaniswami said. The chief minister had on Tuesday told the assembly that he had informed Union home minister Amit Shah during his recent meeting in Delhi that NRC was not acceptable to Tamil Nadu . The AIADMK had extended crucial support for safe passage of CAB in Parliament.

To drive home the point, Palaniswami listed out various welfare schemes being implemented for Muslims, including the annual Haj subsidy despite Centre withdrawing it. The state extended Rs 215.22 crore benefits through minorities’ economic development corporation in the last eight years. Deputy chief minister Panneerselvam sought to reaffirm that the AIADMK would remain supportive forever. “At any time or under any circumstances, we will be the first to raise our voice if there are even small troubles for you,” the leader said, turning towards IUML MLA Mohammed Abu Backer and MJK MLA Thamimun Ansari, amid loud thumping of desks by members of the treasury benches.

Earlier, representatives of a federation of Muslim organisations and political parties called on Panneerselvam and submitted a memorandum seeking the support of the AIADMK against CAA and NRC. AIADMK minority wing Anwhar Raajhaa said the federation wanted the Muslims, and refugees from Myanmar, Sri Lanka and Bhutan to be brought under the ambit of the CAA. “Under the National Population Register, no new questions should be asked that would harm the community. And the NRC should not be implemented in the state,” said the leader, who was part of the delegation. The delegation will meet the chief minister at his residence on Friday.
