Now, according to the Times Now report, the CBI team likely to meet Narcotics Control Bureau unit today.

Title: App helps trace 11-yr-old
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Secunderabad: An 11-year-old boy who was missing since May 2019 was reunited with his family in Alwal. The Darpan app was used by the Rachakonda police to identify the boy. The boy was identified as Enaganti Rohit, a resident of Jonnaband, Alwal mandal. Rohit went missing last year and a missing case was registered on May 28.

Rohit was found on the streets of Dammaiguda by Jawaharnagar police patrolling staff. He was later admitted to Carpe Diem Foundation Children’s Home in Shivanandapuri colony, Dammaiguda as the boy was found to be mentally challenged.

Rachakonda police informed the Alwal police and handed him over to his family. tnn

Title: Kolkata: Mercury may slide to 12 degree Celsius this weekend, predicts Met
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Met says that cold spell may set in again following the light rain on Thursday.

KOLKATA: The rain on Thursday will bring back the winter chill once again, said the Met officials. Though the city received light spells of rain , it will make the city colder from the weekend.

“This winter we have had rain in December, apart from the one on Thursday. Such rain indicates that winter is still active and the cold spell will set rolling again. The mercury is set to dip again from Saturday,” said GK Das, director (weather) at the Regional Meteorological Centre Kolkata. On Thursday, Alipore recorded only 0.3mm rain while other parts of the city like New Market, Mominpore and Ultadanga received more than 1mm rain till late evening. Some adjoining areas of the city, including Diamond Harbour, received around 9mm rain during the same period. However, the Met officials ruled out the possibility of further rain now.

The minimum temperature on Thursday was 15.5°C — one notch higher than the normal. With a clear sky and the Northwesterly wind blowing without any hindrance, the mercury is expected to dip to 12°C from Saturday. “On January 2, the rainfall in the city was 30mm. But this time the cyclonic circulation was not strong enough for moisture incursion. That is why, the intensity of the rain was less. We don’t expect any further spell of rain now,” said Das.

Even if it does not rain on Friday, the sky will remain overcast in the first half of the day. The cloud cover along with the residual moisture is likely to trigger dense fog in early morning on Friday and Saturday, reducing the visibility to around 200 metres.

Title: Uttarakhand High Court stays transfer of roadways land to urban development
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representational image

NAINITAL: Uttarakhand high court (HC) came down heavily on the Uttarakhand Power Corporation Limited (UPCL) managing director (MD) saying that he should either comply with the court’s order or be personally present in court to explain why its orders have not been followed.

The warning was issued by the single judge bench of Justice Manoj Kumar Tiwari while hearing a contempt petition filed by Udham Singh Nagar resident Avdhesh Kumar Sharma. Sharma who was a labour in UPCL said that he along with many others had filed the contempt plea. “We had approached the labour court which passed an order in 1992 that we should be made permanent and given several other benefits. UPCL then approached the HC which upheld the labour court’s order. However, our services were regularised only by 2009. We approached HC again which in 2014 said that all the benefits should be given from 1992. Yet the corporation is not complying with the orders,” Sharma said.

Title: Haridwar: Bride arrested for conning man
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

HARIDWAR: A 25-year-old woman has been arrested by Haridwar police for allegedly conning a man by marrying him. Police have also arrested her legitimate husband who posed himself as her brother at the time of the marriage. According to police, after coming to Haridwar with the victim on their honeymoon, the woman fled from the hotel room with cash and gold jewellery.

A case has been registered against the woman Anjali and her husband Mahaveer by the victim’s sister Sonia, resident of Kalka, Panchkula under section 420 (cheating) of Indian penal code in the city police station.

According to police, Sonia was looking for a bride for her 35-year-old brother Deepak Kumar. She contacted a mediator Sonu, resident of Roorkee, Haridwar, who introduced Anjali and his alleged brother Mahaveer, resident of Shahjahanpur, Uttar Pradesh.

Anjali and Deepak married on December 18 and they eventually reached Haridwar for their honeymoon. They had booked a room in a hotel, from which Anjali ran away at midnight with Rs 50,000 in cash and gold jewellery, while Deepak was asleep.

Senior sub-inspector of city police station, Jagmohan Ramola, told TOI, “During investigation we found that Anjali’s real name is Pooja and Mahaveer is not her brother but her legitimate husband. The duo were facing financial problem and came up with the plan to dupe men.”

Title: Kolkata: Cab aggregator adds features for passenger safety
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

KOLKATA: With rising number of allegations against cabbies for misbehaviour, sexual harassment and assault on women, a leading online cab aggregator has come up with more features for the safety of passengers.

RideCheck is one of such features added by Uber to flag certain trip irregularities. If an anomaly is detected, the aggregator will reach out to both the passenger and driver with the help of the feature.

The aggregator is piloting audio recording as a pioneering safety feature in the Indian market. A rider or driver partner will have an option to record audio through their phone during a trip. When the trip ends, the user can report any untoward incident by submitting the audio recording.

With the audio file being encrypted, the user cannot listen to the stored recording on their device, but the person will be able to send it to the aggregator’s customer support agents who will use the audio to know about an incident and take appropriate actions.

The aggregator has also added safety PIN , a trip verification feature to ensure that riders get into their booked cabs.

Title: Army men get a peek into new tech & radar systems
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Secunderabad: Army men at the Military College of Electronics and Mechanical Engineering (MCEME) were exposed to the latest trends in antenna technology and futuristic radar systems at a college seminar on ‘Radar and Missile Technology’ on Thursday.

The seminar was organised by the Army Training Command of Indian Army. Runa Kumari, BITS Pilani, Hyderabad, Upendra Shankar Pandey, scientist ‘F’ and Srikanth Vadada, scientist ‘F’ from LRDE, Bengaluru, and Lt Col PPS Chauhan provided information about the latest trends in radar and antenna technologies to the participants.

“The seminar was a rare opportunity wherein all major stakeholders concerned with the field got together under one roof,” MCEME said. There were other speakers from academia, design and production agencies.

Among the speakers were Sujitha Ravichandran, scientist ‘G’, RCI Hyderabad, Vivek Sharma, scientist ‘F’, RCI, P Narasimhulu, scientist ‘E’, RCI, R Vijaya Ramaraju, general manager, ‘Akash’ missile, BDL, Hyderabad, Ajit Choudhary, project director ‘Akash’, DRDL, Hyderabad and Col M Paul who spoke about the latest missile systems technologies, the technologies involved and challenges ahead.

The aim was to acquaint the students with the entire paradigm in the fields of Radar and Missile technology including latest research, development, production and sustainment challenges.

Title: ‘JNU spends more on security than on buying books’
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Kottayam: The entire democratic system of Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) has collapsed under its present vice-chancellor Jagadesh Kumar, said Amal Pullarkkat, a research scholar of JNU. Speaking during a special session of Kerala History Congress being held at the MG University campus here on Thursday, Amal said that the university is spending more money for security than for buying books.tnn

Title: Telangana HC pours water on govt’s Karimnagar civic poll plans, refuses urgent hearing
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Illustration used for representational purpose

HYDEARABAD: The Telangana high court on Wednesday refused to take up an appeal filed by the state government seeking permission to go ahead with the election to Karimnagar Municipal Corporation (KMC) along with other municipal bodies.

The government was aggrieved with the restraint order passed by a single judge who, on Tuesday, directed the officials to rectify anomalies in the population figures of SCs and STs before going ahead with the polls in Karimnagar. It urged the high court bench to set aside the single judge order as it wants to conduct polls in KMC also.

Though the government filed an appeal against the order of the single judge and urged the bench headed by Chief Justice Raghavendra Singh Chauhan to suspend that order, it could not secure a copy of the order of the single judge.

Additional advocate general J Ramachandra Rao requested the bench to hear the matter without the copy of the order. The CJ, however, refused to oblige because he was not aware of the contents of the order. Stopping the state counsel from making repeated appeals, the CJ asked: “Where is the order of the single judge? How do I know what was there in the single judge order. What is the logic behind asking me to hear a challenge to an order without placing the order in question before us?”

The state counsel urged the bench to trust his word and the state’s affidavit and hear the matter based on them. The CJ then said, “A lawyer is never to be believed until and unless a documentary proof of what he is saying is furnished. I am sorry. We will take it up on Friday.”

The state counsel said the single judge had passed order, which was in contravention to the order passed by this bench. “The single judge also did not take into account the evidence we placed before him. Now, we are unable to hold elections because of that restraint order. The government wants to hold elections there,” the state counsel said.

Counsel Mayur Reddy, who brought out the irregularities in Karimnagar, however, told the bench that the order of the single judge was reasonable and was passed after hearing the contentions in an elaborate manner. The state counsel requested the court to take up the case on Thursday if they could secure a copy of the single judge order. The bench told him to first get the order copy.

Title: ‘Want to gift asset of education to all kids’
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy launched ‘ Amma Vodi ’ scheme in Chittoor district on Thursday to fulfil one of his key pre-poll promises made to the people.

Under the flagship programme, the government will extend an annual financial grant of Rs 15,000 to all mothers/guardians who send their children/wards to state-run schools. The scheme will benefit nearly 43 lakh mothers/guardians and the state would be disbursing Rs 6,456 crore towards the scheme this year.

“Education is the biggest asset parents can give to their children, which is why article 21A was inserted in the Constitution to provide free and compulsory education to all children in the age group of 6 to 14 years. But education still remains a distant reach for many due to various reasons. This scheme is for them,” the CM told people at the PVKS degree college ground in Chittoor from where the scheme was launched.

Jagan recalled his interactions with people during his Praja Sankalpa Yatra. “I found there are many mothers who couldn’t afford to send their children to even state-run schools because of acute poverty. This programme will ease the concerns of every single mother in the state who desires to equip her child with the asset of education but can’t afford to do so,” he added.

On the compulsory 75% attendance required to claim the financial assistance under Amma Vodi, he said the compulsory norm has been relaxed for this year but will be made mandatory next year onwards.

Explaining the reason behind introducing English as medium of education in state-run schools, Jagan said he wants students passing out of government schools in 10 years from now to be better equipped to face the competitive world. “We will first introduce English medium in state-run schools for classes 1 to 6. It will be extended to class 10 in a phased manner. In four years from now, all our children will appear for their 10th class board exams in English medium,” he said. He further stated that the government will soon improve the syllabus in state-run schools and change the menu of mid-day meal scheme, so that government schools in the state are transformed into centres of excellence. “I am perhaps the only CM in the country who has sat down to revamp the mid-day meal menu. Though it will put additional burden on the state exchequer, we are ready to shoulder the burden to bring smiles,” he asserted.

Title: Delhi crime rate is 4 times of other metros
Content:
Representative image

NEW DELHI: The crime rate per lakh population in Delhi was almost four times the other metropolitan cities in the country in 2018. Data released by National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) showed that while the national average was 238, it was 1,273 cases per lakh people in the capital.Violent crimes saw a marginal dip in 2018 compared with the previous year. However, of the total violent crimes recorded in metropolitan cities, 41% took place in Delhi. Crimes against women were the highest in Delhi (149 cases per lakh population) compared with the national average of 131.In 2018, Delhi matched Bengaluru and Indore in the highest rate of murders at 2.6 cases per lakh population. The number of murders showed a sudden jump of about 5% from the previous year. Delhi recorded 513 cases of murder in 2018 against 487 in 2017. Of these, personal enmity accounted for almost 20%, followed by murders over petty reasons.The highest number of fatal accidents accounting for 1,445 deaths on roads took place in Delhi, followed by Chennai with 1,260 deaths. Of the total road deaths, 775 were hit and run cases. Almost 50% of the fatal accidents occurred in rural areas between 9pm and 6am.Kidnappings, too, showed a marginal dip of about 0.5% compared with 2017. Delhi accounted for nearly one-third of the total number of kidnapping cases registered in metropolitan cities.NCRB data shows crimes committed by juveniles dipped to 2,727 cases compared with 2,965 in 2017. The number had jumped by almost 19% in 2017. Crimes against senior citizens also showed a 3.4% increase.The highest number of vehicle thefts in the country (42,611 cases) was recorded in Delhi. At 2,154 cases of robbery, Delhi was one of the highest compared with the national average. However, it dropped significantly from 3,147 cases registered in 2017. The city also topped the list in thefts with 1,78,953 cases registered in 2018 compared with other metropolitan cities. Of these, 6,024 cases were of snatching. In 2018, police lodged 473 cases of attempt to murder and 24 of dacoity.In the total number of crimes, Delhi continues to fare worse than most cities. However, in terms of crime rate (number of crime per lakh population), which is a better indicator of safety, some cities are far worse than Delhi. Bengaluru’s murder rate is higher than Delhi’s and sexual harassment rate in Kochi is twice than that of the national capital. In rash driving, Bengaluru, Chennai and Kochi fare far worse.Delhi Police maintained that its citizen-friendly service of e-FIRs under certain category of offences increased reporting of crime under such heads. “The figures are indicative of proactive policing, registering of e-FIRs and increase in police presence on the roads. The data shows a dip in heinous crimes, which are prime indicators of the crime situation,” said Delhi Police PRO Mandeep Singh Randhawa.

Title: After making inroads in Nizamabad, BJP eyes municipal corporation
Content:
Representational Image

HYDERABAD: It’s a jostle of hopefuls in Nizamabad. Having won the Nizamabad MP seat last year, BJP wants to prove a point that its victory was not a fluke by bagging as many wards as possible in the January 22 municipal elections .The ruling TRS is facing a stiff competition from within — too many aspirants for party tickets. MIM is not taking it easy as it aims to capture wards in Bodhan area which has sizeable Muslim population, while Congress is planning to upstage TRS in some wards.The fight for the Nizamabad Municipal Corporation seat assumes significance with both TRS and BJP vying for the honours. On its part, TRS exuded confidence of winning a majority wards this time round.While BJP is beset with too many aspirants in Nizamabad urban and Armoor, Congress is facing a similar predicament in Kamareddy. Sources said aspirants for TRS tickets would get clarity on Thursday if they stand to gain or lose. Minister Vemula Prashanth Reddy, who hails from Nizamabad, told local leaders not to lose heart and put up a united front to bag all the wards.MIM, which conducted two rallies in Nizamabad, is looking to field Hindu candidates in some of the wards, sources said. Leaders of TRS, Congress and BJP, however, are worried about nominations being filed by rebels after they are denied tickets. “That is going to be a huge problem for us,” a TRS leader said.Interestingly, most of the aspirants are real estate promoters and builders. “Even in a medium-size ward, we may have to spend at least Rs 20 lakh,” a local TRS member said.

Title: NCRB report continues to show downward trend of crime in city
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Pune: The National Crime Record Bureau’s latest report for 2018 has revealed a continuing downward trend in the rate of cognisable crimes in the city.

Among the 19 metropolitan cities with a population of more than 20 lakh, calculated using Actual Population Census 2011, Pune has been ranked 17 in terms of crime rate. Kochi topped the chart.

The latest report comes barely two months after the NCRB released its report for 2017 in October last year. Pune was ranked 16th among the 19 metropolitan cities then.

The 2018 report has shown Pune’s crime rate at 277.9 incidences per one lakh population as against 379.6 incidences in 2017. A total of 14,034 crimes were registered in 2018 as against 19,172 in 2017. For the preceding year of 2016, the crimes were 19,554. These crimes include offences under the Indian Penal Code (IPC) as well as the special legislative laws (SLLs), such as Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act, IT Act and Juvenile Justice Act, among others.

Pune’s crime rate at 277.9 is also far less than Mumbai’s 309.9 per one lakh population. Police officers pointed out that Mumbai had a much bigger jurisdiction and population compared to Pune.

According to the report, the IPC crimes have gone down from 15,144 in 2017 to 11,551 in 2018, further fortifying the downward trend considering that the same in 2016 were recorded at 16,296.

Similarly, the SLL crimes declined by almost half from 4,028 incidences in 2017 to 2,483 in 2018. In 2016, there were 3,258 incidences of SLL crimes.

The NCRB’s annual reports are published on the basis of information provided by the state police units and the central law enforcing agencies. The bureau has considered Pune’s population at 50.5 lakh for calculating the crime rate, which is crimes per one lakh population.

Usually, the NCRB takes more time in releasing annual reports after collecting data on a pan-India basis, compared to annual figures released at the police commissionerate levels.

For instance, Pune police commissioner K Venkatesham on Tuesday had released the city’s annual crime statistics for 2019. It showed a 9% drop in serious crimes from 9,552 in 2018 to 8,677 in the last year.

The NCRB report shows that the number of murder cases in Pune declined to 73 cases in 2018 from 110 cases in 2017. When it comes to the cases of kidnapping and abduction, they went down to 636 in 2018 from a total of 964 cases in 2017. This is an improvement considering that in 2016, the city had recorded 851 kidnappings and abductions and the same had gone up in 2017.

Crime against women reduced to 1,481 cases in 2018 from 2,032 in 2017, while crime against children reduced to 877 cases from 1,335 in 2017.

As per the report, crime against senior citizens was 178 in 2017. It reduced to 169 in 2018. There were 318 cases of cybercrimes in 2017, which reduced to 153 cases in 2018.

In the case of juvenile crimes, they stood at 715 in 2017 and reduced to 483 in 2018, the NCRB report stated.

Title: Comply with orders or be present to explain : Uttrakhand High Court to UPCL
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

NAINITAL: The Uttarakhand high court (HC) came down heavily on the Uttarakhand Power Corporation Limited (UPCL) managing director (MD) saying that he should either comply with the court’s order or be personally present in court to explain why its orders have not been followed.

The warning was issued by the single judge bench of Justice Manoj Kumar Tiwari while hearing a contempt petition filed by Udham Singh Nagar resident Avdhesh Kumar Sharma. Speaking to TOI, Sharma who was a labour in the UPCL said that he along with many others had filed the contempt petition after the corporation did not follow the court’s orders. “We had approached the labour court which passed an order in 1992 that we should be made permanent and given several other benefits. The UPCL then approached the high court which upheld the labour court’s order. However, our services were regularised only by 2009 when the labour court order had come in 1992. We approached the high court again which in 2014 said that all the benefits should be given from 1992. Yet the corporation is not complying with the orders,” Sharma said.

The court has now listed the case for February 18.

Title: Cuttack: 3 government engineers among seven held for graft
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

CUTTACK: The state vigilance on Thursday arrested five working and retired engineers of the Roads & Buildings (R&B) Division-II, Cuttack , as well as a contractor on charges of misappropriating government money to the tune of Rs 43 lakh during the construction of a bridge over Taladanda Canal near Nayabazar , here, between 2014 and 2019.

All six along with a retired divisional accounts officer of R&B were forwarded to the court of special judge vigilance, Cuttack, and were remanded to judicial custody till January 22.

Among those arrested on the basis of prima facie evidence included assistant executive engineer Rajanikanta Dalabehera, assistant engineer Rabinarayan Sahu, divisional accounts officer (retired) Abanikanta Rout, assistant engineer Ranjan Kumar Debata, executive engineer (retd) Sudhir Kumar Panda, superintending engineer (retd) Bimal Chandra Dash and contractor Trupti Ranjan Debata.

The state vigilance had registered a case on December 10 at the Vigilance police station in Cuttack under the Prevention of Corruption Act and Section 420 of the IPC.

An official release stated that investigations revealed that the construction work was executed under R&B Division-II, Cuttack. During the tendering process, Trupti, the lone bidder, submitted his bid papers by hiding the fact that his elder brother Ranjan was an assistant engineer at the R&B Division, Cuttack. Trupti furnished a false “no relation certificate” in violation of the terms and conditions of the tender.

The tender was accepted by Bimal, the then superintending engineer, R&B Circle, Cuttack, for Rs 2,12,53,801. Accordingly, an agreement was executed on January 5, 2015 with Trupti. Since he had no such work experience, Trupti executed a power of attorney and authorised Manas Ranjan Ojha to execute the work. But in reality it was his brother Ranjan who was executing the work.

After completion of the work, Trupti was paid a sum of Rs 2,02,25,148 by the executive engineer based on the measurements undertaken by the assistant engineers and assistant executive engineers without any bills and invoices from authorised/designated dealers, the official release stated.

Further investigation revealed that during execution of the work, an amount of Rs 43,16,044 was misappropriated by the government officials in connivance with the contractor by falsely showing excess utilisation of iron rods and cement and allowing payment in excess of the estimated cost.

Title: Delhi high court refuses to take up plea to move protesters at Shaheen Bagh
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Delhi high court (PTI photo)

NEW DELHI: Delhi high court on Friday refused to entertain a plea urging it to intervene to remove protesters at Shaheen Bagh so that smooth traffic movement can renew on the DND Flyway and other areas. The plea complained of inaction on part of Delhi Police in clearing the demonstrators blocking roads that are causing traffic congestions.

The application, in the form of a handwritten letter, was mentioned before a bench of Chief Justice D N Patel and Justice C Hari Shankar, which, however, declined to give any relief or issue any order.

The letter by two residents said the route from Delhi to UP, Delhi to Uttarakhand, Delhi to Noida hospitals, Ashram and Badarpur is unavailable due to the protest as the roads around Shaheen Bagh are blocked and vehicles are being diverted to the DND Flyway.

“Lakhs of people are suffering and it is also an issue for people in emergency. The protesters have put barricades and heavy stones on the side of the roads and are not even allowing pedestrians to pass. They have also damaged the dividers and other public properties, causing loss to the government exchequer,” the letter said, pleading HC to step in and give orders.

Title: N Chandrababu Naidu dares YS Jaganmohan Reddy to seek fresh mandate before shifting capital from Amaravati
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

N Chandrababu Naidu

AMARAVATI: TDP supremo N Chandrababu Naidu on Thursday dared chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy to seek mandate from the people afresh before shifting the capital city from Amaravati .

He said that he would accept Jagan’s decision if he gets re-elected. “You can’t move the capital city from Amaravati even by an inch,” Naidu thundered.

In a token gesture, he collected donations to run the movement for capital city in Vijayawada before reaching Machilipatnam to attend a public meeting organised by Amaravati JAC.

Addressing the meeting, Naidu said Amaravati is equipped to facilitate administrators and there was no reason to shift the capital city. “Amaravati is the future of the state. It is the future of the next generations. I appeal to people to send at least one from each family to the movement to protect the capital city,” said Naidu. He lashed out at the state government for not visiting the families of the farmers who died of heart-attack following the government’s plans to shift the capital city. Naidu fumed at the government when there was a power outage during the public meeting and alleged that they have deliberately disrupted power supply. He, however, said that they are not cowards and warned of serious consequences if the government did not relent.

Naidu said farmers have sacrificed nearly 33,000 acres of land for the construction of the capital city and it was a rare instance in history and criticised the ministers for making derogatory comments on the farmers movement. He said the agitation for Amaravati has turned into a peoples’ movement and the Jaganmohan Reddy government would surely get washed away in the anger of people.

“I may have been defeated. But, I am not completely out. I will continue to fight for the people as long as I have the blessings of the people,” said Naidu. He said that women who never stepped out of their houses have also joined the movement. He faulted the police for toeing to the line of YSRC leaders and preventing the bus yatra on Wednesday. He showered praises on Jana Sena leader Pawan Kalyan and called him a fighter.

Title: Mussoorie: Man commits suicide in hotel room
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Image used for representational purpose

MUSSOORIE: A man allegedly committed suicide in a hotel room on Tuesday night. The deceased has been identified as Arvind Joshi (42) who is reported to be a resident of Tehri Garhwal.

According to police sources, it seems that the deceased consumed some poisonous substance in the room of a hotel here near Picture Palace. His body was discovered in a hotel room on Wednesday. However, after police investigation, it has been sent for post-mortem on Thursday.

"It looks like a case of suicide by consumption of a poisonous substance as a glass with some liquid and a suicide note has been recovered," informed Neeraj Kathait, sub-inspector, while adding that the exact cause of death would be known once the post-mortem report is received.

He told that the deceased had taken a hotel on lease on Camel's Back road and in his suicide note he has mentioned financial loss as a reason for suicide.

Title: Jaganmohan Reddy to appear before CBI court today
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

HYDERABAD: Heavy security was in place at the CBI court in Gagan Vihar where Andhra Pradesh chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy will appear before the judge on Friday in connection with the quid pro quo case filed by CBI against him.

There were speculations that he may challenge the order of the CBI court before the high court. “However, he has decided to appear before the CBI court on Friday,” said sources, who cited heavy security arrangements being made at the CBI court premises as proof for their claims.

The frayed tempers on account of protests over capital being shifted out of Amaravati are also cited as one of the reasons for heightened security for Jagan , sources added.

Jagan did not appear before the trial court ever since he became chief minister after his YSRCP came to power in the neighbouring state.

His counsel has been filing exemption pleas every week and the court has been allowing them with the former citing Jagan’s busy schedule as chief minister. However, last week, principal special judge BV Madhusudan Rao ordered Jagan and his associate and Rajya Sabha MP Vijayasai Reddy to appear before the court on January 10.

CBI had filed 11 chargesheets against Jagan in the case charging him with influencing his father YS Rajasekhara Reddy when he was chief minister of undivided AP to dole out public assets to certain businessmen and industrialists between 2004 and 2009 in lieu of the investments they made in his firms.

YSRCP alleges that a politically motivated case was foisted against Jagan after the death of YSR and soon after he quit Congress.

Title: Mysuru university issues showcause notice to student protest organisers
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Participants raise slogans during Wednesday’s protest in Mysuru.

MYSURU: In a big boost to the student community, the University of Mysore stood behind its students and pointed an accusing finger at mischief-mongers. While it has initiated legal action issuing showcause notices to the organisers of the demonstration on Wednesday, it was quick to defend its students.

Varsity vice-chancellor G Hemantha Kumar said the university has lodged a police complaint about the incident. “We are extending all support to the investigation," he said.

According to registrar R Shivappa, the students who had organised the protest were social activists "They were exercising their democratic rights, but a woman misused the situation. We know all these students well. They are not anti-national elements. They are known for seeking social justice. We’re helping police in their investigation to identify the culprit," he said.

He also said the university administration will not allow any student to indulge in anti-national activities. "We won’t allow anyone to use our campuses for anti-national activities," he said.

In its report submitted to the governor's office, the varsity said: "We have issued show cause notice to the Research Scholars Association and Dalita Vidyarthi Okkuta.”

The police launched the investigation in the morning after the video of the girl holding a ‘Free Kashmir’ placard went viral. A team of officials visited the PG campus and quizzed students about the incident. Police also collected CCTV footage for further investigation and confirmed a probe in under way.

According to the complaint, police or varsity authorities were not aware of the rally being held on Wednesday. On learning about the flash protest where slogans were raised, a police team reached the spot and left the spot. It was found that one of the protestors was holding a placard that encouraged protesters to oppose the government in connection with the Kashmir issue.

The protest was held without permission of the University of Mysore or police. Students took out a torchlight march from the clock tower inside the campus and reached the entrance where they sat on a dharna. Sources said only one protester had held the controversial placard.

Title: TMC pulls out all stops to improve Swachh Survekshan 2020 ranking
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

TIRUPATI: After its position went down by two ranks last year, the Tirupati municipal corporation this year has pulled out all the stops to improve its position in Swachh Survekshan 2020.

After securing the sixth spot in Swachh Survekshan 2018, TMC slipped to the eighth position in the 2019 survey. So this year, it has unveiled an aggressive information, education and communication (IEC) strategy and has been organising back to back novel activities to garner people’s support.

Some of the activities organised by TMC include, the twin bin concept, the 5k run, a human chain involving over 10,000 students, a quiz and painting competition organised at Sri Venkateswara university and distribution of over 10,000 plus Swachh Survekshan 2020 badges to hoteliers and students. TMC is also promoting its ‘‘Swachh Tirupati” campaign on its Facebook page.

The civic body is now set to organise a Swachh short film and singing contests on the theme ‘‘Clean Tirupati - Green Tirupati” at the amphitheatre at Prakasam Park on January 11. It has already received 70 entries for the short film contest and 25 entries for the singing contest. TMC would give away cash prizes to the top three winners in both the contests.

Speaking to TOI, TMC commissioner PS Girisha, said Tirupati, which is home to a population of 2.88 lakh as per the 2011 census, also attracts a mobile population of nearly 80,000-1 lakh devotees every day.

“Keeping a city clean that is home to nearly 3 lakh people, besides attracting millions of devotees from across the globe annually, is always a challenge. Despite the challenges, TMC broke into the top 10 cleanest cities in the country as per Swachh Survekshan 2018 and 2019”, said PS Girisha.

“Although we slipped by two ranks last year, we are sure every citizen of the temple city will strengthen our efforts to improve our position this year”, asserted the TMC commissioner.

Title: Mokka Jagannadha Rao is new VC of ANU
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Mokka Jagannadha Rao has been appointed as the vice-chancellor of Adikavi Nannaya University , which is the education hub for East and West Godavari districts. He is a geology professor from Andhra University. He obtained his MS from Alaska University in the United States. He has conducted research on residues debris between Visakhapatnam and Bheemili coastline. tnn

Title: Get set for Bengal launch of national debate competition Speak for India
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Kolkata: The argumentative Kolkatan will have a new reason to debate.

Registrations are open to the college students for the first season of the West Bengal edition of “Speak for India”. This widely popular inter-collegiate debate competition has been garnering good response from the student community across the nation. An initiative by Federal Bank in association with The Times of India and Ei Samay provides a platform for college students across West Bengal where they will voice their views and opinions on contemporary issues for changing the society.

The aim of the forum is to discover the top inter-collegiate debaters in the state through multiple levels of competitions. It gives college students the opportunity to explore their awareness, insights and perspective on contemporary topics. All college students from the state can participate in the competition. All the participants at each level would get participation certificates and they can choose their preferred language from Bengali, English or Hindi. The winner gets a cash prize of Rs 1.5 lakh and the runner-up gets Rs 1 lakh cash prize. Each of the finalists also stands to win Rs 25,000 each. College students can participate by registering online at www.speakforindia.in.

In Tamil Nadu, the second edition of the popular intercollegiate debate competition, Speak for India , was held in September last year. An initiative by Federal Bank in association with The Times of India, the competition had emerged as a vibrant, competitive platform for college students across Tamil Nadu to voice their views and opinions on contemporary issues and become change-makers of society.

“Speak for India is a huge platform. Since I won the competition, I have been getting a lot of opportunities. I have been invited as a guest speaker at 11 different institutions. I have also learnt a lot from the method adopted by ‘Speak for India’. In their very first round, they gave us just one minute to summarise what we had to say. This taught me time management and confidence. Participating in a competition of this scale has also trained me to think out-of-the-box,” said V Veera Balaji, a final-year MA (commerce) student and last year’s title winner in Tamil Nadu.

Phases of evaluation would include district, zonal, semi-final and the final rounds. The contest will be conducted at common venues. At the initial level, participants will speak at their respective district centre or at the designated centres.

Title: Congress MLA raises privilege issue against CS, three others
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Puducherry: The tussle between lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi and Congress government over the mode of appointment of state election commissioner (SEC) intensified on Thursday with Congress MLA T Djeamourthy raising a breach of privilege issue against the chief secretary and three other officials for disobeying a unanimous resolution passed by the legislative assembly appointing retired IAS official T M Balakrishnan as SEC in July last year.

Djeamourthy in a memorandum submitted to V Sivakozhunthu, speaker of the legislative assembly, accused the chief secretary (Ashwani Kumar), local administration secretary (Ashok Kumar), local administration director (G Malarkannan) and local administration under-secretary (Giddi Balaram) of releasing an advertisement to select the SEC, bypassing the government’s appointment of Balakrishnan as the SEC. The Congress MLA charged that the officials insulted the assembly, the speaker, the cabinet and the minister concerned and the elected members by disobeying the assembly's resolution and raised a privilege issue seeking the speaker to initiate appropriate action against the officials to restore the dignity and decorum of the House.

He pointed out that chief minister V Narayanasamy issued an order on January 3 directing the chief secretary not to obey Bedi’s order and initiate efforts to select an SEC. He said Narayanasamy in the order cited relevant Articles of the Constitution of India and Sections of Puducherry Village and Commune Panchayat Act and Puducherry Municipalities Act to prove the legality of the appointment of SEC.

“But the officials have violated the government orders by releasing an advertisement on January 7 to select SEC unilaterally without the knowledge and approval of the speaker, cabinet, chief minister, minister concerned and the government. The act is a breach of privilege of the elected members and an insult to the House,” he said.

Djeamourthy also regretted out that the chief secretary failed to honour the Union home ministry’s direction in September 2018 to consider re-delegation of financial powers conferred on the lieutenant governor to the secretaries, heads of the departments and offices and council of ministers proportionately.

In the last three years, MLAs cutting across party lines had raised ‘breach of privilege’ issues against Bedi, BJP Puducherry president V Saminathan, who is one of the three members nominated to the legislative assembly by the Centre, under-secretary (confidential and cabinet) M Kannan, Bedi’s secretary G Theva Neethi Dhas and former Puducherry municipality commissioner R Chandrasekaran accusing them of lowering the dignity and decorum of the House.

Title: Civic polls: Manikonda residents see hope on the horizon
Content:
Residents and officials confirmed the municipality has a 5-km open storm water system, however, the channels c... Read More

HYDERABAD: The upcoming civic polls offer a glimmer of hope to residents of Manikonda municipality who feel their demands for better amenities have been going unheard for years. Broken roads and open roads are in this municipality which constitutes three gram panchayats — Manikonda, Alkapur and Neknampur. Areas under the municipality house a sizeable population of techies.For many, a major issue has been a lack of connectivity to Outer Ring Road (ORR). “Many bought houses here because of its proximity to the IT belt through ORR. Only later did they realise that most link roads to ORR have either been encroached upon or are still undeveloped,” said Manoj Kumar, an IT employee who resides in the area.Apart from lack of connectivity, maintenance of roads has also been an issue. “Several roads are riddled with potholes. Driving on these roads have resulted in severe back problems for many,” said Ram Shankar, a local. For example, Road No 1 in Alkapur, which connects to a school and is used by children daily, remains in a poor state. Drainage issues only make matters worse, locals said.Residents and officials confirmed the municipality has a 5-km open storm water system, however, the channels carry both storm water and drainage. Locals say that the two must be separated. Attempts by TOI to connect with Manikonda commissioner Jaynath went unanswered.

Title: Jubilee Hills' SI caught with Rs 50,000 cash; inspector flees
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

The two cops initially agreed for bribe of 80,000 but settled for 50,000 & two bottles of whiskey

HYDERABAD: A sub-inspector ( SI ) of Jubilee Hills police station was caught red-handed while accepting Rs 50,000 cash and two whiskey bottles as alleged bribe from a businessman at Jubilee Hills on Thursday. As Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) sleuths were en route to arrest Jubilee Hills inspector Balvantaiah, a co-accused in the case, he abandoned his bandobust duty point near Krishan Kant Park and fled in an auto-rickshaw. ACB sleuths launched a manhunt to nab him.

On January 7, ACB sleuths had received a complaint from one M Vamsi Krishna Chowdary, a businessman from Jubilee Hills, alleging that SI P Sudheer Reddy and inspector Balvantaiah demanded Rs 1 lakh bribe to grant station bail to him in a cheating case and help him in settling the case in the Lok Adalat.

On December 29, Akshaya, who runs Page 3 Luxury Saloon, lodged a complaint against Chowdary alleging that he availed hair, face and neck treatment for his wife and also purchased some products, worth Rs 34,130 and failed to pay up. Based on the complaint, police had registered a case under Sections 420 (Cheating) and 406 (criminal breach of trust) of the IPC against Chowdary.

“After registering the case, the SI and the inspector demanded Rs 1 lakh bribe to grant station bail to the accused, drop Section 406 of the IPC and help him by recommending to the complainant to settle the case in the Lok Adalat. The two accused have also made the complainant pay Rs 25,000 to the spa owner on December 31 with an agreement that the balance amount would be paid after settling the case at Lok Adalat,” an ACB official said.

Chowdary then requested the two cops to reduce the bribe amount and they initially agreed for Rs 80,000 and later settled for Rs 50,000 and two bottles of whiskey. At 2.15 pm, an ACB team trapped SI Sudheer Reddy when he got into the businessman’s Innova car on Road Number 10 of Jubilee Hills and accepted Rs 50,000 cash and two liquor bottles. “The SI spoke to the inspector over the phone before collecting the bribe,” an ACB official said.

After arresting the SI, the ACB team shifted him to the Jubilee Hills police station, while another team rushed towards Krishan Kant Park where inspector Balvantaiah was on bandobust duty. “Balvantaiah got wind of the trap. He stopped an auto and fled from the spot at Krishan Kant Park. He switched off his mobile phones. We have launched a manhunt to nab him,” an ACB official said.

Title: Bengaluru: Are air pollution, low birth weight linked? Study on
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

BENGALURU: Shalini Balakrishna, 29, from Old Bagaluru Layout, east Bengaluru, is due for delivery by the third week of January. In her third trimester, she wanted to confirm the air she breathes does not impact her baby’s health. Volunteering to be part of a study , she wore a device that tracked the quality of the air she inhaled for 24 hours.

Track the pollution level in your city

She is among 505 pregnant women voluntarily wearing air pollution trackers during their pregnancies and turning up for check-ups at Bagaluru and Sriramapura public health centres. The women must wear this device for 24 hours once each in the second and third trimesters of pregnancy to record their exposure to indoor and outdoor air pollution.

The ongoing study by Public Health Foundation of India (PHFI) is assessing the relation between air pollution and the risk of low birth weight . After a pilot in 2017, the team started the actual study in February 2018. The areas chosen, Old Bagaluru Layout and a slum in Sriramapura, are located closer to commercial areas and main roads.

The pregnant women have to wear the personal air quality monitoring device with a power bank kept in a ventilated sling bag, which together weigh less than 300 grams.

Shalini told TOI she was curious to know the study outcome. “The air I breathe should be the best for my child’s health,” she said.

“Most of the participants are homemakers. While resting, they can keep the device closer to them,” said Prafulla Shriyan, research associate with PHFI who is working on the study.

Through the device, the study estimates the level of exposure to air pollutants including coarse particulate matter (PM10), fine particulate matter (PM 2.5) and carbon monoxide levels in both indoor and ambient environments.

During the study, the socio-economic and demographic variables, current and previous obstetric history, fuel used for cooking, heating, location of the kitchen are also considered. Field workers seek information on other sources of indoor pollution such as burning of incense sticks, mosquito repellents and candles.

Of the 505 women taking part in the study, 213 have delivered so far. “We observed higher exposure to indoor pollution among women living in small houses without exhaust/ chimney/ ventilation in kitchen, who used kerosene and solid biomass fuel and whose spouses smoked at home,” Prafulla said.

“The study will also follow up on the delivered children until they turn two. The objective is to estimate if the absolute risk of having low birth weight is caused by air pollution and other variables, which has been established in global studies. Our focus is on understanding nuances of this issue in the Bengaluru scenario,” said Dr Giridhar Babu, professor and head of Lifecourse Epidemiology, PHFI, Bengaluru.

Title: Telangana urban polls: 900 nominations on 1st day
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representational Image

HYDERABAD: Over 900 nominations were filed on Monday, the first day of filing nomination papers for the January 22 elections for urban local bodies (municipalities and municipal corporations) across the state. The last day for filing nominations is January 10.

Chief secretary Somesh Kumar has directed district collectors to make necessary arrangements for conducting the elections peacefully and complete the process as per the schedule released by the State Election Commission. He also instructed the collectors to involve themselves completely in the election process.

“Collectors will liaise with the municipal commissioner at every stage during the election process,” municipal administration and urban development (MA&UD) department principal secretary Arvind Kumar said.

Meanwhile, over 17,000 fresh applications were received for enrolment as voters from 15 Assembly segments in Hyderabad district, officials said on Wednesday.

In all, 30,040 claims and objections were received after December 16. “Of them 2,691 applications were accepted and 1,449 applications were rejected. Also, 4,140 applications have been disposed of, while 25,900 applications are pending,” according to a statement issued by Hyderabad district election authorities. Till now, Hyderabad district in its 15 assembly constituencies has recorded 42,16,826 voters and 3,977 polling stations have been assigned to the district.

In GHMC, by-elections to a ward, number 30 (Dabeerpura), would be held on January 22. The election was necessitated as corporator Riyaz-ul-Hassan Effendi was elected to the Legislative Council.

A meeting pertaining to summary revision of electoral rolls was also held at GHMC head office. Representatives of all political parties participated in the meeting, held as a regular exercise conducted by district election authority. A special campaign would he held on January 11 and 12, at all polling stations. People could enrol and report corrections in the existing electoral rolls. The SEC would hold National Voters’ Day celebrations at Ravindra Bharati on January 25.

Title: Cyberabad cops launch highway patrol vehicles
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Hyderabad: With the 27-year-old veterinary doctor’s gangrape and murder in an open plot abutting the National Highway (NH) exposing chinks in patrolling system, Cyberabad police on Thursday launched four highway patrol vehicles to increase security, tackle increased vehicular movement and cover vulnerable accident spots on National Highway-44.

The four patrol mobiles would cover the 54-km stretch between Hasan Nagar X Road, Rajendranagar, and Hamid Cotton Mills, Shadnagar, round the clock. According to police, each patrol vehicle would consist of a sub-inspector, two assistant SIs or constable or head constable and a driver and cover cover between 12-16 kilometres, an officer added.

The patrolling vehicle staff would help in cordoning off an accident spot, provide first aid, shift injured to hospital and inform law and order police and ‘108’ ambulance. The team would also curb drunk driving, helmet, triple riding, overcrowding in autos, extra projection, cell phone use, seat belt, passengers in a goods vehicle, speeding, controlling sale and consumption of alcohol at unauthorised places and other illegal activities along the highway.According to cops, the officials would also help in case of vehicle breakdown, fuel exhaust, route/direction and visibly lost people.

Title: Water & electricity: Alkapur wants the basics
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Hyderabad: In techies’ residential hub of Alkapur , bijlli and paani remain the key poll issues. In the past year, residents have come onto the streets by the thousands to protest the shortage of safe drinking water in the area. “We need 200 tankers per day to meet our water needs but at present we are only getting 15 tankers,” said Rajasekhar, a resident. He said prices for tankers peak during summers going as high as Rs 2,000 per tanker.

The current situation has made locals heavily dependent on private players. They claim that the ‘tanker mafia’ has threatened them that they will not supply water to them if they approach the water board while the latter cannot meet the demand.

“We have been left in the lurch. If we pursue the matter with officials and they are not able to deliver, we will have no one to go to,” said one resident on the condition of anonymity.

“We have already presented a proposal wherein the township takes up 50% of the cost for laying pipelines and the other half is taken up by the government. Residents have been asked to consider this plan,” said HMWS&SB general manager, division 18, Ravinder Reddy.

When asked, the Alkapur Resident Welfare Association (RWA) said that this was not a feasible option.

Title: Hyderabad: Too many civic bodies, too little infra
Content:
Hyderabad skyline

HYDERABAD: A small town with one lakh population, Jawaharnagar was elevated to a municipality from a gram panchayat in April last year. Within three months, the municipality was made a municipal corporation. Six months down the line, nothing much has changed as Jawaharnagar still has no proper roads, underground drainage, parks, graveyards and streetlights.The official estimation is that the corporation requires at least Rs 500 crore to have basic facilties in place. Worse still, the corporation continues to function from a small panchayat building without a town planning officer, an engineer and accounts officer.The predicament of Pocharam, an emerging IT hub in the eastern part of the city, is no different. It has about 50,000 population and was made a municipality in August 2018. Except the IT corridor, the municipality lacks civic infrastructure . Villages like Narapally, Ismailikhan, Yanampet and Annojiguda are in a bad shape. Ironically, Pocharam municipality in the IT hub does not have a facility to enable people pay their property tax online.The TRS government had hurriedly created as many as 60 new urban local bodies without providing or improving infrastructure and basic facilities. According to officials, Rs 1 lakh crore would be needed for creating facilities in all 141 urban local bodies. The Administrative Staff College of India (ASCI) conducted a preliminary study on infrastructure facilities in 73 municipalities and estimated that Rs 40,720 crore would be required in the next five years. With new municipalities added to the list, the fund requirement could be around Rs 60,000 crore.

Title: Pune airport to get e-gates, body scanners in April
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Pune airport

PUNE: Come April, e-gates and body scanners will be a permanent fixture at the city airport.

“Both the projects are high-priority. The trial run of the body scanner is going on. Before making it a permanent facility, we want to ensure that there are no glitches in the services offered. The decision for both the projects would take a concrete shape soon,” Pune airport director Ajay Kumar told TOI.

At present, Lohegaon airport has a body scanner machine installed. The facility was set up by a Germany-based company, having a base in Delhi.

Tokyo-based NEC Technologies will set up three e-gates to make the entry into the airport easy and seamless. “E-gates equipped with facial recognition technology will be installed at three points — the entrance of the airport, security holding area and the boarding gate area,” a spokesperson of the Tokyo-based company had said earlier.

“The company chosen to install the facial recognition gates (e-gates) has conducted a survey of the airport and the work on its installation would start soon,” another official said.

The e-gates function on facial recognition technology. Before entering the airport, passengers will have to activate their DigiYatra identity and capture facial image at self-service kiosks. Then, passengers will proceed to the e-gates at the entrance of the airport for verifying boarding pass and facial recognition. Once they are in the airport, passengers can complete check-in, security checks and boarding processes seamlessly through facial recognition.

A source said the number of body scanners would increase once the trial run was successfully completed of the one already installed at the city airport. “The trial run of the scanner would go on for a couple of months before being commissioned,” the source said.

Last year, the Bureau of Civil Aviation Security had issued a circular, making it mandatory for 84 airports in the country to install full-body scanners by March 2020 to screen air travellers.

Title: Herd of 14 jumbos on a rampage in Chittoor
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Tirupati: A marauding herd of 14 tuskers are on a rampage at several villages in Chittoor district, destroying crops in large extents of farmlands for the past three days.

A herd, which has crossed over from the Tamil Nadu-Karnataka border to Andhra Pradesh, has already left a trail of destruction in villages, including Rallpalli, Kusuru and Gondhivalla Vooru and their surrounding areas since Tuesday night.

Villagers said that the 14 wild pachyderms have been camping at Ranganayakula Cheruvu area from the past three days. They said they had informed the forest department officials about the movement of the elephants and the damage to the crops. Following the complaint, forest officials have roped in drum-beaters and are trying to drive the elephants back into the forest.

Farmers and villagers, who live near the tri-state borders have time and again appealed to the forest department officials to put an end to the jumbo menace, but nothing concrete has been done yet, it is alleged. tnn

Title: ‘Give tickets to BC community candidates’
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Hyderabad: As many as 14 various Backward Classes Welfare Associations on Wednesday demanded that TRS, Congress and BJP give tickets to candidates from BC community in 50% of the total seats in open category. National BC Welfare Association president R Krishnaiah, along with the representatives of 13 other associations, said injustice was done to BCs in municipal seats reservation. “The BC population is nearly 55% of the total population in the state. However, only 32% reservations were given to BCs in the quota finalised and announced by the government,” he said. TNN

Title: B Laxma Reddy Cong candidate for Miryalguda
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Hyderabad: Telangana Pradesh Congress Committee president N Uttam Kumar Reddy on Wednesday announced that social activist B Laxma Reddy will be the party candidate for Miryalguda municipality chairperson post.

Interestingly, Laxma Reddy joined the Congress on Wednesday and his candidature for Miryalguda municipality chairperson post was announced the same day. The TPCC chief also declared that Bachalakuri Prakash (SC) is the party candidate for Neredcherla municipality chairperson post in Nalgonda Parliamentary constituency.

Earlier in the day, Nirmala Jagga reddy, wife of Sanga Reddy MLA T Jayaprakash Reddy, filed her nomination for the post of Sanga Reddy municipal chairperson. The Congress has started finalising candidates for municipal wards and divisions too.

Title: Key posts continue to stay vacant, health department looks for boost
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

PUNE: A senior health official posted in Akola district has an additional task in hand nearly 480km away. The administration has told him to double up as the joint director of the state health department in Pune.

The Akola-based official has been told to take up the additional charge of the joint director of health services following the retirement of his predecessor on January 1. Senior health officials said the order has once again brought into focus the issue of long-pending vacancies in the department.

“This is the state of affairs in the health department because nearly 63% of key posts of Class I officers, including directors, additional directors, joint directors and deputy directors, are lying vacant for many years. The charge of these keys posts is given as an additional charge to someone already overburdened,” a senior health official said requesting anonymity.

Public health expert Prakash Bhoi, who was the joint director and responsible for controlling vector-borne diseases in the state, retired from his service on December 31.

“Such a key post cannot be left vacant. Hence, an additional charge has been given to a senior health official working in Akola district. Now, how can he be present to oversee work of the joint director’s office in Pune while dispensing an equally important duty in Akola?,” the official said.

When contacted, Pradeep Vyas, principal secretary in the department of health and family welfare, told TOI, “The civil surgeon in Akola was high up on the seniority list for promotion and continuously making representation for the same. Regular posting orders are issued at this level with concurrence of the health minister and chief minister. But this takes time. As a result, the additional charge was proposed as a temporary measure since the incumbent officer was superannuating. We will ensure effective changes soon.”

The instance of the Akola health official getting an additional charge is, however, not the lone case. The issue of long pending vacancies has become a serious concern.

“In the absence of supervision from top officials, there is no one to fix accountability of staffers working at the region- and district-level. There is no vision to take the department a notch higher, bring in some positive changes, make newer experiments and try out-of-the-box ideas. There is no motivation left,” another state health official said.

Another senior officer said, “The entire administrative procedures are in a mess in health department. There is no seniority list and there have been no promotions for years. In the revenue department, a clerk can go up the ladder and even become the tehsildar. But in our department, there are scores of examples where people working for more than 25 years in same post.”

The state government has created two posts of directors in health department. Of them, the director’s post in Pune is being handled as an additional charge by senior public health expert Archana Patil (who is an additional director). This means one of the two posts of director is vacant.

Title: FASTag mandatory only on national highways: MSRDC
Content:
Glitches and stutters have marred the roll-out of FASTag, which will become mandatory from January 15, albeit ... Read More

The roll-out of FASTag — a way to electronically pay toll — has been anything but smooth in the state

PUNE: Glitches and stutters have marred the roll-out of FASTag , which will become mandatory from January 15, albeit only on national highways.Some people have been charged incorrect amounts, while others had to pay twice — via FASTag and by cash.FASTag will be compulsory only at the 500-plus toll plazas on national highways controlled by National Highways Authority of India and not state highways, which come under Maharashtra State Road Development Corporation (MSRDC). “Maharashtra is the first state in the country to roll out FASTag across all state highways, but it remains optional,” MSRDC general manager (toll collection) Bharat Bastewad said.The roll-out of FASTag — a way to electronically pay toll — has been anything but smooth in the state. Many people said the authorities should have thoroughly tested the system before rolling it out.Mumbai resident Vrinda Walavalkar said on a recent trip, their vehicle’s FASTag was scanned twice by an operator on the ‘ETC+Cash’ lane at the Khalapur toll plaza and both times, the balance was erroneously shown as 0. “We paid cash and proceeded, only for my friend to get a FASTag charge notification a while later,” Walavalkar said.At the next plaza, they took this up with the operator, who told them to call a phone number mentioned on the tag. On their return trip, just before Urse toll plaza, Walvalkar said they received a message that the same amount was debited again. "We had not even passed the toll plaza then. We managed to get free passage at the time. We have been trying to reach the number mentioned on the tag since then, but got no response,” she saidAnother Mumbai resident, Ameya Hardas, ended up paying toll for a different class of vehicle on a recent trip from Pune. “While coming to Pune on January 5, the correct amount (Rs230) was debited from my tag. On my return trip, Rs1,166 was debited — I noticed that I was charged the fee levied on multi-axle vehicles,” he claimed. Hardas’ tag was issued by a private bank.Bastewad said different tags were issued for different classes of vehicles and that it was unlikely that a single tag could be charged different amount within a few hours. “This could be taken up with the tag-issuing bank,” he said.“It is advisable to physically obtain the tags rather than online. Those who got the wrong tags must immediately have them replaced,” Pravin Bhalesain, founder-CEO of ZatpatPay, a company working on FASTag implementation and providing FASTag solution to banks, said.He said the ETC ( electronic toll collection ) lanes on the expressway are already equipped with FASTag readers. “Hand-held devices have been issued as backup,” he said.

Title: Delhi: Court gives bail to 12, tells cops to clear their doubts on CAA
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

NEW DELHI: Granting bail to 12 men arrested following the Seemapuri protests against Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) and National Register of Citizens , a city court on Friday directed Delhi Police to clear the “doubts” of these men about CAA.

The applicants will appear on January 19 between 2pm and 4pm at the Seemapuri police station, where the investigating officer/station house officer “shall make endeavour to remove the doubts of the applicants in respect of CAA”, additional sessions judge (ASJ) Sanjeev Kumar Malhotra said. Besides this condition, the accused were directed to furnish a personal bond of Rs 20,000 each with one surety for the bail.

The right to protest is a fundamental right in a democracy but this right of peaceful protest and open criticism of government policies does not extend to disturbing the public order, the court pointed out. On Thursday, another city court also made similar observations while granting bail to 15 men in relation to the Daryaganj violence.

Public peace, safety and tranquillity of a place cannot be jeopardised owing to protests, ASJ Malhotra said. “The Constitution of India also prohibits a person from making any statement that incites people to commit an offence,” he added.

The court also asked the investigating officer if any of the 12 men was seen in the CCTV footage collected by police or in the video on news channels or social media as pelting stones or causing damage to public property or injuring cops. The police submitted that none of them was involved in any such activity.

The lawyers of the accused argued a few of these men weren’t even present at the spot and the rest were protesting peacefully. The men have also been booked on the attempt-to-murder charge though the injuries suffered by seven cops were simple in nature, the lawyers said.

Title: ED attaches Haryana-based firm's assets worth Rs 2,500 crore
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

NEW DELHI: Assets worth over Rs 2,500 crore have been attached in connection with a money laundering and fraud case against Haryana-based SRS group , the Enforcement Directorate said on Thursday.

"Movable and immovable assets like land, real estate projects , commercial projects, residential houses, a school, cinema hall, balances in bank accounts and fixed deposits totalling to Rs 2,510.82 crore of the SRS Group, its promoters, their family members and associate companies have been attached," the agency said in a statement.

A provisional order for attachment of these properties has been issued under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act ( PMLA ).

The group and its promoters have been accused of allegedly making fraudulent promises of giving high returns to investors in the guise of investments in real estate units like shops, plots, flats and apartments among others.

The SRS Group, as per information provided on its official website, is a diversified business house with a "strong presence" across multiple sectors that include gold and jewellery, commodities, cinemas, retail, hospitality, financial services, real estate, education and health care.

The ED said its probe found that the promoter of the group, Anil Jindal, and founder directors Jitender Kumar Garg and Praveen Kumar Kapoor along with other accomplices "hatched a criminal conspiracy" and lured investments from several individual and institutions on fake promises of high returns in the guise of investments. Jindal was arrested by the Faridabad Police in 2018 as part of the probe.

"These investments were later siphoned off into group companies through various shell companies of the group having dummy directors, who were mainly SRS Group employees," the agency said.

"To sustain their illegal investment schemes, the accused further availed loans which were used for re-payments and to develop their other projects," the statement said. PTI

Title: Relief for private hospitals as Centre releases Rs 250 crore
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

New Delhi: The Centre released nearly Rs 250 crore under the Central Government Health Scheme ( CGHS ) — over the past month — to clear dues towards treatment of its beneficiaries at select private hospitals , the Indian Medical Association (IMA) and Association of Healthcare Providers, India (AHPI), said in a statement on Friday.

The associations claimed that the action was consequent to submission of a memorandum and meeting with Union state finance minister Anurag Thakur and other CGHS officials. They added: “While the total outstanding was close to Rs 1,000 crore, the approved outstanding from CGHS as on date was Rs 450 crore, which hospitals would get forthwith.”

IMA and AHPI would continue to insist that all outstanding amount was paid on urgent basis, as the hospitals — being pushed to the brink of unsustainability — would be constrained to suspend cashless services, officials said.

Last month, AHPI — that claims to represent some of the country’s top hospitals, including Max, Fortis, Medanta and BLK — had approached the Prime Minister’s Office (PMO) demanding payment of dues with respect to treatment of CGHS and Ex-servicemen Contributory Health Scheme (ECHS) beneficiaries. Dr Girdhar J Gyani, the director general of AHPI told TOI the government owes about Rs 245 crore (Rs 165 crore CGHS and Rs 80 crore ECHS) to the Max group of hospitals, Rs 225 crore (Rs 70 crore CGHS and Rs 155 crore ECHS) to the Fortis group and Rs 73 crore (Rs 42 crore CGHS and Rs 31 crore ECHS) to Medanta Medcity.

Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

Title: Three in net for thefts in PMPML, MSRTC buses
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: The Bhosari police on Wednesday busted a gang of three members, including two women, who were involved in committing thefts in the crowded city and state transport utility’s buses and autorickshaw.

A police team led by senior inspector Shakar Avtade made the arrests and have recovered gold ornaments and cash, collectively valued at Rs3.38 lakh, from the trio.

“The trio — Sunil Sonawane (28), Soni Sakat (22) and Bhagyashri Kasbe (28) — are from Vishrantwadi. We have detected five cases against them — four registered with the Bhosari police and one with the Pimpri police. They stole valuables from commuters travelling in Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) buses, Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) buses and Sonawane’s autorickshaw,” Avtade said.

A 32-year-old woman on January 3 this year had lodged an FIR with the Bhosari police, stating that two unidentified women on December 31, 2019 , stole her gold ornaments worth Rs1 lakh. She said the incident occurred while she was travelling between Bhosari to Vadmukhwadi in an autoruckshaw.

“We checked the CCTV footage on the route and traced the registration number of the autorickshaw,” Avtade said. The police team comprised assistant inspector Siddheshwar Kailase and sub-inspector Mahendra Gadhave laid a trap and took the driver, Sonawane, into custody from Bhosari area.

“During the investigation, Sonawane admitted his involvement in the theft and also revealed the names of his two other aides. Based on his information, we took the two women into custody,” Avtade added.

Title: Pawan Kalyan to hold rally in support of farmers
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Pawan Kalyan

VIJAYAWADA: Jana Sena chief Pawan Kalyan is likely to conduct a rally in support of Amaravati farmers who gave their land to the state government. Kalyan who was in Vijayawada on Thursday evening conducted a row of meetings with party leaders from Guntur and Krishna district. He has decided to stay in Vijayawada for a week and intensify protests in support of Amaravati farmers.

Jana Sena political affairs committee chairman Nandendla Manohar on Thursday said Jana Sena will fight in support of capital farmers. He condemning the arrests of Amaravati JAC leaders, including former chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu on Wednesday. tnn

Title: 7 years on, Calangute sewerage project yet to take off
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

The pumping station site at Gaura Vaddo had been barricaded by the contractor some months ago

CALANGUTE: Nearly seven years after work started on a sewerage pipeline network and a sewerage treatment plant (STP) for Calangute, the project is yet to see the light of day. It was to be completed within three years, in March 2016.

While most of the pipeline network is ready, work has been stalled for the last couple of years because of opposition to two pumping stations, though a solution is expected soon.

According to Calangute panchayat members, the two pumping stations in Calangute are needed to move the sewerage towards the STP, which is located at the northern end of Calangute at Baga. People have opposed the two pumping stations at Gaura Vaddo and Porba Vaddo as they are located close to residential areas and would cause air pollution.

“It is technically not possible to build them elsewhere, so the contractor is trying to find a solution which would address the fears of the locals,” a panchayat member said.

According to waste management minister and Calangute MLA Michael Lobo, the reason why the STP, which has been completed, is not being inaugurated, is because of a “reverse pipeline” which needs to be laid from the STP to the garbage treatment plant (GTP) at Saligao. The reverse pipeline will take the treated water from the STP to the GTP for use there, he said.

However, with the state government facing a financial crisis, the reverse pipeline is still in the pipeline, and a sewerage network in Calangute is still a work in progress.

Title: Leaders opposing CAA without knowing why: Ram Madhav
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Trichy/Madurai/Chennai: Under fire from the opposition parties and allies over the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) and National Register of Citizens (NRC), the Narendra Modi government has gone into firefighting mode deploying ministers Ravi Shankar Prasad and Smriti Irani as well as BJP general secretary Ram Madhav to clear the air over the issues in the state.

Ram Madhav said at a meeting preceding a rally organized by the district wing of the BJP in Trichy that those opposing the CAA do not know anything about it. He said the sea of participants in the rally was proof of thousands in the state supporting the Act as all of them were patriots. “Some leaders in Tamil Nadu are opposing the Act. If we ask them the reason for their opposition, they do not have answers. Those who oppose the Act really do not know anything about the Act,” he said.

The opposition leaders are not bothering about the people living in India but worried about the Muslims living in Pakistan and Afghanistan. Another propaganda about the Act unleashed by the DMK was that the Act has excluded Sri Lankan Tamils from becoming Indian nationals. “I appeal to the Muslim brothers to not to fall prey to the propaganda of the opposition parties. This Act is not against Muslims or Christians,” he said. Party’s national executive committee member L Ganesan, actor Gautami and state general secretary M Muruganantham also participated.

At Sellur in Madurai, Union Minister of Women and Child Development and Textiles Smriti Irani asked DMK, “When you had so many opportunities to show your sympathy towards Sri Lankan Tamil refugees and other minorities when the UPA government came up with policies which against their welfare why did you not react.” She said they had gathered there because all those who were participating in the rally had put the nation first. ‘When the November 2007 special commission for rehabilitation did not entertain citizenship for Sri Lankan refugees under the UPA government why did you remain silent?’’ she asked. ``We recall the sacrifices of the Indians beyond caste and religion, so that they can live in dignity, but the DMK has joined hands with those who shamed those sacrifices,’’ she said.

At Chennai, Union law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said the government will hold talks with allies and take them into confidence. He was responding to a question on Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami’s statement in the assembly that he had told Home Minister Amit Shah that NRC was not acceptable to the AIADMK government. On NRC, he said, “There are provisions that the date for NRC shall be announced, there will be verification, hearing of objections and disposal of objections and appeal against that. Nothing has been decided at all including the date.”

Title: 6 short of majority in Nandurbar ZP, Cong, BJP reach out to Sena
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Nashik: The post-ZP poll scenario in Nandurbar has taken an interesting turn as both Congress and BJP will need support from Shiv Sena , which seems to be bargaining for the president’s post with only seven seats in its kitty.

Congress and BJP have won 23 seats each and are short of six seats to reach the magic figure of 29 to rule the 56-member Nandurbar ZP for the next five years. The NCP won only three seats.

Sources in Shiv Sena on Thursday told TOI from Nandurbar that their party will extend support on the condition that the ZP president will be from Sena.

“The situation in Nandurbar is similar to the one after the state assembly elections last year,” said Sena insiders..
