The sources said that Congress and BJP have reached out to the local unit of Sena seeking support.

“Although Congress, NCP and Sena are a part of the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government in the state, the three parties fought the ZP polls in Nandurbar separately. Our party will extend support on the condition that the ZP president will be from Sena,” party insiders said.

Chandrakant Raghuvanshi, senior Sena functionary from Nandurbar, said his party will play a key role in deciding who comes to power in the local zilla parishad.

“We will abide by the decision of the party high command and chief minister Uddhav Thackeray. Given the numbers, our party is eyeing the post of ZP president,” confirmed Raghuvanshi.

According to Sena insiders, party MP Sanjay Raut and state tribal welfare minister K C Padvi had a preliminary discussion over the phone about Congress and Sena stitching up a post-poll alliance to rule the zilla parishad.

Padvi, the local Congress MLA from Akkalkuwa assembly segment of Nandurbar, could not be contacted. “We are assuming that our high command will direct the local unit to join hands with Congress to keep BJP out of power. The scenario would be clear within the next couple of days,” said a Sena functionary.

The local BJP unit has ruled out the possibility of Sena getting the post of ZP president. “The local Sena unit is bargaining hard and BJP will not succumb. Our party can offer the post of ZP vice-president and chairperson of few committees in to the Sena if they extend support to our party,” said a district BJP functionary.

According to Nandurbar BJP MLA Vijay Gavit, the party is exploring all options to come to power in the zilla parishad. “BJP has done well in the polls and is keen to rule the Nandurbar ZP,” he said, but refused to divulge details about the options available before his party to cobble up a majority.

BOX

Maharashtra cabinet minister Chaggan Bhujbal has been appointed as the Nashik guardian minister. Bhujbal will have a key role in taking decisions about various projects and schemes for the development of the district

Title: Perambalur man loses Rs 30,000 in ATM fraud
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Trichy: A Tamil Nadu Generation and Distribution Corporation (Tangedco) employee lost Rs 30,000 after an unidentified man stole his ATM card and PIN while it was being used in an ATM room in Perambalur town on Wednesday.

Tangedco employee Balakrishnan handed over his ATM card to his son-in-law, Balamurugan of Pudhunaduvalur, to withdraw money. Balamurugan, who is an autorickshaw driver, went to an ATM room in Venkatesapuram locality.

As Balamurugan tried to withdraw money, the card got stuck in the ATM. An unidentified man, who was standing behind Balamurugan, took note of the ATM PIN. Under the pretext of helping Balamurugan, the accused swapped the ATM card with a bogus one. Without noticing it, Balamurugan left the ATM room.

The unidentified man withdrew Rs 30,000 from Balakrishnan’s account. Upon receiving a text message on money deducted from the account, Balamurugan and Balakrishnan realised that they had been cheated. Balakrishnan approached the bank and blocked the ATM card.

The Perambalur police began investigations based on footage from a CCTV camera in the ATM room.

Title: Further hike in tax on tobacco will hit ryots
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

GUNTUR: The government is losing nearly Rs 13,000 crore annually due to boom in illegal cigarette trade, said director of Tobacco Institute of India Syed Mohammad Ahmed at a meeting held in connection with the annual TII awards for growers from AP, Telangana and Karnataka on Thursday. Stating that high taxes on cigarettes is not only helping widen the market for illegal cigarettes in India, Ahmed said, that it is also adversely affecting tobacco growers. He said any further tax increase on cigarettes will affect the offtake of Indian tobaccos and increase the stress on earnings of domestic tobacco farmers .

He urged the Centre to adopt a consultative approach for policy development on tobacco so that livelihoods of farmers are protected.

Title: Goa Bazaar at Merces hits hurdle due to pending approvals
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

PANAJI: Pending final approvals, the construction of the ‘ Goa Bazaar ’ at Merces seems to have hit a roadblock.

“We have submitted the proposal to the town and country planning (TCP) department for approval. The expenditure finance committee (EFC) committee too is yet to approve of the project. There are some technical reports sought by the government pertaining to land feasibility. As the project has been designed by the Goa State Infrastructure Development Corporation Limited (GSIDC), we’ve asked it to submit the report,” said Sanjit Rodrigues, project director of the North Goa District Rural Development Agency (DRDA).

Slated to cost approximately Rs 53 crore, the project will be undertaken phase-wise. “Central funding amounting to Rs 12 crore is already with us and we’re ready to start the work. However, we cannot tender the works until the approvals come through,” Rodrigues said.

Goa Bazaar, being planned on the lines of Dilli Haat in the national capital, will accommodate 200 stalls and two halls. A fountain built outside will feature different variants of lotuses. The unique project will probably be the first government building to access sweet water from the natural spring at Merces.

Sources from DRDA said that there is water erupting within the premises of the project, and this will serve as the water source for the fountain. “We will be using the spring water for both, construction work and as a water supply source. It will save money as well by eliminating the need for water tankers,” a DRDA official said.

Title: Nagpur: Metro takes away another green patch, this time from Neeri
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

Nagpur: City’s another green tract of land is set to be knocked out as Mahametro has acquired around one acre of National Environmental Engineering Research Institute’s prime green area in Ajni.

The land is near Metro’s Ajni Square station. While MahaMetro officials didn’t specify the purpose of acquiring land, TOI learnt that it is likely to be used for parking.

Neeri director Rakesh Kumar informed that the decision to hand over the area was made around five years back. “The procedure happened following directives of the government which state that vacant land should be expeditiously given for developmental projects,” said Kumar.

With the completion of formalities, the area is now in possession of MahaMetro which is now carrying out fencing work. “We have taken possession of the area but are yet to decide its usage,” said a Metro spokesperson.

As the news came out, it received a backlash from several environment activists who opposed destruction of the green cover. MahaMetro stated that it has no immediate plans to cut down trees in the area. Garden superintendent of Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) Amol Chorpagar confirmed that the agency has not sought permission to fell trees yet.

However, environment activists are certain that significant green cover would be lost. “The fact that Metro has acquired land implies that it is planning to carry out construction activity. And, for this, trees will be chopped,” they said.

Stating that the land is along side the road and not too deep inside the forested area, Neeri officials said, “Many trees in that given area are of subabul specie.”

Activists however pointed out that the green patch is home to various species of birds, including owls and other animals too. “A cluster of subabul trees is also an important habitat. Over the years, experts have recorded various species of birds in that area. Before handing over the land, an environment impact study should have been done,” said Jaydeep Das, honorary wildlife warden of Nagpur.

Many green lovers expressed objection to the move on social media platforms, blaming civic authorities for not ensuring sustainable development . “Why is MahaMetro only encroaching on green patches of the city? Why can’t it find other alternatives? Damaging age-old trees and biodiversity habitat and then justifying it with reasons like parking or a road is not acceptable,” they stated.

Since over a year, a large group of citizens have been protesting a proposed road which threatens to kill age-old trees and a biodiversity habitat in Bharat Nagar. The road was proposed by MahaMetro and NMC.

Title: Engg student found hanging in hostel
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Trichy: A 20-year-old student of the University College of Engineering Bharathidasan Institute of Technology Campus Anna University was found hanging from the ceiling of a private hostel outside the college campus on Thursday.

Police identified the dead as J Lokeswari from Dharmapuri district. According to Navalpattu police, the incident was informed by the hostel manager.

Police sources said that the girl was struggling to concentrate on her studies as her father was unable to afford her education and other expenses.

Police also recovered a suicide note from the spot and an investigation is on based on the letter. tnn

Title: Voltage fluctuation damages 100 household appliances
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Nashik: A sudden power fluctuation damaged at least 100 household electric appliances in Cidco’s Uttam Nagar area on Wednesday morning. Appliances such as televisions, set-top boxes, audio systems, mixer grinders, refrigerators, washing machines, computers and even photocopiers were damaged as a sudden high voltage current flowed across supply lines to residential and commercial establishments in the area around 8.30am. An MSEDCL official said senior officials of the state power utility will take a decision on compensating citizens whose appliances were damaged.

“We were watching television when it suddenly switched off. At first, I thought it was due to a power failure. But then there was a foul smell of a damaged LED bulb. Many neighbours also started complaining, indicating that several appliances in the area were damaged,” said Sanjay Patil, a resident of Uttam Nagar, adding that his LED television had cost around Rs 49,000.

Citizens alleged that they waited for about an hour before complaining to the state power utility but since officials did not turn up, angry residents got together and rallied to the MSEDCL office near Sambhaji Stadium. Uttam Nagar corporator Ratnamala Rane alleged that this was the third such incident in the last one-and-a-half-years and has affected many people. “Previously, we only sought the MSEDCL officers’ response but this time since so many people were affected we marched to the office. Most people came voluntarily,” said Rane.

About one-and-a-half years ago in Janeshwar Chowk, 57 televisions were damaged due to a similar case of fluctuation in power. During Dasara, 23 televisions and other electrical appliances were damaged due to a similar incident. “The MSEDCL will have to pay for the damaged goods this time. They cannot take us for granted,” said Snehalata Vaidya, another resident of Uttam Nagar.

The MSEDCL, meanwhile, said the sudden power surge was due to the insulation over the wires wearing out and two supply cables getting connected. “A technical failure at one of the distribution points at Uttam Nagar resulted in the voltage fluctuation that led to damaging of electrical installations in the area. A panchanama is being carried out to ascertain the damage,” a senior MSEDCL official said.

The MSEDCL has appealed to people to put in place electric safeguards as mandated by the company. “Protection kits have been made mandatory. Besides, many people either modify the parameters or even bypass safeguards,” said another official, adding that people should follow rules. When asked about compensation, the official said “There is no statutory provision for compensation, but senior officials will decide.”

Title: House site among sops in consideration for secretariat staff shifting to Port City
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Amaravati: The state government is planning to grant house sites to all secretariat employees in the proposed executive capital city of Visakhapatnam. Besides, a special house building loan of Rs 25 lakh and an additional 10 per cent displacement allowance is also under consideration. The initiatives are meant to mollify the anxiety that has gripped secretariat staffers.

The high-power committee, formed to study the expert panels’ recommendations on the capital issue, is believed to have also discussed the grievances of the employees in moving the capital to Visakhapatnam. The committee, which met three days ago, is reported to have readied a list of sops to be granted to the employees if the capital is shifted and is waiting for a clearance from chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy before making the list public.

Sources said the high-power committee has suggested grant of house sites to all employees before they move to Visakhapatnam, keeping in view the non-fulfilment of promises made to the secretariat staff by the erstwhile TDP regime. When the capital was slated to come up in Amaravati, the then Chandrababu Naidu government had promised house sites for all secretariat employees. Though many All India Service (AIS) officers got their plots registered, other officials attached to the secretariat could not get them till the general elections, the outcome of which has now changed the whole scenario.

The committee, therefore, wants house sites to be given to all employees before they move to Visakhapatnam. The plots, however, would be offered at nominal rates. The stamp duty for registration of house sites would be exempted. The spouse of the employee would also be transferred to Visakhapatnam urban area without reference to the vacancy position in that particular cadre. Besides a house rent allowance of 30 per cent, the secretariat staff would also be given an additional 10% city compensatory allowance as displacement allowance.

It has also been decided to grant a shifting allowance of Rs 1 lakh to gazetted officers, Rs 75,000 to non-gazetted officers and Rs 50,000 to class-IV employees. Further, the government is also considering subsidised housing facility for those who shift their families to Visakhapatnam. A 2-bhk flat would be offered at Rs 4,000 per month while the staff would need to pay Rs 6,000 for a 3-bhk apartment. Free accommodation would be provided to bachelors, as in the case of Amaravati.

The present 5-day week system will continue for another three years. Free bus passes will be provided in Visakhapatnam city, while employees would get a 50% concession twice a month to travel from Visakhapatnam to Hyderabad or Vijayawada to meet their family members. The committee has also decided to give top priority to medical facilities for employees by setting up a dispensary and station an ambulance at the new secretariat.

Title: Education director has vitiated atmosphere, says Congress
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

PANAJI: Goa Pradesh Congress Committee (GPCC) has demanded that the state government remove director of education Vandana Rao, an IAS officer, from the post, stating that she has created ‘an atmosphere of discontent among stakeholders’.

If the government fails to take action, GPCC, along with parents, teachers and schools, would hold an agitation for Rao’s removal, Congress spokesperson Swati Kerkar said. Kerkar said that since the day Rao has taken over as director, she has only issued irrelevant and unwarranted circulars one after another.

“She has been ordering schools to comply to her fanciful activities at gun point, threatening the managements, heads, and teachers of the serving educational institutions of this state. The director has failed to understand that every educational institute has it own yearly programme planned well in advance at the beginning of academic year. The director directs to conduct several tireless and time-bound activities to school and staff. However, these activities clash with the school activities planned earlier,” Kerkar said.

She said Rao should take the view of various organisations of schools, school heads, teachers and other stakeholders in the state and plan the academic activities accordingly.

Recently, Rao had issued show cause notices to schools which failed to appear for a meeting called by her.

In one of the circulars issued by the director, the pay scales and status of teachers working on temporary basis have been illegally changed violating the principles of ‘equal working equal pay’, Kerkar alleged.

Title: 25,000 T workers on tenterhooks as Iran fires missiles at US bases in Erbil
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Hyderabad: With Iran targeting US forces in Iraq by firing missiles, 25,000 Telangana workers in Erbil , Iraq, are on tenterhooks. In view of the situation escalating further, workers are willing to be evacuated.

The Telangana Gulf Employees’ Welfare Association stepped in and issued an appeal to Telangana workers to gather at the Consulate General of India in Erbil at 6pm on Thursday to bring pressure on the authorities to facilitate their travel back home. The Indian embassy also advised Indian nationals to avoid non-essential travel to Iraq until further notification.

“There is utter chaos and uncertainty here. There are a lot of American troops, who are being targeted by Iran. The situation is going to get dangerous in the coming days,” said Ramachander Rayalawar, vice-president of the association. Ramachander, who works in Erbil. He said a large number of Telangana workers are expected to gather at CGI on Thursday.

“The place where I stay is just two minutes away from the US consulate. There is tension in the air and we are definitely facing a dangerous situation,” Ramachander told TOI over telephone from Erbil. A majority of workforce from Telangana is employed at construction sites in Erbil and nearby towns.

In a travel advisory issued on Wednesday, embassy in Baghdad asked Indian nationals residing in Iraq to be alert and avoid travel within the country. “Our embassy in Baghdad and consulate in Erbil will continue to function normally to provide service to Indians in Iraq,” the embassy said.

Indian workers have always considered Baghdad a dangerous city to live and hence chosen Erbil which is considered safer. “The missile attack took place in the night and there is a lot of movement of government and military convoys here. We heard that some helicopters were taken down in the missile attack. We also heard about casualties though we are not sure about that,” Ramachander said.

According to Iraqi military, 22 missiles were launched by Iran on Ain al-Asad air base and another base in Erbil between 1.45am and 2.15am (local time).

Title: Ramky Enviro plans Rs 3700cr investment in three years
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Hyderabad: Nearly a year after global investment firm KKR picked up 60% stake in environmental solutions and services provider Ramky Enviro Engineers Ltd (REEL) for around Rs 3,600 crore, the Hyderabad-based company has lined up investments worth nearly Rs 3700 crore in a dozen projects in India and abroad over the next three years.

This is part of the company’s ambitions to emerge as one of the largest integrated environment solutions players in emerging economies, REEL managing director and CEO Goutham Reddy told TOI.

“We are eyeing a bigger play in Africa, South East Asia and Middle East. We already have projects worth nearly Rs 950 crore that are under construction in India and the Middle East and expected to be commissioned within the next six months. We also have projects worth around Rs 2700 crore under various stages of planning over the next two to three years,” Reddy said.

Reddy pointed out that Hyderabad will account for a chunk of its investment plan at Rs 1,500 crore, including the Rs 400 crore, 20MW waste-to-energy (W2E) plant coming up at Jawaharnagar that is to be commissioned by March this year.

“We are also investing Rs 1,100 crore over the next 2-3 years in setting up a 28MW W2E plant in the second phase at Jawaharnagar. Two 15MW W2E plants in other parts of Hyderabad are also planned,” Reddy explained.

Ramky is also looking at a 24MW W2E project at an investment of Rs 400 crore in Delhi, where it already has an existing 24MW plant, in addition to four 6MW plants in Reva, Raipur, Dehradun and Dhanbad at a total investment of Rs 500 crore, he said.

In the overseas markets, the company has a Rs 160-crore, 1200 tonnes per day metal recycling facility (MRF) coming up in Dubai, a Rs 100 crore integrated hazardous biomedical and industrial waste treatment plant being set up in Abu Dhabi along with BR Shetty group by March 2020 as well as a Rs 80 crore marine pollution treatment plant coming up at Oman.

Ramky Enviro is also planning a Rs 160-crore, 1200tpd capacity MRF at Abu Dhabi and a Rs 100-crore integrated biomedical and industrial waste treatment plant in Dubai. It also has in the pipeline a Rs 220 crore integrated waste management and recycling facility in Saudi Arabia as well as a Rs 250 crore integrated waste and environment management park in Vietnam.

Reddy said the company expects to close FY20 with revenues of Rs 2,700 crore, up from the Rs 2,250 crore it clocked in FY19.

Title: Court orders AIADMK councillor to abstain from chairman poll
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

TRICHY: The principal district court has ordered an AIADMK candidate, who was declared elected as councillor of district panchayat ward 15 in Thanjavur district, to abstain from the indirect election of the council chairman on January 11.

According to sources, out of 28 district panchayat ward councillors, DMK bagged 22 and AIADMK the remaining six at the civic polls held recently. Ponnusamy (DMK) and B Vinubalan (AIADMK) contested in ward 15. Though there were 62,313 eligible voters, a total of 39,158 votes were polled in the election. However, 2,680 votes were declared invalid by the election officials at the counting on January 2.

Vinubalan was announced as winner with 12,753 votes polled for him while Ponnusamy got 12,554 votes. Alleging that election officer Prabhakar favoured the AIADMK candidate, a petition was filed by the DMK candidate before the principal district court in Thanjavur praying for a recounting. During the hearing on Thursday, the principal district judge ordered AIADMK candidate Vinubalan not to participate in the indirect election to be held on January 11 to elect the chairman of the district panchayat council. The judge also postponed the hearing to January 20, sources said.

Title: Nagpur: Tiger Sahebrao to be fitted with artificial limb on January 18
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

NAGPUR: Sahebrao, the 9-year-old tiger at Gorewada Rescue Centre in the city, is all set get an artificial limb on January 18.

This will be the first case of prosthesis for a tiger in the world. Earlier, it has been done for dogs and elephants.

Prosthesis is an artificial device that replaces a missing body part, which may be lost through trauma, disease or congenital conditions. They are intended to restore normal functions of the missing body part.

According to Forest Development Corporation of Maharashtra (FDCM) sources, which runs the rescue centre, the artificial limb will be fitted in the presence of noted orthopaedic surgeon Dr Sushrut Babhulkar, Dr Peter Giannoudis, professor of orthopaedics with University of Leeds, United Kingdom, FDCM officials and wildlife veterinarians from Maharashtra Animal and Fishery Sciences University’s Wildlife Research & Training Centre (WRTC).

“The artificial limb has been prepared by a team of local doctors who have expertise in fracture fixation of humans and animals. Sahebrao’s limb has been prepared under the guidance of Dr Babhulkar with technical know-how from Germany’s AO Foundation, well-known in fracture fixation of humans and animals too,” said the sources.

Dr Babhulkar is the only Indian Council member of AO Foundation and hence used his connections to ensure that Sahebrao can walk once again.

TOI on February 3, 2018, was the first to report about the decision to fit an artificial limb to Sahebrao with the help of Dr Babhulkar, who had adopted the male tiger then.

Experts involved in the process told TOI they will examine the limb before going ahead. The first step to fit an artificial limb started in August 2018 by taking X-rays and blood samples. Based on the radiology reports, a team of WRTC experts operated Sahebrao on October 9 for neuroma and took measurement for the prosthesis. “Post-surgery, Sahebrao is under observation of WRTC team. The tiger’s surgery wounds have healed and pain has reduced drastically. The vets planned to fit the artificial limb after six weeks. It is nearly three months now and stage is set for the world’s first such procedure,” said sources.

Till the prosthesis is done, experts are playing cards close to their chest as this will be the first such process on a tiger. “The artificial limb is made of polysynthetic material and is very strong. It will be interesting to see how Sahebrao reacts to the artificial limb,” said sources.

Two-year-old Sahebrao and his sibling were caught in a steel trap laid by organized gang of Baheliya poachers in Gondmohadi outside Tadoba-Andhari Tiger Reserve (TATR) on April 26, 2012. While the sibling died, Sahebrao was rescued but his injured front leg had to be amputated because of gangrene. The tiger was later shifted to city’s Maharajbagh zoo on December 12, 2012 and on June 1, 2016 to Gorewada.

Title: Don’t make jallikattu profit oriented: Hiphop Tamizha
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Trichy: Jallikattu is a native sport and should be conducted in a traditional manner as the very purpose of the traditional sport will be lost if it is commercialised, Tamil film composer Hiphop Tamizha Aadhi has said. Aadhi, who was the chief guest, was speaking to reporters after attending Pongal celebrations at St Joseph's College on Thursday. Referring to jallikattu league being planned in the state, he said detaching the sport from its traditional identity might affect the sport.

Giving an example of the sport turning commercial, he said Coimbatore district has no jallikattu connection but is being conducted there now. “However, Rekla race is native to Pollachi and adjoining areas of Coimbatore. Jallikattu should be conducted in a traditional way as it was conducted in the past. Otherwise, the purpose of the sport might be lost,” he said.

He supported restrictions on the conduct of jallikattu as they would ensure safety of both bulls and bull tamers.

He condemned the attack on students of Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU). He said students should be given freedom to express their views. “It is unfortunate that an organization was allowed to carry an attack on JNU students and proudly claims responsibility for it,” he said.

Title: One killed, three injured in separate accidents
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Nashik: One person was killed when his motorcycle dashed against a divider, while three others were injured in three different accidents in Nashik city.

The Nashik Road police have booked the victim for negligent driving, hitting the divider and causing his own death.

According to the police, Yogesh Bharmal, 20, resident of Akole taluka of Ahmednagar district, was riding his bike on Tuesday at 11pm on Nashik – Pune highway when the accident occurred.

The police said Bharmal was riding his bike negligently and hit the concrete divider on the road near Darna Bridge in Chehadi village area. The motorcycle was badly damaged and the motorist suffered serious injuries. He was rushed to the local hospital where the doctors said died on his way.

In another incident, two persons were injured in a head-on collision of their motorcycles on Tuesday afternoon. The two were riding different bikes and in opposite direction. The two vehicles collided on the service road near Mumbai Naka in front of the Hotel Inayat Café.

The Ambad police station have registered a case against a car driver for driving negligently and causing injury to a motorcycle rider.

The police said Suresh Sangamnere, resident of Kherwadi, Niphad was riding his motorcycle on January 3 at 12.30 noon when the accident occurred.

According to Sangamnere, the car driver was heading from Garware Chowk towards Vilholi on Mumbai-Agra national highway and suddenly turned left at Gaulane fata without giving any prior indication.

Since the car turned left all of a sudden, the motorcyclist coming from behind banged into the car. The impact left the motorcyclist injured and his vehicle damaged. The police have registered the case.

Title: Central prison starts sale of soaps made by inmates
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Trichy: Trichy Central prison has commenced the sale of bathing soaps manufactured by the inmates. The soaps come in a range of fragrances and varieties. The prison DIG inaugurated the sale of the soaps to the public here on Thursday. Prison superintendent K Shankar, and prison bazaar superintendent Thirumurugan were also present during the event.

Offers have also been announced for customers, who purchase the soaps in bulk, prison authorities said. The initiative is in line with the drive carried out by prison authorities to sell various products manufactured by the inmates to the public. The initiative is expected to help rehabilitate the prisoners, especially the ones serving lengthy terms.

Th hand-made bathing soaps come in four fragrances-lavender, rose, jasmine, lemon. The soaps also come in three varieties whereby the normal variety costs Rs 16 each while the oil-free variety is priced at Rs 40 and the glycerine bathing soaps cost Rs 56. There is also an offer to buy two glycerine soaps for Rs 100, the prison officials said. The price of detergent soaps has been fixed as Rs 10.

The soaps are available in 100 and 150 gram varieties. The prison inmates have already been running a restaurant, a cake and a sweet shop under one roof named as Prison Bazaar. They have also been selling cloth bags, which are a substitute for plastic bags, air purifier bags, which produce vapours that freshen the air in addition to a tailoring unit functioning inside the prison. Prison bazaar is located in front of the prison on Trichy-Pudukottai main road in the city.

Title: Rape cases rose by 16 per cent in Gujarat, 2.4 per cent in India in 2018
Content:
Representative image

AHMEDABAD: Gujarat in 2018 recorded a 16% rise in rape cases — reaching 553, from 477 in 2017. Sexual offences against children registered under the The Protection of Children From Sexual Offences (Pocso) Act rose from 1,671 in 2017 to 2,127 in 2018 — a 28% jump.The figures were mentioned in the report ‘Crime in India 2018’ released by the National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) on Thursday. Two Gujarat cities — Ahmedabad and Surat — got featured in the report which recorded 6.25% (from 64 to 68) and 43% (from 32 to 46) rise in rape cases, respectively.The report highlighted that in 2018, Gujarat police disposed of a total of 8,476 cases of which 127 were quashed and 124 were stayed at the investigation stage. Forty-seven cases were found to be false, 249 as mistake of fact or a case of civil dispute and 598 were cases with insufficient evidence. In 92.2% cases, police filed chargesheet, and 8.6% cases remained pending by the end of the year. At the court level, 3.8% of the accused were convicted, found the report.

Title: Goa legislators’ forum opposes Mhadei water diversion
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Goa Legislators’ Forum on Thursday passed a resolution calling on the Centre to prevent Karnataka from divert... Read More

PORVORIM: The Goa Legislators’ Forum on Thursday passed a resolution calling on the Centre to prevent Karnataka from diverting water from the Mhadei river basin through the Kalasa Bandura project.

The resolution was passed in the presence of chief minister Pramod Sawant where former St Cruz MLA Victor Gonsalves also said that he does not trust the assurances given by the Centre.

“Most of us have doubts over the Centre’s promises on Mhadei. The CM should show this resolution to the Centre. We resolve here that all members of the Goa Legislators’ Forum want Mhadei river to be saved and that no water should be diverted from the Mhadei basin to Karnataka,” Gonsalves said.

The resolution was unanimously approved and passed by the Goa Legislators’ Forum at an event to mark Legislators’ Day.

Sawant lauded the contribution made by MLAs and former legislators. Sawant, who was speaker of the assembly just a year ago, said the forum was one of the most active in the country.

“Goa could consider hosting a legislators’ forum conference,” Sawant suggested, adding that the government will support all efforts to host such a conference.

Deputy speaker Isidore Fernandes, however, rued the lack the of interest shown by present legislators in attending the function which was held at the assembly complex. “I sent a message to ruling MLAs, but nobody came. I request the speaker to make it compulsory to have four ministers in attendance at the next Legislators’ Day function,” he said.

Title: Telangana: No impact study, Genco gets nod on power plant work
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

HYDERABAD: In what could raise eyebrows of environmentalists and green activists, the state government has exempted TSGenco from conducting a social impact assessment (SIA) study for acquiring 234 acres for laying a railway line, water pipeline, intake structure and other facilities for the Rs 20,000-crore 4,000 MW thermal power plant at Veerlapalem village in Nalgonda ’s Damaracherla mandal.

A GO (No. 20 dated December 2, 2019) was issued in this regard with a rider that this was being done in public interest as per the powers vested with the government under the provisions of Land Acquisition Act, 2013. Special chief secretary, energy, Ajay Mishra told TOI that government could use such powers and added that all environmental norms were being followed.

“Why would we take a risk in execution of a huge project. All norms pertaining to National Green Tribunal and central environment committee have been followed while giving SIA exemption. The project is being taken with hypersensitive technology in compliance with norms,” Mishra said.

Meanwhile, environmentalists have kicked up a furore and demanded that SIA be conducted. “Was Genco not aware that it would be requiring 234 acres for laying the railway line and water pipeline when it launched works three years ago? Under the pretext of urgency to complete the project, the government has given exemption to Genco, which is not acceptable,” said environmentalist and IICT former scientist K Babu Rao.

Babu Rao said chapter II of the Right to Fair Compensation and Transparency in Land Acquisition, Rehabilitation and Resettlement Act, 2013, clearly states that SIA needs to be conducted whenever a government intends to acquire land for public purpose.

Human Rights Forum Nalgonda unit secretary G Mohan said the government cannot bypass SIA. “It should conduct SIA at all costs,” he said. The project has seen protests from locals affected by the project.

Title: Vanpic scam: Trial court cognisance order on Dharmana holds good, says CBI
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

File Photo

HYDERABAD: The CBI said trial court’s cognisance order in respect of role played by former AP revenue minister Dharmana Prasada Rao holds good under provisions of Prevention of Corruption (PC) Act in Vanpic chargesheet of quid pro quo case filed against AP CM Jagan and others.

The investigating agency conveyed this to the trial court in compliance with a direction given by principal special judge BV Madhusudan Rao of Hyderabad CBI courts, who sought to know the status of the case filed by CBI against the former minister in the Supreme Court. Dharmana was an accused in Vanpic chargesheet.

Vadarevu and Nizampatnam Port and Industrial Corridor (Vanpic) was proposed to be set up between Guntur and Prakasam districts in 2008 in an extent of 28,000 acres. Dharmana’s role as then revenue minister came under CBI scanner. In its chargesheet, CBI said businessman Nimmagadda Prasad, Dharmana and others entered into a criminal conspiracy to cheat the state.

Section 19 of PC Act makes it mandatory for CBI to obtain sanction from the state government to prosecute a public servant like a cabinet minister in a trial court. The state had refused to accord sanction in 2012. The trial court took cognisance of the role of the former minister in respect of IPC sections like cheating, criminal conspiracy, etc., but deferred the cognisance in respect of PC Act. Later, when he ceased to be a minister, CBI approached the trial court again and asked it to take cognisance as he was not a public servant. The trial court then took cognisance of Dharmana’s role under the PC Act.

Dharmana moved the HC challenging trial court’s decision. Stating that trial court erred in taking cognisance during second round, he contended that trial court has no review power. HC agreed with it. But, SC later found fault with HC order and upheld trial court’s decision. It said trial court had merely deferred its decision on cognisance and cannot be called as first decision.

“There is no second decision. Trial court took cognisance when Dharmana ceased to be a minister and it should be seen as sole decision,” SC said while remanding the matter to HC asking it to examine whether there is any need to obtain prior permission under the PC Act. Though the HC, in tune with the order of SC, took up the matter, Dharmana withdrew his plea from the HC later. “This means that trial court order taking cognisance stands good,” CBI counsel K Surender said. The case will come up for hearing on January 10.

Title: Official in soup for letting women councillors’ husbands to read oath
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

The Krishnagiri district administration has sought explanation from the returning officer who presided over the swearing in ceremony of district panchayat councillors when some of the women elected representatives got their husbands to read the oath instead of them.

Krishnagiri collector S Prabhakar told TOI that the returning officer was asked to submit his reply within 15 days. On Monday, when the district panchayat councillors took charge in the district, husbands of women councillors read the oath in a jarring indication of the influence they might wield over the women representatives.

Thirteen of the 23 district panchayat councillors in Krishnagiri were women. Sources said that at least four men who accompanied their wives to the swearing in ceremony read the oath instead of their wives including that of M Anitha, a DMK councillor representing fourth ward.

Oath taking is an essential part of the swearing in ceremony of panchayat representatives. During the hearing of a case in 2018, the Supreme Court had warned of serious consequences if the elected representatives did not take oath. The court had then lauded Tamil Nadu for making oath taking mandatory for local body representatives. “For some reason, it was the women councillors who asked their husbands to read the oath. But the final words agreeing to swear by the oath were uttered by them,’’ said Krishnagiri district rural development agency project officer C Periyasamy, who was the returning officer who presided over the swearing in ceremony.

Prabhakar, however, said that there are clear rules even in case a councillor was illiterate or unable to read. “In such cases, the officials should read out the oath and the councillors are supposed to repeat. We will see the explanation and decide the next course of action,’’ he said. He assured that the husbands or any other male relatives will not be allowed to interfere in the functioning of woman councillors.

Title: National crime data positions Nagpur as ‘safe’ city
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Image used for representational purpose

NAGPUR: In a silver lining for the city’s guardians, the just-released national crime data of 2018 illustrates that Nagpur can no longer be associated with the moniker of ‘crime capital’, which was once used by the opponents of the-then chief minister Devendra Fadnavis to corner him on the assembly floor.

During a media briefing earlier this week, city police chief BK Upadhyay had claimed that there was a 10% dip in the crime rate in 2019, when compared to the previous year. The assertion has been validated with the release of the crime statistics of 2018 by the National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB), where Nagpur’s position is quite lower down the order in most categories of serious crimes in the nation.

In a majority of the categories, Nagpur is third in the state after Mumbai and Pune, barring the category of ‘Crime rate of cognisable offences’, registered under Indian Penal Code (IPC) and Special Local Laws (SLL), where it has overtaken the bigger two metros in comparison of 19 such places nationwide. While Nagpur has a crime rate of 688.6 per one lakh, Mumbai stands at 309.9/lakh, while Pune’s is the lowest (277.9/lakh) in Maharashtra. Nagpur is placed at number 12 in India in the same crime rate category.

Upadhyay said that the crimes are under control, and that the numbers have both, visibly and statistically come down. “It is a safe city. Our force is constantly trying to remain on its toes and improve the scenario further,” he said.

The city stands at number 12 in the country for rape, with 69 offences registered in 2018, and third in the state after Mumbai (319) and Pune (103) — making it statistically safer for women. In the category of ‘Assault on women with intent to outrage her modesty’ under Section 354 of IPC, the city holds the 10th position in the nation with 274 offences. It is third in the state after Mumbai (2,038), which is second in the nation, followed by Pune (406).

In the category of ‘Total offences affecting human body’, Nagpur is 14th in the nation with 2,619 offences, and third in the state with Mumbai (11,585) at number two in the country and Pune (2,903) standing at the 12th position.

In the category of murder, the city is 12th in the nation and third in the state with 72 such offences, which is one less than that in Pune. Mumbai is fourth in the nation and first in the state with 164 murders. In the ‘Attempt to murder’ category, the city is third in the state and 11th in the nation with 77 offences, after Pune (127) and Mumbai (280).

In economic offences, Mumbai is first in the nation with 4803 crimes, while Nagpur is 15th, with 534 offences. Pune is 12th in the country with 777 offences.

The city is also relatively safer for senior citizens, with 207 offences — which is sixth in the nation and second in the state after Mumbai (1,043), which tops the chart. Pune, with 169 offences, is safest in the state for the elderly population as per the national crime data.

In crimes against children, Nagpur is third in the state and sixth in the country with 538 offences. Mumbai has the highest crime against children in the state and second in the nation, with 2,538 offences.

Title: Nagpur: Will Nitin Raut gel well to steer city’s development?
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Nitin Gadkari

NAGPUR: After Nitin Raut ’s appointment as guardian minister, the city has two Nitins at the helm of affairs, both belonging to opposing parties and having different ideologies. While one is at the centre, the other is at state, and coordination between them is must for city’s development , feel the politicians and observers.

“I am never against any development and we will work together. In fact, I had brought many developmental projects for the city. However, I would not support those projects that are against public interests. City’s development and generation of employment is a priority,” says Raut.

Earlier, it was Gadkari’s partymate Chandrashekhar Bawankule who was the guardian minister. Inevitably, there was synergy between them. With a change in guard in the state, it could become difficult for the powerful Union minister to implement his ambitious plans like Intra Model Station (IMS) at Ajni on Central jail’s land, modernization of city’s Dr Ambedkar airport, expanding metro rail to suburbs like Katol, Saoner and Kamptee, and rejuvenation of Nag river among others.

“We’ve to wait and watch on how the two Nitins gel. Though it’s too early to comment on their chemistry, one thing is sure that the development would definitely take a back seat, at least for some time. We can only hope that both should work in a tandem to ensure city’s development, for which the people have voted them to power,” political analysts Anjali Gaidhane says.

Earlier, the presence of former chief minister Devendra Fadnavis from the city and finance minister Sudhir Mungantiwar from Chandrapur, helped in getting clearance and funding for all the major projects like Metro rail expansion, airport modernization, construction of highways, flyovers, railway under and over bridges and others, in last five years. In the current scenario, it seems to be bit difficult.

Politicians like ex-city MP Vilas Muttemwar feel if the same party government is working at centre, state and also in municipal corporation, it helps in expediting and implementation of the projects. “I was lucky as the Congress government held power at all three places from 2002 to 2007 and we brought many projects. All the projects Gadkari was taking credit for like Mihan and metro rail, were introduced by our government,” he says, adding that how both Nitins coordinate with each other would be vital for development.

It’s not only that centre needs state’s help for projects, many a times, it’s vice versa. Being a senior minister in Modi cabinet, he can easily push the state’s proposals.

“I think both Nitins are big leaders and worked hard for city’s development in their respective capacities. Both should take lessons from assembly polls, where BJP lost many seats in district, due to their failure to carry out development works. Now, I think there would be a competition between two for launching new projects,” says Congress MLA Vikas Thakre who got chosen to the state legislature for the first time.

Former president of NGO Janmanch, Sharad Patil, believes that both Nitins would give priority to their respective parties, their own personalities and then to the development. “Obviously, there would be a break to the city’s development. It would need some time to get back its momentum provided both leaders work closely with each other by keeping aside their party affiliations,” he says.

Title: Goa government mulls relocating families living in Mhadei eco zone
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Goa CM Pramod Sawant

PORVORIM/KERI: The death of four tigers within the Mhadei wildlife sanctuary has prompted the state government to look afresh at the proposal to relocate families situated within the proposed tiger corridor.

Chief minister Pramod Sawant has asked the principal conservator of forests and other authorities to prepare to evacuate two families and rehabilitate them outside the wildlife sanctuary.

“I am not talking about everyone. It is only those in the eco-sensitive zone in the Mhadei sanctuary.I think there are just two families who live in what could be declared as the tiger corridor,” said Sawant.

“The government’s preparations to shift them along with their livestock and relocate them somewhere else is on. There are some from the tribal community and other communities, and we need to insist that they relocate to another locality,” said the chief minister.

He said that the government would provide land and other resources so that the families can be rehabilitated along with their livestock.

The chief minister said the death of the tigers had mentally disturbed him. He said that in order to ensure that such situations did not occur, the principal conservator of forests had been empowered to compensate or assist farmers who had lost livestock to predators.“It is our misfortune that these four tigers died and it is not just the state government but the Central government has also taken note of this,” said Sawant.

Under the Forest Dwelling Act 2006, Goa government had constituted committees and asked villagers in forests to produce evidences of their settlement. But so far the cases of their rights have not been settled. Harishchandra Gaonkar from Caranzol said, “We are living on these lands in the sanctuary since ages, but so far the issue of our right over these areas has not been recognised. In this situation, initiating the relocation of the villagers will not be fruitful.”

Villagers from Cadval and Vainguinim have expressed willingness to move out of the sanctuary area if proper rehabilitation packages are extended to them. They, however, said they have no faith in forest department officials as for the last two decades no concrete steps have been taken to solve their genuine problems.

However, environmentalists and wildlifers have welcomed the government move.

Title: SJC students celebrate Pongal
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Trichy: Student from all the 28 departments of St Joseph’s College (SJC) took part in the Pongal celebration organised by the college on Thursday.

All the students came in traditional attire and exchanged Pongal apart from taking part in art forms native to Tamils. The purpose of the programme was to uphold and give value to traditional culture.

The chief guests were brought in a procession of bullock carts and honoured with parivattam - a traditional head gear.

Stalls were erected to display traditional age-old things that were used for daily purposes. Architecture of huts and traditional utensils used for cooking and grinding were also on display.

Traditional food stalls were also put up in the college displaying dishes made of millet apart from raw and rich snack varieties that have remained our staple food in the past. “In an era of fast food, the purpose of the traditional food stall was to remind students that we have rich traditional nutritious food and our food was medicine,” said Vimal Jerald, coordinator of the festival.

The cultural process was the highlight of the festival. Three eminent personalities were awarded Tamil Traditional Award for their contribution towards preserving traditional practises. Thirupathi Thangasamy was awarded for keeping alive traditional farming techniques while Ravi Kumar, Devarattam artist – a traditional dance form prevalent in Karur and adjoining districts, and Ramu, a pot maker, were awarded for preserving their art form. tnn

Title: Lot at stake in West Asia, seek peace, India tells US, Japan
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Defence minister Rajnath Singh (ANI photo)

NEW DELHI: Defence minister Rajnath Singh on Thursday told his US and Japanese counterparts, Mark Esper and Taro Kono, that India was firmly in favour of de-escalation in the ongoing tensions between the US and Iran in the middle east.

Singh, in separate telephonic conversations with Esper and Kono, shared with them India's "concerns, stakes and interest" in the West Asian region, while also affirming the Indian government's resolve to further expand defence cooperation with the US and Japan.

Esper assured Singh that the US too was interested in ensuring that the security situation in West Asia did not deteriorate any further, while briefing him on the developments in the region. India has watched with growing concern the escalating tensions in the region after the killing of top Iranian military commander Qassim Suleimani and the retaliatory missile strikes by Iran against US-led forces in Iraq.

India has huge stakes in West Asia, ranging from energy supply to an over seven million strong diaspora. "While reviewing the situation in the middle east, Singh and Kono discussed ways to ensure the security of their energy and oil lines flowing through the Persian Gulf.

The two ministers also discussed measures to enhance the bilateral security cooperation under the framework of the India-Japan special strategic and global partnership," said an official.

Singh and Esper, in turn, resolved to strengthen bilateral defence cooperation in line with the two-plus-two dialogue, which is the highest-level institutional mechanism between India and the US to review the bilateral security, defence and strategic partnership, held in Washington last month.

India and the US reiterated their commitment to advancing "a free, open, inclusive, peaceful, and prosperous Indo-Pacific region" during the dialogue, while agreeing to "further deepen" militaryto-military cooperation, including between the Indian Navy and the US Navy fleets under the American Indo-Pacific Command, Central Command and Africa Command.

Title: 8 coaches of Rajya Rani Exp to be reserved for Nashik region
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Nashik: Rajya Rani Express , that will run from Mumbai to Nanded instead of Manmad from Friday, will have as many as eight second sitting coaches and one AC chair car, reserved for travellers from Nashik region in both directions.

The intercity Manmad-Mumbai-Manmad (No. 22101/2) Rajya Rani Express will be renamed as Nanded-Mumbai-Nanded (17611/2) and will start its maiden journey on January 10 from Mumbai.

“The train will begin service after being extended up till Nanded and the railways has taken care to ensure there are coaches reserved for the travellers in Nashik region travelling to and from Mumbai,” a railway official said.

Sources said that when the train leaves Nanded station, the reserved coaches will be locked till the train reaches Manmad. In the return journey from Mumbai, the same numbers of coaches will be reserved only for the people travelling up to Manmad and not beyond.

“It clearly means that the people willing to travel beyond Manmad will have to occupy other coaches and if there were passengers travelling to Nanded in the coach, they could be removed with the help of authorities. Besides while coming to Mumbai, passengers from the region will get ample space,” the official said.

Passengers from Nashik, however, are skeptical about the arrangements and believe that it was likely to create friction between the commuters.

“When the train will leave CSMT it is likely that the passengers travelling beyond Manmad will occupy seats in these coaches and this it will lead to friction. Similar will be the case when the train in heading towards Mumbai,” a passenger said.

“People from other coaches will rush to the coaches that are being opened in Manmad. So by the time the train comes at Nashik Road, the train will be full just in the case of Tapovan Express,” Rajesh Nahar, a regular commuter, said.

Commuters have therefore demanded than three coaches should be reserved for Nashik Road railway station.

Title: PMPML board electric bus fare-hike proposal
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

The board of directors of PMPML rejected a proposal to increase electric bus fares at a meeting on Thursday

PUNE: The board of directors of Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) rejected a proposal to increase electric bus fares at a meeting on Thursday.

“The board didn’t approve the proposal,” a senior PMPML official confirmed to TOI.

Last month, the transport body said it planned to double the fare on-board its 119 e-buses, thanks to a loophole in a government resolution (GR), which allowed levying double rates on air-conditioned buses. “Since the electric buses are air-conditioned, their on-board fare can be increased. The issue is not e-buses, but AC buses,” a PMPML official had said.

The move had sparked dismay among regular passengers, who said the transport body should have been clear about increasing the fares from the onset, rather than claim the fares would be the same as other buses.

The buses were acquired as a part of Phase II of the FAME India scheme, which is aimed at boosting clean mobility in public transportation.

Hemant Rasane, a PMPML director, said board also rejected another proposal — for a team of technicians from Tata Motors to maintain 400 new buses set to arrive this year. “Why do we need a special team to maintain new buses? We thought that the proposal was not quite realistic and turned it down,” Rasane said, adding that the board informed PMPML that, if anything, a special team was needed to maintain the older buses.

Rasane, however, added that they would float a tender for the maintenance of their fleet of midi (mid-sized) buses. “Tata Motors can bid for it. This special team of technicians will take care of the midi bus fleet,” he said.

In December, two PMPML technicians had sustained injuries following an explosion in a midi bus that was under maintenance. All 233 midi buses on PMPML’s fleet were manufactured by Tata Motors. The transport utility then sent one of the buses to Automotive Research Association of India to seek a third-party opinion.

In another development, PMPML will rent 40 buses owned by a body of self-help groups of army widows. “These are around 40 self-help groups, which get grants from the Sainik Welfare Board. All these SHGs have come together and formed a company and bought 40 buses. PMPML has decided to take these buses on a rental basis. The rates they have quoted are less ... PMPML will deploy conductors for these buses, which will be inducted in the fleet after checks by Central Institute of Road Transport and PMPML,” Shankar Pawar, another director, said.

Title: Japan professor proposes water, forest conservation levy on Nagpur
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

NAGPUR: An Indian-origin professor from Japan’s Keio University (KU) on Thursday proposed levying a new water and forest conservation tax on Nagpur city to compensate for the resources people are drawing from rural areas, especially the Pench corridor from where most of the drinking water requirement is fulfilled.

KU professor Rajib Shaw, who is part of a study report submitted to Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) on environmental mitigations under India-Japan bilateral programme, said the model has been successfully implemented in Yokohama and other Japanese metro cities where urban dwellers are paying $10 per household for the last 13 years.

He was speaking to TOI on the sidelines of a round table conference held at VNIT’s Senate hall to conclude the India-Japan bilateral programme.

The professor said since the money comes from people, it is monitored by them too. “It is a transparent system though the prefecture government utilize the funds for conservation. A monitoring committee is part of the system to ensure proper utilization,” he said.

Shaw said that the measures have “made a big difference as the money collected was used for water conservation, tree plantation, groundwater and other such measures”. “The soil condition where the measure were taken has improved. However, during our study and visits to Pench, we found the water level has gone very deep while it was healthy just five years ago,” he said.

The professor from KU’s graduate school of media, governance and policy management said a citizens’ forum having NGO and VNIT experts can ensure proper utilization of the money if such a tax is implemented here.

“In India forests are cut but in Japan the forests are owned by individuals. If I have my own forest, the government can’t cut,” said Shaw.

“53% of forests outside cities are owned by private individuals as a result of the urban funding. We know if we maintain the forest, it will have water for urban dwellers,” said Shaw.

When the water level comes down there is disruption and disaster, according to Shaw. “The impacts can be seen in Nagpur which was forced to supply water on alternate days,” he said.

Title: Harassed on Facebook, 3 girls attempt suicide in Anantapur
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Tirupati: Three girls attempted suicide by consuming overdose of sleeping pills in Anantapur district on Thursday unable to bear the harassment of their Facebook friend from whom they had borrowed money.

The girls were found in a state of unconsciousness at the local bus station in Anantapur. The police shifted them to hospital where they are recovering. The accused Facebook friend was later arrested by the police.

The police said the girls, who are classmates, hail from Dharmavaram town in Anantapur district.

The victims told the police that they had decided to end lives unable to bear the harassment of their Facebook friend, whom they have identified as Mahesh. Incidentally, Mahesh also hails from Dharmavaram.

Dharmavaram police inspector Asrar Basha told TOI that one of the girls, Navya Sri, developed contacts with Mahesh. The girl and Mahesh used to chat on social media quite often.

A few months ago, the girl introduced her friend to Mahesh, who reportedly borrowed Rs 20,000 from him. Later, when she learnt that Mahesh was developing friendship with other girls too, she distanced herself from him. She also blocked him on social networking sites.

After their friendship turned sour, Mahesh demanded his money back from the first girl’s friend. Meanwhile, another girl and a common friend of the first two girls, also came in contact with Mahesh. When the girls expressed their inability to immediately pay him, Mahesh allegedly began harassing them. A couple of days ago, he allegedly spread rumours against the three girls in an attempt to put their character in bad light.

After deciding to end their lives, they bought sleeping pills and reached the bus station in Anantapur. After consuming the pills they became unconscious. Timely intervention of the local police saved their lives. Dharmavaram police registered a case against Mahesh and took him into custody. Further investigation is on.

Title: State to HC: New secretariat estimated to cost Rs 400cr
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Hyderabad: The state government has told the HC that cost of the new secretariat is estimated to be between Rs 300 crore and Rs 400 crore and that its construction may be completed within a year. Special chief secretary (R&B) stated this in an affidavit filed before the court. He filed the affidavit in tune with the direction given by HC while hearing a PIL that challenged the proposed demolition of the existing secretariat buildings. TNN

Title: Vijai Sardesai slams red tape for slow bioremediation work
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

The third dry waste baling machine was inaugurated at Sonsoddo

MARGAO: Fatorda MLA Vijai Sardesai on Thursday expressed his displeasure over the tardy pace of the bioremediation exercise at Sonsoddo and blamed it on the inefficiency of bureaucracy.

“We have five months to go (before the monsoon). One month is already wasted. It’s very unfortunate that a lot of red tapism is going on. Meetings after meetings are being held, but effectively, nothing much is happening,” Sardesai said. He was speaking after inaugurating the third dry waste baling machine at Sonsoddo, Margao’s fifth such machine. CCTV cameras installed at Sonsoddo were also commissioned by Sardesai on Thursday.

While a gate has been installed to regulate access to the site, the work of fencing the area will also begin soon, it was informed. Hoping that unauthorised dumping of waste will now come to an end, Sardesai voiced his suspicion over the existence of a waste disposal ‘racket’ at Sonsoddo by five-star hotels in South Goa.

“There are unanswered questions as to where the waste churned out by all the five-star hotels is going. I think there’s a big racket going on. Hopefully that racket will now stop. Everybody has to keep an eye on this,” Sardesai told reporters.

With the third dry-waste baling machine made operational at Sonsoddo on Thursday, and two more machines already functioning behind the Margao municipality, the Margao Municipal Council (MMC) has succeeded in bringing about a semblance of order in processing the incoming waste generated daily by the city.

MMC’s chief officer Ajit Panchwadkar said that a sixth baling machine will be installed soon. “Our objective is to ensure that the entire dry waste generated in the town is treated the same day,” he said.

Stressing the need for MMC to identify land for temporary storage of residual waste from the bioremediation at Sonsoddo, Sardesai said that the parking lot in the old market could be utilised for the disposal of the inerts, like construction rubble. The bioremediation process of the 2,35,000 tonnes of legacy garbage began in December and is expected to take three years to complete.

Title: Telangana aims to boost air connectivity in state
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Hyderabad: The Telangana government has sought the central government’s help to re-activate old airports as well as establish a chain of greenfield airports and heliports to connect the remote parts of the state

“It would help connect distant districts such as Adilabad and allow easy access to tourist destinations such as Yadadri... we will request the central government’s funding support for creating the infrastructure and request the ministry for necessary approvals,” Telangana IT and industries minister KT Rama Rao said while addressing participants at a curtainraiser for WINGS 2020 at New Delhi. The event will be held at Begumpet airport in the city during March 12-15.

Rao said the state government is working towards making Warangal airport functional as it will boost regional air transport and support the upcoming Kakatiya Mega Textile Park.

“We also intend to open a heliport at Warangal airport on a subsidy basis so that investors and operators find it viable,” he said, adding that a greenfield airport is being planned at Kothagudam that can connect the coal belt, mines and power sector ecosystem around Khammam district and an airport is also proposed at Jakranpally, which will support the upcoming Pharma City NIMZ.

The minister also highlighted the importance of the MRO sector and said it offers a great opportunity for investment and employment creation. Telangana currently has two MROs operated by GMR and Air India.

He also said Telangana is the first state to come up with its own drone policy to develop an ecosystem for the drone/ UAV industry and is engaging with startups and industry partners to pilot use cases of drones in healthcare, agriculture, mining and law enforcement, among others. The state has also envisioned a ‘Telangana Drone City’ to support drone testing, skilling, R&D and commercialisation, he added.

The minister also met heads of several aerospace and defence majors, including GE Aviation’s country head Vikram Rai, Airbus (India & South Asia) president & MD Anand Stanley, Safran India CEO Pierre Dickeli and BAE Systems India MD Nik Khanna, among others. He appraised them about the favourable aerospace and defence ecosystem in the state and urged them to invest in Telangana.

Title: Man held for murdering grandma
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Erode: Grandson of a 79-year-old woman has been arrested on charges of smashing her head with a television set and murdering her in Erode on Thursday.

According to police, S Peer Mohamed, 33, was living with his grandmother Joharammal at Vivekananda Nagar on Chennimalai Road in Erode. Peer Mohamed was a habitual drunkard and would pick quarrels with the elderly woman every day.

On Wednesday night, he came home in a drunk state when Joharammal was asleep. He woke her up and started quarreling with her demanding money from her savings. Joharammal refused and went back to sleep. In a fit of rage, Peer Mohammed lifted the television set and dropped it on her head.

The woman died on the spot. Neighbours who heard the noise rushed and caught Peer Mohammed. They informed police and handed over the man to them. tnn

Title: Metro rakes gear up for trial runs powered by electricity from Friday
Content:
Picture used for representational purpose only

Full-fledged trial runs of the Metro rakes on the elevated corridor between Sant Tukaramnagar and Phugewadi stations will start on Friday

PUNE: Full-fledged trial runs of the Metro rakes on the elevated corridor between Sant Tukaramnagar and Phugewadi stations will start on Friday, with MahaMetro completing the overhead electric traction work.The rakes were so far being pulled by battery operated shunting engines on the 1.4km stretch, which is part of the elevated section of Line 1 of the Pune Metro rail project — between Pimpri and Swargate .The two rakes were installed on the tracks towards the end of December.MahaMetro officials stated that they had energized the overhead catenary system (the cable from which the Metro draws power) on a 25KV, 50hz frequency power supply.A total of 114 electric pole portals had been installed in the section, officials said. “All the necessary tests, including short-circuit tests on the overhead system, were conducted successfully, following which the system was put into operation,” an official said.A MahaMetro official said a traction sub-station had been constructed at Vallabhnagar to supply the required electricity for the Metro project.Two express feeders, each of a 22KV capacity, have been laid from the Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited’s (MSEDCL) Bhosari grid substation to the Vallabhnagar substation, via a switching station. “The express feeders will ensure uninterrupted power supply to the substation,” an official said.Two traction power transformers and 25KV copper cables have been installed at the substation to supply power to the overhead catenary system.MahaMetro said they had published a public notice, as per statutory requirements, regarding the energisation of the overhead traction system in local newspapers. “Notices and danger boards have been installed at the stations, platforms and other important locations to inform people regarding the energisation of the system on the viaduct,” an official said.“We will soon begin the trials and the process for securing necessary approvals from RDSO, CMRS and the Railway board,” said MahaMetro managing director Brijesh Dixit.

Title: ‘Probe role of range forest officers’
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Porvorim: Former PWD minister Ramkrishna Dhavalikar said the state government must investigate the role of the range forest officers, and if found negligent, action should be taken against them. “Forest officials who come from other states don’t go to the forests. They only sit in the office and work. In such a situation, the government needs to be very strict, and those who are responsible for the death of the tigers should be imprisoned,” said Dhavalikar. tnn

Title: Two including trackman die as trains hit them
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Thanjavur: Two people including a 40-year-old railway trackman died after they were hit by a locomotive and a train in separate incidents in Thanjavur on Thursday.

According to Government Railway Police (GRP), the trackman has been identified as Rajaraman, residing at the railway quarters in the city along with his family. The incident took place when he was on his routine work on the tracks between Ayyampettai and Pandaravadai on Trichy-Thanjavur section on Thursday morning. Due to fog, there was poor visibility around the area, police said.

While he was working on the tracks at Melavazhuthur, a locomotive, which was coming his way, hit him as he failed to notice it, police said. He died on the spot. On information, GRP rushed to the spot and conducted an inquiry and sent the body to Ayyampettai government hospital for postmortem.

In another incident, a 45-year-old vegetable vendor died on the spot after he was hit by an express train while he attempted to cross a track near Kumbakonam in Thanjavur.

He has been identified as C Ramesh, a resident of Sundaraperumalkoil village. He was running a vegetable shop at Dharasuram market. While he attempted to cross the tracks on Thanjavur - Mayiladuthurai section near Kudamurutti, the Coimbatore - Mayiladuthurai Jan Shatabdi Express hit him. Kumbakonam GRP rushed to the spot, retrieved the body and sent it to Kumbakonam government hospital for autopsy, sources said.

Title: Delhi: Crime against women up nearly 5%
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

NEW DELHI: More number of crimes against women was reported in the national capital in 2018 compared with the previous year. Delhi Police registered 13,640 cases of crime against women , which was almost 4.7% more than the 2017 figures.

As per NCRB data, as many as 1,215 cases of rape were registered in 2018 compared with 1,168 cases of rape in 2017. Delhi also reported more cases of crime against women per one lakh population in 2018 as compared to other metropolitan cities, with 149.6 cases being registered per lakh population.

Police say that measures like removing dark patches of road and immediate registration of cases on basis of a complaint by a woman have led to the rise in the number of cases reported.

In most of the cases registered in 2018, the accused were either a family member, friend, neighbour or a person known to the victims. Out of the 13,640 cases, 1,215 cases of rape and 11 cases of attempt to rape were reported. Besides this, 3,416 cases of cruelty by husbands or relatives, 3,715 cases of kidnapping of woman, 2,705 cases of outraging the modesty of a woman, 18 cases of women-centric crime on the internet and 153 incidents of dowry death were reported. Investigation in at least 20,940 cases from the previous year is still pending and a case has also been reopened for investigation. The rape of a 20-year-old visually impaired girl at her residence in Central Delhi by her neighbour had sent shock waves in the city. The accused had entered her house on the pretext of asking for sugar. According to NCRB, the crime against girls also saw a rise with 394 more cases reported in 2018 compared with 7,852 the previous year.

In 2018, 8,246 cases were reported out of which 1,839 cases were of Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act (POCSO), 52 murders, 72 of human trafficking and 687 of outraging the modesty of a child under sections of POCSO. In September 2018, a woman had accused a self-styled godman of raping her and molesting her daughter, which was shifted to crime branch.

Title: SRPF cop suffers fatal injuries in road accident
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: An assistant sub-inspector of the State Reserve Police Force (SRPF), Group I, riding a motorcycle was killed after an autorickshaw hit his bike near Jhambulkar Chowk in Wanowrie around 7.15pm on January 4.

The victim Pralhad Sakpal died two days later while undergoing treatment for multiple head injuries at a private hospital. On Wednesday, his son Pranay Sakpal (24) lodged an FIR against an unidentified autorickshaw driver for causing his father’s death due to negligence.

Assistant inspector Bhagwan Kamble from the Wanowrie police station said, “Sakpal drove out of his residence at the SRPF quarters and was travelling on the road leading to Jhambulkar Chowk, when an autorickshaw waiting by the roadside suddenly took a right turn without giving a signal and hit the bike. The impact of the collision was such that Sakpal was critically injured.”

Kamble added, “Passersbye rushed Sakpal to a private hospital in the neighbourhood. However, he was rushed to the Sassoon General Hospital for obtaining treatment for the critical injuries. His family members later shifted him to another private hospital, where he succumbed to injuries while undergoing treatment.”

“We came to known about the accident after receiving a telephone call from the hospital on January 6. We then visited the accident spot, collected information related to the accident and how it occurred from eyewitnesses. No CCTV cameras were found around the location of the accident. We are working on certain clues for establishing the identity of the autorickshaw driver,” he stated.

An offence punishable under the relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code and Motor Vehicles Act has been registered, Kamble stated.

An SRPF official said, “Sakpal was posted at Mahim in Mumbai on bandobast duty. He did not report for duty since December 25. He had returned to Pune for reasons not known to us. We later received information that he was killed in an accident.”

The victim’s son Pranay remained unavailable for comment.

Title: Missing woman case, in which zero FIR was filed, solved
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Hyderabad: The case in which first zero FIR was registered on December 7 last year in the state has been solved. The complaint about a missing woman was lodged at Subedari police station in Warangal. A zero FIR was filed and the case was transferred to Shayampet police station. Police told TOI that after the FIR was registered, the woman contacted her family and informed them about her whereabouts. TNN

Title: Cop clearance certs now with QR codes
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Panaji: Goa police has started issuing police clearance certificates (PCC) with quick response (QR) codes to eliminate instances of duplication or forgery. The issuance of such PCCs began at the North Goa SP’s office this month.

The QR code contains information about applicant, his address and jurisdiction of the police station.

“Details such as the purpose of seeking a PCC and the name of the issuing authority are embedded in the QR code along with the application number. All this information can be easily accessed by scanning the code if the authenticity of the document is required to be ascertained,” DySP Edwin Colaco, who proposed the introduction of the measure, said.

Title: The sherlock of Gujarat ATS
Content:
Himanshu Shukla

AHMEDABAD: The nabbing of an alleged ISIS operative from central Gujarat has yet again brought into focus the role of Gujarat IPS officer Himanshu Shukla, DIG of Gujarat’s anti–terrorism squad (ATS). The 40-year-old officer’s relentless pursuit of those involved in organized crime has earned himself the reputation of a sleuth who means business when it comes to weeding out terror from the state.A BTech degree holder from IIT Kharagpur, Shukla had secured 54th rank in the UPSC and could have become an IAS officer, but he chose to become a cop.Over the years, Shukla has helped pre-empt acts of terror on land and in the sea and is known to have made Gujarat ATS a force to reckon with.Few people know that while serving as ASP Vadodara rural, Shukla had followed the trail of a notorious criminal into UP and was shot in his abdomen during the arrest. Shukla’s pistol jammed and the criminal shot him. He received the police gallantry award for that operation.Fearless and perceptive, Shukla has handled the responsibility of a series of high-profile cases, making it clear that when the Gujarat government needs a Sherlock, it calls Shukla.After Vadodara, Shukla served as assistant superintendent of police in Sabarkantha. Here, he got the chance to work on the Ahmedabad serial blasts case, which brought him instant fame.
