This story is from January 10, 2020

Police with the five accused, in Gudur on Thursday

Title: Erode folk made to wait in queue for hours to collect Pongal gift hampers
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Erode/Tirupur: Ration card holders were made to wait in long queues for hours to collect Pongal gift hampers in many places in Erode on Thursday.

Erode district administration said the state government had allocated Rs 71 crore to provide the Pongal gift hampers to 6.8 lakh card holders. The gift hampers comprise Rs 1,000, 1kg raw rice, 1kg sugar, a 2ft sugarcane, 20g of cashew nuts and kismis each, 5g of cardamom and free dhoti and sari.

The authorities had earlier announced the plans to distribute the gift hampers on Thursday between 9am and 6pm in all the ration shops. However, in many shops, the card holders stood in queues since early morning to collect the same.

While ministers K A Sengottaiyan (school education) and K C Karuppanan (environment) inaugurated the scheme, AIADMK functionaries led the proceedings in shops in their respective areas. In many places they were late, forcing the people to wait in long queues for many hours. For instance, the card holders were standing in the queue since 5am in a ration shop on Karupanna Gounder Street near the Erode MLA office. AIADMK functionary Manoharan, of Periyar Nagar, who was supposed to inaugurate the proceedings, reached there only by 11am, said K Prabhu, of Vasuki Street.

In a few shops, which caters to a large number of ration card holders, AIADMK cadres pitched in to distribute the gift hampers to the beneficiaries. Police protection was given to many shops, where the crowd was more.

In Tirupur, which was allotted Rs 96 crore to distribute the gift hampers to 7.2 lakh card holders, animal husbandry minister K Radhakrishnan had inaugurated the freebie scheme in a ration shop in Udumalpet on Sunday. But it was formally distributed only on Thursday.

Title: Jaipur: No headway in twin murder case
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Two days after the murder of a mother-son duo in Jaipur’s Pratap Nagar area, the police are yet to arrest or e... Read More

JAIPUR: Two days after the murder of a mother-son duo in Jaipur’s Pratap Nagar area , the police are yet to arrest or even detain any suspect. The murdered woman’s husband remains on the police’s radar, but it appears that the cops have found no solid evidence against him.

Two persons were rounded up from Vaishali Nagar area and are being interrogated. However, the officials did not divulge anything. Sources told TOI, the husband, who is also the complainant in this case, is not cooperating much in the investigation. After the woman’s body was found in a bloodied state in her flat on Tuesday, police found her son’s body in a deserted area close to the residential complex where the family lived.

While the husband Rohit Tiwari has neither been officially detained nor arrested, the cops are keeping him under watch at the local police station. The brutal murders of his wife Shweta Tiwari and son Shreyam had sent shock waves across the city.

Rahul Jain, DCP East, Jaipur said, “We are talking to Rohit though obviously he is saying that he has no reason to kill his child. Through CCTV footage, we confirmed that he was at work at the time of the killings. We are looking at all possible leads to solve the case at the earliest.” Tiwari’s family also reached Jaipur on Thursday while the cremation of the murder victims was done in Kanpur by Shweta’s family.

Sources told TOI that Rohit was playing it smart and not cooperating in the investigation and an official on condition of anonymity said, “There are many things which he is not revealing and not cooperating as well. There are many suspicious aspects about his involvement in the murders. Since he is the complainant as well in the case, so we have to be very careful with the investigation.”

Rohit, a native of Delhi and an Indian Oil Corporation employee, had moved to the city two years ago with Shweta, a native of Kanpur. He was at work when their maid found her body in the living room on Tuesday and informed neighbours, who alerted cops.

Shreyam had been missing since then. On Wednesday afternoon, a police search party ultimately found the child’s body in the forest area just over the boundary wall of the residential complex where the family lived. Sources said the body was dumped there on Tuesday itself.

Title: Pune: Focus on fruit flies at research conference
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

PUNE: Scientists participating in the ongoing 5th iteration of the Asia Pacific Drosophila Research Conference in the city underlined the importance of studying Drosophila, colloquially known as fruit fly.

They said the study was relevant to basic understanding of biological processes and provided clues to the cause of several human diseases.

The five-day conference, being held at the Westin in Koregaon Park, will conclude on Friday. Two Nobel laureates — Eric Wieschaus and Michael Rosbash — are among the participants. “The meet focused on ongoing research in a number of fields, including developmental biology, neuro-genetics, immunity and brain function/behavioural biology,” a statement issued by Indian Institute of Science Education and Research (IISER), that has organised the conference, stated.

Title: Former sarpanch held for highway blockade
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

VIJAYAWADA: Cops arrested former Yerrabalem sarpanch Palagani Tatarao, along with another farmer, for allegedly holding the highway blockade at Chinnakakani area on Tuesday. According to police sources, they found CCTV footage and other evidence showing Tatarao and a farmer Dhone Bujji playing a role in organising the blockade, despite prohibitory orders under section 144 of CrPC being in place.

Officials said that they have registered cases against them and are still investigating others who were involved in the blockade causing and traffic and law and order issues.

Farmers in the Amaravati region organised a road blockade demanding that the Andhra Pradesh government drop the move to shift the state capital. TDP chief N Chandrababu Naidu’s son Nara Lokesh had taken part in a one-day hunger strike with party leader Gaddee Rammohan at Vijayawada, and was moving towards the National Highway for the road blockade protest when he was taken into custody.

Cops pointed that advisories were issued against organising and participating in the highway blockade protest that few TDP leaders and farmers called for on that day.

Title: Cybercrime up by 50%, only 28% cases chargesheeted
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

VIJAYAWADA: Andhra Pradesh has witnessed a steady increase in cybercrime according to data released by the National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB). The rate of cybercrime has almost doubled from 2016 to 2018, data shows. The state stands at fifth place in the country in the total number of cybercrime cases.

While fraud is the motive behind majority of the cases, sexual exploitation takes second place in motive for cybercrimes in Andhra Pradesh. There are only three other states in India which have more cases of cybercrimes committed for sexual exploitation. Extortion, personal revenge and anger are found to be the other common motives for cybercrimes in Andhra Pradesh during 2018.

When it comes to other motives, AP had the most number of cases of cyber stalking, second only to Maharashtra. The state also has the second highest number of blackmailing cases in the cyberspace, after Assam .

As many as 12 cases of cybercrimes against children were reported in 2018. Out of the total number of cases, six cases of cyber stalking on children were reported in the state, which was the second highest in the country. In other cybercrimes against children, two cases of blackmailing children in the cyber space were reported and two cases of fake profile were reported. The state tops the list in these two categories.

When it comes to enforcement by police in dealing with the cybercrimes, the police chargesheeted only 27.9 per cent of the total 2,327 cases. The pendency of cybercrimes with the police was found to be 62.6 per cent.

As many as 802 cases have been sent to trial during the year 2018, which also includes cases from previous years. Out of the total cases pending in courts, trial was completed in 52 cases and only ten cases ended with convictions. The conviction rate of cybercrimes in Andhra Pradesh stood at 19.2 per cent and the pendency of cybercrimes with the courts stands at 87.5 per cent, according to NCRB data.

Title: Thorat unwilling to be dist guardian minister
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Kolhapur: The stand taken by revenue minister Balasaheb Thorat that he would not to take charge as district guardian minister of Kolhapur has once again revealed the cracks within Congress and Maha Vikas Aghadi partners.

Thorat, who is also state Congress chief, has expressed his unwillingness to take charge saying that he had made it clear long time back that he would not take responsibility of district guardian minister. Sources in Congress said that Thorat was surprised after chief minister Uddhav Thackeray announced list of district guardian ministers late on Wednesday night.

Thorat is scheduled to meet Thackeray over the issue and would prevail upon him to look for a new guardian minister for Kolhapur district. Congress leaders, however, said the post would remain with Congress at any cost.

Thorat’s appointment assumes significance due to tussle between Congress’s Satej Patil and NCP’s Hasan Mushrif over the post. Both were eager for the post and had exchanged duals overs the issue after formation of Thackeray government.

Patil and Mushrif have been kept away from their home district. Mushrif is guardian minister of Ahmednagar while Patil has been given responsibility of Bhandara. The move has, however, upset workers of both the parties.

Sources in Congress said the post has been given to Congress as it has six MLAs, while NCP has two. According to formula decided by ruling partners, post of guardian minister is to be given to the party which has more MLAs in the district.

NCP has chosen senior leaders to take care of crucial districts in western Maharashtra. Dilip Walse Patil is district guardian minister of Solapur district, where NCP suffered setbacks in the recent past. Balasaheb Patil will be in-charge of Satara district, where party bounced back despite defection of leaders like Udayanraje Bhosale and Shivendraraje Bhosale. Jayant Patil is new district guardian minister of Sangli, his hometown.

In western Maharashtra, Congress has been given charge of only Kolhapur district. Pune and Ahmednagar districts are also with NCP. Ajit Pawar and Hasan Mushrif, will be in-charge of Pune and Ahmednagar districts, respectively.

Title: Greens see red over Godavari river front, beautification work
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Nashik: Environmentalists in the city are opposed to the Godavari river front and beautification project, saying that the work cannot be done in red and blue lines of the river.

The Nashik Municipal Smart City Development Corporation Ltd (NMSCDCL) has undertaken the project at a cost of Rs 68 crore.

“The civic body had developed Goda Park, which has gone under water several times and the project is now almost ruined. Hence, developing the Godavari river front under smart city is nothing but waste of funds,” said Devang Jani, a senior environmentalist.

Jani said that he has sent a letter in this connection to the smart company chairman, Sitaram Kunte, and CEO Prakash Thavil, seeking their attention to his objection to the river beautification project.

The NMSCDCL had earlier planned to remove concrete from the Godavari riverbed to reduce the flood impact.

“Instead of de-concretisation of the riverbed, the smart city company has directly started beautification work on the stretch between Ramwadi bridge and Ahilyabai Holkar bridge,” said Jani.

Nishikant Pagar, another environmentalist, echoed Jani’s views and said that work on blue line cannot be undertaken. “The smart city company is misleading people. For instance, work on the smart road has been under way for two years, whereas the deadline was six months. Besides, the quality of the road is not up to the mark,” he alleged.

There were plans to revive 17 ancient kunds in the river. The NMSCDCL had also started the work last month, but had to halt it following opposition to de-concretisation and revival of the kunds in the riverbed of Godavari by some corporators.

Municipal commissioner Radhakrishna Game said, “Every citizen has the right to oppose in our democracy. However, the Godavari river front and beautification project is to be done as per the norms and considering all the legal aspects.”

Last week, the Bombay high court appointed a special committee to tackle the Godavari pollution and directed the NMSCDCL CEO Thavil to conduct a survey before reviving natural springs in the river.

Objections have been raised against the works undertaken by the NMSCDCL in Goadavari riverbed.

Taking the cognizance of this, divisional commissioner Rajaram Mane, who is the chairman of the special committee on Godavari pollution, had directed the NMSCDCL CEO to submit a detailed report about the works during the committee’s next meeting.

Title: ‘Residual waste safe, can be stored at Margao plots’
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Margao: With a view to ensuring that the bioremediation work at Sonsoddo goes on unhindered, South Goa collector Ajit Roy on Thursday held a meeting with various departments to seek their cooperation in the scientific disposal of all fractions of the byproducts of bioremediation, even as he impressed upon the Goa Waste Management Corporation (GWMC) to go ahead with utilising the two parcels of land identified by the Margao Municipal Council (MMC) for temporary storage of the residual waste.

Speaking to reporters after the meeting, Roy said “There’s absolutely no problem (in using the land). There are high court directions, we have to implement them. The MMC has the right to use the land. Bioremediation is going on and they have to take care of all the fractions. And all the responsible agencies are coming together for this,” Roy said.

The MMC has already identified 5,000 sq m of land at Ravanfond and a private land adjoining the Sonsoddo dump for temporary storage of the residual waste. However, due to objections from certain quarters, the land remained unutilised, hampering the pace of the bioremediation exercise.

“The by products of bioremediation are proven to be safe; and that’s the whole purpose of going in for bioremediation. While the RDF(refuse derived fuel) will be sent to cement factories for the generation of heat, the compost can be used for crops. It has been decided that the inerts will used for filling of land for highway work, a practice widely adopted throughout the country,” Roy said, adding that the Konkan Railway has also been asked to identify projects for which inerts could be used for land-filling.

Sources disclosed that the meeting also discussed identifying more parcels of land for the storage of RDF.

Title: Memories of Lagoo, CID mark beginning of PIFF
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Vetaran actor Vikram Gokhale (left) and director BP Singh (centre) were felicited on Thursday. Actor Shivaji S... Read More

PUNE: When actor Shivaji Satam of CID-fame spoke in honour of his friend BP Singh, who was presented a distinguished award by Pune International Film Festival (PIFF) on Thursday, a member of the audience at Balgandharva Rangmandir yelled out a dialogue familiar to him by now. “Daya, darwaza tod do (Daya, break open the door)!” That’s how Satam, as ACP Pradyuman, often commanded his sidekick.

“No, not today,” Satam responded to peals of laughter from the crowd. He was also joined by his co-stars on the show Dayanand Shetty and Aditya Shrivastava.

Thursday evening was about recognition for long careers. As a tribute, the organizers have dedicated the festival to the late Shreeram Lagoo. During the inaugural function, the organizers also screened a tribute film to Lagoo.

The honoree list for the evening also included veteran actor Vikram Gokhale. “I have received many awards in my career but this award carries some emotional weight. I had a great relationship with Dr Lagoo. I have analysed his work for 40 years and a friendship developed. For so many years, I had discussed with him his performances and his books. I was never afraid of his reaction if I told him that I didn’t like a part of his work. His death was a personal loss to me,” Gokhale said in his address. He dedicated the award to his father the late actor Chandrakant Gokhale .

Title: Kamat tells govt to tackle fund crunch with austerity steps
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Porvorim: Given the economic slowdown and the decline in tax revenue, the state government needs to implement austerity measures and also cut down on unnecessary expenditure, former chief minister Digambar Kamat said here on Thursday.

Speaking at the function to celebrate Legislators’ Day, Kamat also said that MLAs and former MLAs need to discuss ways to improve the state’s finances.

“In such times, people look towards MLAs and former MLAs to bring the state out of a crisis. I feel that it is important for the state that all should be united to see what austerity measures can be taken. Today, it is important to see how unnecessary expenditure can be curbed,” said Kamat.

Kamat said that a global economic slowdown has put India’s and Goa’s economy in a crisis, and it would require a collective effort from not just the government and the MLAs, but former MLAs too to assist the state.

“A lot of the responsibility comes on the MLA, and even if you no longer an MLA, the role played by former MLAs is equally important. If you have been elected even once, you have to play the role of the guardian of society,” said Kamat.

Minister for panchayats Mauvin Godinho disagreed with Kamat about the state of India’s economy, but agreed that all need to work together to help the country and the state develop.

“We are still the fastest growing economy and I still say that India is still performing better than other countries. I am confident that India will become a $5trillion economy by 2026 because our fundamentals are right,” said Godinho.

Kamat also said that all parties, MLAs and former MLAs need to stand united on the Mhadei water diversion issue. “I think it is unanimous that under no circumstance can water from Mhadei be diverted,” the opposition leader said.

The other issues highlighted by Kamat included drugs and prostitution.

Title: Udaipur: Notice to teacher over old holiday message
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

UDAIPUR: A government schoolteacher posted in a remote tribal block of Udaipur district was served show-cause notice by chief district education officer on Thursday for spreading an old message of the collector regarding holidays in schools.

Shivlal Damor, a teacher at the government primary school in Lakhumbara Fala in Jhadol block, posted a letter issued by the collector announcing closure of primary schools due to extreme cold conditions from January 9 to 12.

The letter also announced change of timings for the secondary classes and the new timing was said to be from 10.30 to 3.30 pm with immediate effect.

The letter was posted in the WhatsApp group 'Guruji-2' which had many members including head masters, teachers and staff of several government schools.

The letter created much confusion among the members and some of them who did not verify or carefully read the date mentioned in the letter, believed it to be true and were misled about the holidays.

When the authorities came to know of the post, they found that the collector’s letter was issued in 2019, when the schools were closed down for the same dates.

Title: Don’t make religion a criteria for citizenship: Bengaluru Archbishop
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Bengaluru: The archbishop of Bangalore, Rev Peter Machado, on Thursday urged the Centre to have a dialogue with those opposing the Citizenship (Amendment) Act.

In a memorandum to the President and Prime Minister, the archbishop said: “We appeal to the central government to grant citizenship to illegal immigrants based on each individual case and not on the basis on religion. It is important that the government engages in a dialogue with those opposing the Act.”

Machado said he regretted “the polarization of people” over CAA on religious lines. He said students looking to study are unable to do so due to the current climate at universities in the country.

“In general, we have accepted the Act. We are only asking for a small correction and that is to not make a distinction on the basis of religion. Violence is not a solution when there is a difference of opinion. It is necessary for the government to enter into dialogue with those opposing the Act and come to an agreement about the way forward with justice, equity and fairness. There is no harm in backtracking and changing course if necessary,” he said in the memorandum.

He said the Act “will make it difficult for certain sections of the population to prove their citizenship”. “This includes the poor and women, who have traditionally moved place with marriage.”

Speaking about the participation of students in the protest, he stated that institutions are places where students ‘come to study’.

“I have requested the police commissioner to give minimum security to our institutions, at the outset,” he said. “Most students are reacting not to the Act itself, but to what happened in (other) universities. It is our duty to protect students and ensure they study well. At the same time, students are grown-ups, they have their own wisdom to react in the way they want to.”

Title: City’s maiden ‘smart road’ to get 4 e-toilets
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Nashik: The Nashik Municipal Smart City Development Corporation Ltd ( NMSCDCL ) has decided to set up four e-toilets — two for men and two for women — on the city’s maiden ‘ smart road ’.

The e-toilet structures are being manufactured by a Nashik-based industrial unit and the user will have to pay Re 1 to use it. “The four e-toilets will toilets to be set up on the 1.1-km stretch of the road between Ashok Stambh and Trimbak Road. There will be two toilets each on both the sides of the roads,” said smart city sources, underlining that the facility is being put in place for the convenience of citizens and that they should ensure the toilets are not damaged.

The toilets will made of stainless steel and weigh around 1.5 tonnes. While public toilets are cleaned manually, the e-toilets are maintained automatically. “The toilet has an automatic system flush system. The floor of the toilet is also automatically cleaned after it is used by three people,” said Dhananjay Bele, the manufacturer of the e-toilets. Once the Re 1 coin is inserted, the toilet lights will come on automatically and switch off later once the door is closed after use.

The 1.1km stretch from Ashok Stambh to Trimbakeshwar is being developed as a ‘smart road’ under the smart city project by the NMSCDCL. Concretisation of the stretch has been completed and work at two of three junctions — Meher Point and CBS — has been completed. Work at the third junction at Ashok Stambh is in progress.

Title: Jaipur: Man gets life term for raping blind minor girl
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

Title: VMC dumps plastic, switches over to eco-friendly banners
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Non-plastic flexis at MG road

VIJAYAWADA: The Vijayawada Municipal Corporation (VMC), which imposed a complete ban on single-use plastic, is now focussing on bringing eco-friendly banners. The civic body has erected banners made of polyester fabric replacing PVC vinyl banners. The banners have been erected at 120 prime locations in the city.

The civic body, which focused on improving its ranking in Swachh Survekshan-2020, started a number of campaigns and erected huge banners explaining the eco-friendly initiatives undertaken as a part of Swachh Survekshan-2020. Recently, it replaced the vinyl flex banners with cloth banners made of polyester fabric.

“We have decided to motivate the public in using eco-friendly banners. Printing flex banners is very cheap and readily available, but we have used polyester fabric and eco-friendly ink to print the banners. We procured the cloth and ink from vendors in Chennai vendors. The banners cost around Rs 25 per square foot, but they are very effective,” said VMC commissioner Prasanna Venkatesh.

“The cost of the cloth banners may be high initially, but it will decrease over a period of time when the public starts using them. We appeal citizens to replace vinyl flex banners with eco-friendly cloth banners and colours,” he said.

Title: SCR GM reviews Vijayawada division’s performance
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

VIJAYAWADA: South Central Railway ( SCR ) general manager Gajanan Mallya reviewed Vijayawada railway division’s overall performance , in the city on Thursday.

He began the day with an extensive inspection of the Rayanapadu wagon workshop. Chief workshop manager Birendra Sinku gave a presentation and appraised the GM about the latest initiatives and innovative techniques deployed to reduce the work pressure on staff. The GM advised them to increase the present capacity of handling periodic overhauling of freight wagons from 525 to 700 per month in the workshop.

Mallya also inaugurated 50.7KWP solar plant, electrical substation with a backup of 500 KVA DG set for feeding electrical energy to the body shop and participated in a plantation drive with PHOD’s near the body shop.

GM also inspected basic training centre, new bogie repair bay, the paint shop, the administrative building and inaugurated roof top solar plant. GM also inspected the newly renovated Railway Hospital at Rayanapadu with 25 bed capacity.

Title: Bypolls in 2 civic wards see 34.03% turnout
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Nashik: Byelections in two wards of the Nashik Municipal Corporation held on Thursday recorded a 34.03% turnout. The fate of 14 candidates, who contested from ward 22 (A) and 26 (A), will be decided on Friday when the results will be declared.

Election officials attributed the low voter turnout to possible ‘election fatigue’. “Voters were not so enthusiastic about the bypolls. There were Lok Sabha elections in April-May last year and then state assembly elections in October. Hence, there was little enthusiasm among the people to vote,” said an election official.

The counting of votes will begin on Friday morning at Nashik Road and Satpur divisions. While eight candidates were in the fray in ward 22, six contested ward 26. A total 520 employees were deployed on election duty. Of the 63,045 voters in both civic wards, 21,453 voters exercised their franchise. Of 30,165 voters in ward number 22, as many as 10,388 voters cast their votes recording a turnout of 34.44%. Of the 32,880 voters in ward number 26, only 11,065 voters exercised their franchise and the turnout stood at 34.03% in this civic ward.

Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) has fielded NCP candidate Jagdish Pawar from ward 22 (A) in Nashik division, while Shiv Sena’s Madhukar Jadhav is contesting from ward 26 (A) in Satpur division. In ward number 26 (A), MNS has fielded Dilip Datir while BJP’s Kailas Ahire contested this ward. MVA fielded Madhukar Jadhav from Shiv Sena.

The corporator’s post in ward 22 (A) fell vacant after BJP’s Saroj Ahire resigned and joined NCP to contest the state elections from Deolali assembly constituency. The election in ward 26 (A) was necessitated after Shiv Sena corporator Dilip Datir resigned and joined MNS to contest the Nashik West seat in the assembly elections.

Title: FM: Centre cuts Kerala’s borrowing limit again
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: The Centre has once again cut the borrowing limit of Kerala, thus further smothering the state financially which is reeling under a severe fiscal strain , finance minister T M Thomas Isaac told reporters here on Thursday.

“The Union government, without citing specific reasons, had informed on Wednesday that the borrowing limits of the state has again been reduced. As per the budget estimates, the state was supposed to get Rs 24,915crore loan from the Centre during financial year 2019-20. Of this, the state was eligible for loan worth Rs 10,233crore during the last quarter of the current fiscal. The Union government, by the middle of the current financial year, had informed that the loan limit for the last quarter would be cut by Rs 5,325 crore,” Isaac said.

“But, as per the latest communication that reached us yesterday, the Union government says that Kerala would be eligible for only Rs 1,900crore. This simply means that the Union government has further cut the borrowing limit by Rs 3,000crore. When the state gets the Rs 1,900crore loan, we would need to pay back to Centre Rs 4,615crore by way of the principal and interest towards the loan the state had availed earlier,” he added.

The state government would urge the Centre to revise the unexpected changes in the borrowing limits and issuance of grants.

The state finance minister said that the government would try to manage the deepening financial crisis by resorting to some emergency management tactics, including deferred payment of bills from contractors and suppliers.

The minister, however, said that the twists and turns brought on by the Centre on the state’s finances wouldn’t have any significant impact on the next budget, which is only a few months away. “The government plans to face the current crisis by increasing revenue and curtailing expenses,” he added.

Title: Kerala governor to share insights on ‘Ram Rajya’ in Ayodhya
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

File photo of Kerala governor Arif Mohammad Khan

LUCKNOW: Kerala governor Arif Mohammad Khan and author Tarek Fatah will discuss ‘Ram Rajya’, the rule of Lord Ram in Ayodhya during Treta era, which in Indian ethos is the epitome of good governance.

While Khan will deliver keynote address on ‘Sri Ram: Global Governance Model’ during a programme at Ram Manohar Lohia Avadh University on January 21, Fatah, along with Shia Waqf Board chief Syed Waseem Rizvi, will express their views on the Supreme Court verdict in Ayodhya case.

Khan will speak on steps which other countries can follow to adopt Lord Ram’s governance model and how good governance in countries can help in establishing world peace.

Khan recently hit the headlines for allegedly being heckled and stopped from speaking by historian Irfan Habib during Indian History Congress in Kannur on December 28.

Fatah and Rizvi will share new narratives that emerged after the Ayodhya verdict. Another session on ‘Ramayan’ and ‘Ramlila: A shared heritage of culture and economy’ which will be chaired by director general, Indian Council of Cultural Relations, Akhilesh Mishra.

The event will also see participation of three delegates from Nepal.

Vice-chancellor, RML Avadh University, Prof Manoj Dixit said Ram’s good governance model cuts across religious lines.

The event is being jointly organised by RML Avadh University and India Think Council.

Title: Goa: Lokotsav yet to get permissions, another meeting called today
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Artistes rehearse their upcoming acts for Lokotsav, at Kala Academy on Thursday

PANAJI: With organisers yet to comply with mandatory fire safety and waste management norms, the Corporation of City of Panaji (CCP) refused to grant permissions for the art and culture department’s annual Lokotsav event at Kala Academy in the state capital, said officials. The event begins on Friday evening.

Officials from the art and culture department, CCP and Panaji traffic cell met on Thursday for over an hour and even held a site inspection. After the meeting, CCP refused to issue the permission and asked the organisers to obtain an NOC from the fire and emergency services department.

“Fire compliance is still pending and parking arrangement compliance is pending. Some waste management compliance is also found wanting,” said CCP commissioner Sanjit Rodrigues.

The Lokotsav festival has grown from 200 stalls to 750 stalls this year and there are concerns that the footfalls expected at the venue could lead to traffic jams and affect residents of Campal.

“In principle we have approved the festival. We don’t want to disrupt it, but we cannot disrupt the life of local residents either,” said Rodrigues.

Officials of all three departments will meet on Friday to review the situation after which a final decision will be taken. “We have asked for certain measures to be put in place. The traffic cell is looking into the parking and traffic management aspects,” said Rodrigues.

Panaji traffice cell police inspector Brendon D’Souza spoke to TOI and said that the organisers have been asked to depute 25 traffic wardens and erect barriers along the road to prevent cars and two-wheelers from parking along DB Road.

Title: APERC holds public hearings to finalise tariffs for 2020-21
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

VIJAYAWADA: The Andhra Pradesh Electricity Regulation Commission (APERC) chairman Justice CV Nagarjuna Reddy said that they would take all suggestions and objections received during the public hearing meetings into consideration while finalising the power tariffs for the year 2020-21. The APERC conducted public hearing on the Annual Revenue Return (ARR) and tariff proposals at Thummalapalli Kalalshetram on Thursday.

Earlier, public hearings were held at Visakhapatnam and Eluru. Justice Nagarjuna Reddy observed that there have been some problems in the Indian Telegraph Act 1865 which lacks clarity on the compensation to be paid to the persons who gave their lands for transmission lines.

Justice Nagarjuna Reddy said that they would take up the matter of of paying compensation to the farmers and land owners who gave their lands for the installation of huge towers for transmission lines though the matter do not come under the ambit of APERC. He said he would consider conducting a meeting with all collectors to discuss and find a solution to the problem.

The JMD of AP Transco Chakradhar Babu explained that discoms have to pay Rs 16,000 crore to power producers and presently they were in losses amounting to Rs 29,000 crore. He said the state government took the power sector on top priority and has paid Rs 11,000 crore in the last six months to ensure uninterrupted power supply to all sectors.

Title: Sweeten this Sankranti with Arisalu
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

A woman makes Ariselu at her home, in Vijaywada on Thursday

VIJAYAWADA: With the three-day harvest festival Sankranti approaching, the demand for traditional delicacies is on the rise. Despite massive discounts offered by wholesale traders, citizens say they prefer cooking their favourite festive sweets at home.

Sankranti is among the biggest festivals celebrated in the Andhra region. “Sankranti is a festival of giving thanks. Cooking food at home in large quantities and sharing it with neighbours is an age-old ritual during Sankranti,” said K Lakshmi Devi, a home maker from the city. “We prepare traditional dishes like Arisalu, kobbari burelu, chakralu, gorumittelu, gavvalu. Food is an important part of Sankranti celebrations,” she added.

Sweet stalls and home food centres in the city said the sales were poor this Sankranthi season. “We offer a variety of home foods and traditional sweets at an affordable price, but there is no response from the buyers,” said M Ravi Krishna , who runs a sweet shop in Governorpet.

A few sweet stalls have come up with the idea of ‘live kitchens’ which involves the the buyer in making their own sweets, with the help of an expert cook, at the sweet stall.

Meanwhile, the Vijayawada Municipal Corporation (VMC) says it is looking to celebrate Sankranti on a grand note. VMC commissioner Prasanna Venkatesh said that an inter-school cultural fest would be conducted at Tummalapalli Kalakshetram on January 10. Rangoli and cooking competition for women will be held at Indira Gandhi Municipal Stadium on January 13 and a village-style cultural fest will he conducted on January 15.

Title: 3-day Akshar Sahitya Sammelan held at YCMOU
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Nashik: Nashik-based Yashwantrao Chavan Maharashtra Open University ( YCMOU ) recently organised a three-day festival — Akshar Sahitya Sammelan — in collaboration with Kusumagraj Pratishthan and the varsity’s Chair of Wamandada Kardak.

The festival hosted several programmes and witnessed participation of renowned literary artists from Mumbai, Nagpur, Pune, Nanded, Nadurbar, Aurangabad and other parts of the state.

MLC Hemant Takle was the chief guest of the programme. During the inauguration, Takle appreciated the concept of Akshar Sahitya Sammelan. He said, “Such literary festivals should often take place during the times of cultural pollution.”

The festival included discussions with various literary artists. Renowned Marathi poet Neerja Dhulekar participated in the discussion at the programme and opined that youngsters should take more interest in literature as it is the strongest medium of expression.

Other well-known artists like Ranganath Pathare, Rajan Khan, Satish Tambe and several too participated in the literary festival. Over 120 students took active part in discussion with celebrities and learned about multiple facets of literature.

Students and artists enjoyed the experimental play “Nebula” which was followed by a discussion about art, artists, perspectives and production.

Written by Datta Patil and directed by Sachin Shinde, the one-and-a-half hour play was the biggest attraction of the festival.

“The play is about Claude Monet, a French painter who suffered from cataract. After beign diagnosed with cataract, Monet began looking at objects without edges. He perceived that cataract is a god’s gift to him and decided to not get operated,” Shinde told TOI.

Monet wanted to represent the framelessness of perspectives as people should not perceive things with bias and look at everything without prejudice, Shinde said.

Title: Traffic at Izzatnagar railway underpass to remain suspended for three days
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Bareilly: Traffic police has imposed a three-day restriction on the movement of traffic at the railway underpass near Izzatnagar area here due to the on-going construction work of the IVRI flyover.

According to traffic department officials, the commuters were allowed to use the underpass as the railways had, so far, not taken up the construction work of the flyover above the tracks.

However, with the construction of the railway overbridge (ROB) now being initiated, the traffic will remain suspended from 11am-5pm on January 11, 15 and 17, said officials, suggesting that the commuters going to Delapir could take Kudeshiya Phatak route.

Speaking to TOI, superintendent of police (traffic), Bareilly, Subhash Gangwar said, “Despite the construction of the flyover near the Central Jail trisection in Izzatnagar underway, the traffic movement was allowed partially in the area. Although a major portion of the project was completed by Uttar Pradesh State Bridge Corporation (UPSBC) Ltd, the portion above the railway tracks was yet to be constructed. And since the railways is undertaking the ROB construction, the traffic movement cannot be allowed in the area. The traffic will remain suspended from 11am till the evening on January 11, 15 and 17. Commuters going to Delapir are requested to take another route.”

“Motorists coming from Nainital road will be diverted towards Kudeshiya Phatak to reach Delapir,” added the SP.

The UPSBC had taken up the construction of nearly 700-metre-long flyover in Izzatnagar area around three years ago. The total cost of the project is Rs 38.23 crore, of which the f Bridge Corporation is paying Rs 28.85 crore and the railway’s contribution is around Rs 9.35 crore.

The flyover that will connect Izzatnagar (IVRI) to Nainital road will soon be thrown open to the traffic.

Title: Jaipur: Bizman held for Rs 34 crore Goods and Services Tax evasion
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: The zonal unit of Director General of GST Intelligence (DGGI) has arrested a 69-year-old man for violation of CGST Act by allegedly issuing fake invoices without actual supply of goods to avail Input Tax Credit (ITC) fraudulently. The total value involved in the fake invoices issued by 11 firms operated by accused Subhash Chandra Tyagi is Rs 669.23 crore, involving total ITC of Rs 33.50 crore.

DGGI officials arrested Tyagi on Tuesday evening for the offences committed under Section 132(1)(b),(c),(f) and (l) of the CGST Act, 2017, which are punishable under provisions of Section 132(1), (i) and (iv) read with Section 132 (5) of the CGST Act. The accused has been sent to judicial custody till January 22.

Based on intelligence, an investigation was initiated against Tyagi, proprietor of M/s Shri Sai Trading Company, Jaipur. “He was involved in creation of fake firms and issuing fake invoices without actual supply of goods, resulting in fraudulent availment of ITC on such invoices,” said an officer.

Title: Jaipur: Hubby moves court, accuses police of unfair treatment
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Image used for representational purpose

JAIPUR: The heinous murder case of a 34-year-old woman and her son took a new twist on Thursday when the husband of the deceased woman accused the police of harassing him. He has filed an application in the court of Metropolitan Magistrate number 30 against the cops for not conducting a fair investigation in the matter.

Responding to the application, the court has asked the station house officer (SHO) of Pratap Nagar to appear in the court on Friday with the case diary.

Advoate Deepak Chauhan appearing on behalf of Rohit Tiwari, husband of deceased woman Shweta Tiwari, alleged in a complaint filed in the court that Rohit had lodged an FIR on January 6 on the murder of his wife. “Police has not been investigating the case properly. The preliminary investigation did not brought any concrete evidence or clues still the police are unnecessarily taking the case in a direction where they can put the blame of murder on the deceased’s husband. We have requested the police to do a fair investigation, still nothing much is been done by the police in this regard,” said Chauhan.

The Supreme Court has stated in the case of Sakiri Basu that if the investigation officer does not conduct true and impartial investigation in a case, the complainant may appeal to the concerned magistrate for monitoring by presenting an application before the magistrate concerned.

The complainant says that his “constitutional and fundamental rights are being violated by the actions of the investigating police officer”, thus the court should monitor the investigation of the case. The complainant has requested the court to monitor the investigation and also summon the investigation officer with the case record.

The matter will be heard on Friday after the report is presented from the Pratap Nagar police station. A 35-year-old woman was found murdered at her residential apartment in Jaipur’s Pratap Nagar area on Tuesday. Her two-year-old son was also found murdered a day after on Wednesday.

Title: BJP made Delhi garbage capital: Arvind Kejriwal
Content:
Arvind Kejriwal

NEW DELHI: Accusing BJP of making Delhi the “garbage capital of India” , chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday asked people to choose between the governance model of AAP and that of the municipal corporations being run by the saffron party for the last 15 years. Presenting a detailed report card of the three civic bodies vis-à-vis the performance of his own party’s government in Delhi, Kejriwal alleged that the corporations had failed in all fields, including education, healthcare and sanitation.The CM claimed that Delhi government schools and hospitals were doing far better than those runs by the corporations.“The strength of corporation schools has gone down by 2.5 lakh students in the last nine years. We still see students in around 100 schools sitting on the floor. Delhi government schools have better infrastructure than in private schools, with swimming pools, lifts and sports grounds,” Kejriwal said, while addressing a press conference at AAP’s headquarters.The CM cited a study to claim that 74% of students who had completed Class V from corporation schools couldn’t even read a simple text from their Hindi textbooks. On the other hand, he said, with a 95% pass percentage in Class XII, Delhi government schools had done even better than private schools (93%).Mincing no words on the performance of Delhi Police, Kejriwal said that while the force was capable, it got “orders from the top not to stop violence”. He also alleged that there was a 90% chance that the cops wouldn’t file a complaint in case of an emergency. Anil Mittal, additional PRO, Delhi Police, rubbished the allegations, stating that it was “absolutely incorrect” to say that the cops acted under any pressure whatsoever. “It is also incorrect to suggest that complaints are not registered at police station. In police stations, there is a well-established mechanism to address complainants,” he said.Kejriwal laid special focus on sanitation. “The biggest gift of BJP to Delhi is the waste mountain at Ghazipur, which is expected to cross the height of Taj Mahal,” he said, adding that only 40% of the garbage in Delhi was processed. AAP has promised to make Delhi the cleanest city in the world if re-elected. Kejriwal said nearly 90% of the toilets built by the corporations didn’t have water or power and had no security or maintenance staff. Delhi government’s DUSIB had built and ensured good maintenance of 20,000 community toilets, he added.Alleging large-scale irregularities, Kejriwal claimed that MCD had come to be known as an acronym for “Most Corrupt Department”, adding that even BJP’s Vijay Goel had accepted that the corporations were neck-deep in corruption. “The corporations have been under BJP for 15 years and it has done nothing to eliminate corruption,” Kejriwal said. “Delhi’s municipal corporations are the only local bodies in any major city to have failed to pay salaries to their staff. This despite the fact that Delhi government has increased its allocation to them by Rs 1,322 crore in the last five years — from Rs 3,345 crore in 2013-14 when Congress was in power, to Rs 4,667 crore in 2017-18,” he said.“Most of their dispensaries and hospitals are poorly maintained, with no availability of medicines, missing roof tiles, falling wall plasters, dirty corridors and toilets. In the last three years, the combined health budget of all three corporations has reduced by Rs 97 crore. On the other hand, Delhi government has added 450 new mohalla clinics and 26 polyclinics in the same period. The number of hospital beds has increased from 7,200 to nearly 10,000 and the construction of three new government hospitals is nearing completion,” Kejriwal said. The health budget in Delhi had increased from Rs 3,500 crore to Rs 7,500 crore in the last five years, he said.Referring to BJP’s promise that it would raise subsidy on water and power by five times, Kejriwal said: “BJP should provide it in Haryana and Uttar Pradesh first,” adding that Delhi had already decided to vote for AAP.

Title: 40% off on some APSRTC routes during festival
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Though passengers need to pay an additional 50 per cent over and above the regular ticket prices for the speci... Read More

VIJAYAWADA: The Andhra Pradesh State Road Transport Corporation (APSRTC), which is running around 4,200 special bus services in view of the Sankranti rush, is offering 40 per cent concession on ticket prices in routes where demand is less.

Though passengers need to pay an additional 50 per cent over and above the regular ticket prices for the special services, the demand is mostly for the onward journey, and the buses almost run empty while returning. The buses will run from Hyderabad, Chennai and Bengaluru to various destinations in AP during the Sankranti festival.

Nagendra Prasad, APSRTC’s regional manager for Krishna district , said the demand will be mainly from Hyderabad and other cities to various destinations in the state, and from Andhra Pradesh to Hyderabad and other major cities after the festival. “So we have decided to offer 40 per cent discount to Hyderabad before festival and to various destinations from Hyderabad after the festival,” he said

“We have almost doubled our frequency for the festival. Advance reservation facility has also been opened for passengers planning their travel. The response is huge, as over 60 per cent of seats have already been booked. To ensure that people are not fleeced by private buses during the festival, we have arranged abundant number of buses this year to meet the demand before and after the festival,” Prasad said.

Title: Nagpur: Research will make cochlear implants 50% cheaper says Nitin Gadkari
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

The annual conference of the Association of Otolaryngologists of India was inauguarated at Chitnavis Centre, o... Read More

NAGPUR: Union minister Nitin Gadkari , on Thursday, revealed that the Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) has developed an indigenous multi-electrode cochlear prothesis for the benefit of profoundly deaf people which will cut the cost of cochlear implants surgeries in India by 50%. The existing cost is more than Rs6.50 lakh.

“The DRDO team gave a presentation on the subject two days ago in New Delhi. This Made in India implants will bring a revolution in the field of cochlear implant surgeries and thousands of kids born deaf will be benefited,” he said.

Gadkari was addressing the inaugural function of the 72nd annual conference of the Association of Otolaryngologists of India (AOICON 2020) at Chitnavis Centre. Former chief minister of Madhya Pradesh Shivraj Singh Chouhan was the guest of honour.

About medical devices park project under MSME ministry, Gadkari said, “Medical devices parks will be opened to work on reducing costs of manufacturing goods. MRI machines costing Rs5 crore are being made available in such parks at only Rs98 lakh.”

The national convention of ENT surgeons AOICON will showcase vast expanse of otolaryngology field. Organizing chairman Dr Madan Kapre said that the conference will lay special emphasis on prevention of oral cancers along with advances in management. More than 1,800 delegates from all over India and abroad are attending the conference. Around 480 scientific research papers will be presented.

National president of AOICON Dr Satyaprakash Dubey appealed that Maharashtra Government should start a statewide mission to facilitate cochlear implant surgeries of poor patients on the lines of Madhya Pradesh. Replying to his appeal, Gadkari said that proposal has already been sent to the state government and chief minister will take final decision on it soon.

During the function, AOI felicitated veteran ENT surgeons Dr Krishnakant Bhargava, Dr KP Morwani and Dr Mohan Kameshwaran with lifetime achievement awards.

Title: Spl stamp, coin to mark 100 yrs of LU
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Lucknow: The postal department has agreed in principle to release a stamp to mark the centenary year of Lucknow University. Also, talks are underway with Reserve Bank of India for a special coin as a memorabilia which will also be released this year.

“We have had a word with postal department officials for the release of a special stamp and first-day cover stamp to mark the centenary year. Also, we plan for a special centenary coin for which will we soon request RBI,” said LU spokesperson Sanjay Medhavi.

He said ideas to make the centenary year special by launching various memorabilia, fancy centenary merchandise is being floated by professors, soon LU will announce a few more centenary special things.

A post office, Aadhar card and railway ticket booking facilities will also be made available on the campus soon.

Title: Tiger kills man in Lakhimpur Kheri village
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

BAREILLY: A tiger mauled to death a 50-year-old man in a sugarcane field in Bojra village under Bheera police station of Lakhimpur Kheri district on Thursday. The incident took place nearly 8 km from the forest. The area comes under the buffer zone of Dudhwa Tiger Reserve.

According to officials, Matru Lal (50), son of Chetram, was working in the sugarcane field adjacent to the village, early morning on Thursday, when he was attacked by a tiger. Villagers along with a forest team went searching for him when he did not return home for a long time. They found his partially eaten body in the agricultural field.

Divisional forest officer, Dudhwa Tiger Reserve (buffer areas), Anil Patel said, “I have spoken to the district magistrate of Lakhimpur Kheri to provide a compensation of Rs 5 lakh to the family of the deceased. World Wildlife Fund-India (WWF-India) will also give a compensation of Rs 10,000 at the earliest.”

Man-animal conflicts have been recently reported from different parts of Lakhimpur Kheri district, which has around 100 tigers. On January 1, a 55-year-old farmer, Paragu Bihari, was injured by a tiger at Kaanp Tanda village in Kishanpur Wildlife Sanctuary of Dudhwa Tiger Reserve. The farmer, who received injuries on both hands and right leg, was admitted to a community health centre in Bheera.

On December 30, a tiger killed Lal Bihari (65) and later injured Ramesh Chandra Mishra, 45, at Budheli Nankar village in Hyderabad area of Lakhimpur Kheri district. This village is adjacent to Maheshpur beat of the social forestry region where the presence of multiple big cats has been confirmed by the forest department. The tiger first killed Bihari and later, attacked Mishra.

On December 28, a 21-year-old farmer, Dinesh Kumar, was injured in a tiger attack near Bheera range of Dudhwa Tiger Reserve.

Title: Nagpur: New and old super hit songs enthral
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Representative image


NAGPUR: Old and new hits presented by Unique Star Singers’ Club in musical programme ‘Sargam Naye Purane Geeto Ki’ captivated each and every soul present at Mor Hindi Bhavan in Sitabuldi, on Thursday evening. As many as 34 songs were presented by 23 singers. Anchor, singer and conceptualizer Alpa Talavia wowed the audience with her energetic performances — in anchoring and singing. Talavia introduced each singer and the song by giving a nice background to the number. The programme commenced with ‘Jaa re jaa re udd jaa’ by Bhagyashri Kulkarni followed by ‘Main aur meri awargi’ by Prashant Mankar. Other singles which were well-appreciated by the audience were ‘Deewana mujhsa nahin’ presented by Ajay Deshpande, ‘Aankhon se jo utri hai dil mein’ by Pratibha Kadu and ‘Chandan sa badan’ by Shefali. Other singers who sang were Padmakar Maske, Shrikant Dixit, Yogesh Paranjape, Sanjay Borkar, Ashutosh Chahande, Achal Walde, Piyush Shinde, Rajesh Naik, Kaushik Pujari, Tushar Rangari, Babubhai Patel, Bharat Gajjar, Rajeshwari Gore, Shaila Kachole, Urmila Borkar, Shikha Mahule and Rukmani Kaithwas. Entertaining duets like ‘Bekhudi mein sanam’ from the movie ‘Haseena Maan Jayegi’ presented by Talavia and Maske, ‘Tauba tumhare yeh ishaare’ a romantic hit ‘Chalte Chalte’ by Kulkarni and Paranjape, ‘Kisi raah mein kisi mod par’ from ‘Mere Hamsafar’ by Gajjar and Talavia enthralled. ‘Jaane kaise kab kahan’ another superhit song from ‘Shakti’ was sung by Shefali and Chahande while ‘Parbat ke iss pair’ from ‘Sargam’ was presented by Talavia and Borkar. Title: Cop books CAA protesters for sedition in Jharkhand, gets notice
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

RANCHI: The Dhanbad police issued on Thursday a showcause notice to a sub-inspector for filing a sedition case against 3,000 people for participating in an anti-CAA protest on Tuesday. The move comes after Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren took to social media and asked the police to withdraw the case and initiate action against the policeman who had filed the case.

Dhanbad SP R Ramkumar said, "We have initiated the process to withdraw the sedition charge. The matter is now in court and the process of withdrawal of the sedition charge will be carried out soon. We have issued a show-cause notice to the subinspector, posted at Dhanbad city police station. He was in charge of the thana when the procession was taken out and he was the one who signed the FIR against the protesters.

Based on the reply filed by the officer concerned, further action will be taken by the senior SP of Dhanbad." Sub-inspector Santosh Kumar had filed the FIR against the protesters, charging them with sedition and under other sections of the IPC pertaining to unlawful assembly , preventing a public servant from performing his duty, creating public nuisance and attempting to spread disharmony among religious groups.

Following the CM's tweet, Ramkumar sent an official communication on Wednesday to the senior inspector of Dhanbad police station to withdraw the charge.

Title: NABL accreditation for chemical examiner’s labs
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Two forensic laboratories under the home department —the regional chemical examiner ’s laboratories of Ernakulam and Kozhikode— have received NABL accreditation . The recognition is for maintaining the ISO/IEC 17025:2017 standards in these laboratories.

Experts from Quality Council of India had inspected these laboratories. Of the 90 such laboratories in the country only ten labs have received this accreditation. tnn

Title: Sensex shoots up 635 points
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Mumbai: Markets across the world rallied on Thursday as there were signs of some easing of tension between the US and Iran, which also led to softening of crude oil and gold prices. As a result, the sensex rallied 635 points, or 1.6% to close at 41,452, while the Nifty gained 191 points, also 1.6%, to close at 12,216. The rupee strengthened by 49 paise to close at 71.22 per dollar, from 71.71 on Wednesday. The rising rupee, however, led to some selling in the stocks of software exporters.

Motilal Oswal Financial Services head (retail research) Siddhartha Khemka said market sentiments have revived as oil prices cooled down due to no further escalations in the Middle East. “The US has offered to impose sanctions on Iran instead of military action. On the domestic front, the government has eased laws to fast-track mining at sites and also imposed import duty on copper wire rods,” he wrote in a note.

Title: Lucknow Municipal Corporation scores poorly in garbage management: Survey
Content:
Lucknow Municipal Corporation

LUCKNOW: The performance of Lucknow Municipal Corporation in garbage disposal for the April-September period has been poor, an assessment report by the Swachh Bharat Mission (SBM) survey showed.The assessments of two quarters—April-June and July-September—were added for a final result. While Lucknow overall got an encouraging 16th rank out of a total of 425 cities, it scored poorly in several aspects. The survey was conducted by a body hired by the ministry of housing and urban affairs (MOHUA). The city’s total score was 1,389.5 (75%) out of 1,836.5. However, LMC scored 156 (42%) marks out of 365 in garbage management. The score is significant because annual swachh survey begins on January 20.As per MOHUA data, LMC got 42 out of 100 marks in door to door garbage collection. This means that over 2.7L city households (45%) are still not covered under daily garbage collection. LMC has performed miserably with 18 out of 50 in sweeping and garbage management of markets and commercial places. In segregation of dry and wet waste, Lucknow scored 43 out of 125.In the ‘reduce, reuse and recycle’ category, city has got 18 out of 50. Only encouraging performance was in category ‘garbage collection from open spaces’, where city got 35 out of 40.Under plastic ban, the city got 13 marks out of 30. LMC has scored well for coverage of sewage system with 80/80 marks, ample sewage treatment plants with 50/50 and open defecation-free status with 40/40.Official in charge of SBM 2020 Arvind Rao said, “We are focusing on parameters where we have scored low. Improvements have been made and we are expecting good results.”

Title: Pilibhit: Teething problems in online transfer system holds back paddy payments
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

With farmers going unpaid for over a month after the 72-hour deadline, the district vice-president of Bhartiya... Read More

PILIBHIT: Resentment is brewing among farmers in Pilibhit over arrears in payment for paddy crop worth Rs 71.38 crore, which accumulated due to the launch of a new central government system, of transferring payment for procured paddy to bank accounts of the respective farmers. With farmers going unpaid for over a month after the 72-hour deadline, the district vice-president of Bhartiya Kisan Union (BKU), Manjit Singh, has sent a letter to chief minister Yogi Adityanath, demanding he expedite the payment so that farmers can invest in their next crop, which would be wheat, mustard or lentils.

He also warned that farmers would be compelled to agitate if their arrears were not cleared within a week.

Singh said of the eight agencies deployed by the government to purchase paddy in Pilibhit, barring the state food department, all seven were initially transferring payments via RTGS (Real Time Gross Settlement), but after a government order dated December 23, they began transferring to farmers’ bank accounts via the Union government’s public financial management system (PFMS), which had already been adopted by the food department.

“The new system is sluggish due to multiple complications related to verification of farmers’ particulars. As a result, the outcome is huge arrears in paddy payments, leaving farmers in a liquidity crisis ahead of the Rabi crop season,” Singh said.

District food and marketing officer, Avinash Jha, said, “PFMS is a Union government financial portal to which all bank accounts across the country have been fed. After procuring paddy from a farmer, the transaction is locked online by the procurement center in-charge with his digital signature. Thereafter, the district food and marketing officer and the regional accounts officer has to independently verify the particulars of each farmer filed with his bank account, including land ownership revenue documents and registration with government website for paddy sale. Only then are details uploaded by the regional accounts officer on the PFMS for payment.”

“Payment is transferred to farmers’ bank accounts only after all their details match with those fed to PFMS. There are a lot of teething issues such as mismatch of spellings of farmers’ names, his status as first holder of bank account or incongruity in land ownership documents, which is delaying payment,” Jha said.

The Union government’s objective behind introducing PFMS from this season was to wipe out manipulations in payment transfer process, which had frequently been reported during the previous years, he explained.

He added that till January 8, the district had procured 3.70 lakh metric tonnes of paddy, valued at Rs 680.13 crore, of which the backlog of payment is around Rs 71.38 crore.

Some affected farmers, including Lakhwinder Singh of village Naurangabad , Gurpinder Singh of village Khamaria Patti, Ramesh Singh of village Dudhia Khurd and Om Prakash of village Tanda Chhatrapati, all under Puranpur tehsil, told TOI that their payment was held up since last week of November.

Title: Burglars decamp with goods worth R1.20L
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Unidentified men broke into a house located opposite Ganesh temple on Gangapur road in Madilge village of Bhudargad taluka and decamped with valuables worth 1.20 lakh on Wednesday.

According to Bhudargad police, the complainant — identified as Vinayak Satappa Kumbhar — had gone out of town when his house was targeted in broad daylight.

“The suspects entered the house through the roof. We are gathering information about the incident and will soon nab the suspects involved in the crime ,” an officer from Bhudargad police station said.

Man loses Rs 40,000 at ATM kiosk

Taking help from a stranger to withdraw cash from an automated teller machine (ATM) cost a man dear as he lost Rs 40,000 from his bank account.

The complainant had gone to withdraw cash from an ATM in Central Bus Stand area where he was assisted by person standing behind him. The suspect somehow managed to exchange the debit card of the complainant, Parsharam Kamble, with another card following which he easily withdrew the money. Kamble later lodged a complaint with Shahupuri police station.

Title: ABVP stages stir against JNU violence
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

(From left) Shatrughan Sinha, Prithviraj Chavan and Yashwant Sinha attend the Gandhi Shanti Yatra that reached... Read More

PUNE: ABVP activists on Thursday staged demonstrations near four educational institutions to protest the recent violence at Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) and approached the city police against what they claimed defamation of their union by rival student groups opposing the incident.

The Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) members also took a dig at the Nationalist Congress Party ’s (NCP) student wing for the blackening of the board of the former’s office in Sadashiv Peth on Tuesday.

Around 40 ABVP members gathered near SP College to stage the protest, from where they proceeded to PVG’s College of Engineering, Modern College of Arts Science and Commerce on Ganeshkhind Road and finally near the Savitribai Phule Pune University ’s (SPPU) main gate.

They carried banners with messages such as #StopRedTerrorInJNU, #OpposeRedTerror and “JNU must be saved from fanatic violent left”. ABVP city secretary Anil Thombre said, “We should be careful on campuses and try to keep a tab on people brainwashing the students towards ideologies supporting Naxalism and Maoism.”

Shambhavi Sale, a second year BA-LLB student of Modern College of Arts, Science & Commerce, said, “Over 20 students supporting the ABVP were injured in the violence at JNU on Sunday night. Many of those students are still recuperating at AAIMS. I also want to tell the NCP supporters that the ideological tussle is between us and the left wing groups. I fail to understand why the NCP’s student wing is getting into it.”

The ABVP members on Wednesday night submitted a complaint application to the Deccan Gymkhana police station, claiming that their union was defamed during the protest marches carried out by the students of Fergusson College, Film and Television Institute of India (FTII) and SPPU and other youth groups.

Senior inspector of Deccan Gymkhana police Deepak Lagad said, “We have accepted the complaint application for further investigation.”

The ABVP’s complaint letter stated that many groups active on the social media were defaming the union by blaming its activists for the attack on the JNU students and teachers. An ABVP activist said the union would not tolerate action such as blackening of its office board.

“It is difficult to stop social media posts offending any organization. We would like to appeal to the people to not spread rumours,” a police officer said.

Title: Miscreants fish with gelatin bombs in Pale-Usgao
Content:
This story is from January 10, 2020

Bicholim: Villagers from Pale and Usgao, Bicholim, have raised concerns over the killing of fish using gelatin bombs in the Pale-Usgao river.

Locals have complained that unidentified persons have been detonating gelatin sticks in the Pale-Usgao river and surrounding rivulets, consequently destroying different species of fish, besides damaging the river banks and houses located near the river.

They believe the gelatin bombs are made in Usgao, Pale, Vaghurme, Vagus and surrounding areas.

“This type of fishing is banned and unethical. There are large numbers of blasts being perpetrated in broad daylight, by unknown persons, as a result of which different types of species of aquatic life in the river are killed. It also damages the river banks,” said Prakash Naik from Usgao.

Dinesh Volvoikar from Pale told TOI that the government was not initiating any action, despite the blasts being set off during the day.

“We demand that the authorities, especially the marine police, investigate the matter and take stern action against the guilty,” he said.
